Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, rooms a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: businss_travell3r
Reviews.Content: Travelled here on business, and location was unmatched. Rooms however were a disappointment for what is billed as a 4/5 star hotel. Deluxe room felt rather shabby and carpet quite questionable (especially since no slippers provided). Sheets and towels clean but everything else rather grimy. Next room was a suite, and a much better experience. More room of course, and a nicer bathroom with separate shower and tub. Nice aspect onto the side of the Louvre courtyard also. All in all, if I had to return, would insist on the suite. Other rooms are not of an acceptable standard for business travel. Internet, thankfully, is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: I didnt expected much as the critics were quite mixed... The bedroom & bathroom were clean and decorations nice. The staff was very helpful & friendly, concierge restaurant recommendation was exact. Excellent location and walking distance to many many Paris attractions. There are at least 4 Metro stations around the hotel that made it for an easy access to trains. I would recommend this hotel and consider staying at next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and First Rate Staff”
Reviews.Author: Geezers_on_the_Go
Reviews.Content: We concluded our trip to France with a stay at Hotel du Louvre. I was a little hesitant at the cost, but the location made it well worth it. From our check-in, the stay was great. Unfortunately the room was not available (they had upgraded us - thank you very much) so they escorted us to the bar and hosted us to drinks and snacks until the room was ready. When ready they came to get us - escorted us to the room -- and we found that our luggage had been delivered. We were on the 4th floor, a corner room, overlooking the plaza, the Louvre, and the Palis Royal. Three great French doors with a fourth in the bath provided great breezes. You could literally watch folks tour the galleries of the Louvre from the South windows (100 feet away across the street). The only drawback was the noise from the plaza, but after the first night we learned how to adjust the doors for great airflow. The Concierge service was outstanding from reservations for diner to arranging a taxi to the airport - always able to assist. I'd recommend the hotel to any traveller who wants to be within walking distance of the center of the city and also close to the metro (in the plaza).

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: leazo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weekend in December 2011 for my boyfriends birthday. We had free flights so only required a hotel and this was the best option. They had a fantastic deal with Last minute and it couldn't have been a better location. The hotel is beautiful and the staff can't do enough for you. The hotel room is slightly smaller than we are used to but the bathroom was a good size. The hotel is immaculate and has some great little cafes and restaurants around it. The location is perfect, only a few minutes away from the tube station and right next to the Louvre. I can't rate this hotel highly enough and would most definitely stay here again if I was to return. This a must stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Bentle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite expensive, but I think all hotels are expensive. The beds are extremely comfortable and the location is amazing. I stayed here 2 nights, I'm headed back to the states today. The full breakfast was pretty good. You should try to negotiate this in with your room charge, very expensive, otherwise. The staff is very accommodating. Metro station right outside of the hotel restaurant which My son & I took most places. Taxi's are very expensive in Paris, but I did use them several times. The fare is $60 euros from the CDG airport. There are several transportation options from the airport, but if you have a larger bag it would not be very easy to use the train. There is a bus shuttle option available, but I did not research. I have been to Paris twice now and out of the two hotels, I would highly recommend this hotel and location. Right across the street from the Louvre. Buy a ticket from the concierge for $12 euros to skip the long lines. My son and I went right in!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect from a 5 Star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: geronimo1049
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel du Louvre for a long weekend with some business friends. It is in an ideal location right in the centre of Paris, and it also close to the Louvre Gallery, Museum, and Opera. It exude's class and quality but still manages to remain unpretentious. If you are able to book well in advance, and you are flexible in your requirements look out for special offers on the suites, you can save considerably if you are able to take advantage of one these deals. The rooms are decorated tastefully and are very spacious, and the staff are helpful and efficient. We also found the food in the restaurant delicious although the beef was too rare for one of our party but this was returned to the kitchen and came back perfect. Obviously there is a price to be paid for this opulence but if you want to stay in one of the best hotels in Paris then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, and the staff were amazingly helpful. Almost everyone spoke english which was also very helpful. The room was a bit smaller than I had anticipated, but there is so much to see and do in Paris, you dont spend much time in your room. Food in the restaurant was also very delicious and buffet breakfast was awesome! Almost every breakfast food you can think of (except I dont think I seen any vegimite?) hehe.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Daniel F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel all over the world and have stayed in the finest hotels where ever we go. When we come "back" to Paris, we consider the Hotel du Louvre home. We've stayed there at least 5 times and have never had a bad experience. The rooms are small but offer enough space for our needs; the bathrooms have been modernized and are wonderful. The continental breakfast buffet is wonderful and the small, cozy hotel bar is a great place for a late afternoon or evening cocktail. Will be going back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 8 days in November, 2011. I don't know how you could beat this location...unless you actually sleep in the Louvre itself, perhaps. There are more expensive hotels in Paris that have terrible locations! Too far from everything. But not this place. Our room faced the Louvre and you could actually look in and see beautiful sculptures. And the room was completely soundproof...we faced the Rue de Rivoli. But the best part of this hotel is the staff. I want to adopt them all!!! Seriously, this hotel staff should be cloned and placed in hotels all over the world!! What a bunch of sweet hearts...all of them from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff to the reservations people...all of them were totally professional, extremely helpful, friendly, pleasant, intelligent and they smiled whenever they spoke to you. And if you needed something you got it immediately. They really helped make it a fantastic vacation. It was my first trip to France and I just want to throw in that the Parisians are fabulous. The only rude person I encountered on the entire trip was an American (and I'm an American). The French have not lost their old fashioned (and wonderful) manners, dignity or humanity. People of France...you are the best!!! Thank you for one of the best vacations of my entire life!!!!! Love ya!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: minnesotans4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked this hotel due to the wonderful location. It is within walking distance of all the major museums and cathedrals in Paris. The hotel is across the street from the Louvre. We were in room 283 which faced a small courtyard. The windows were well insulated and we didn't hear the noise. We could hear the rumble of the metro at times which wasn't loud enough to bother. The beds were very comfortable. Bring your own conditioner since they don't supply any. The bathrooms had terry bathrobes. The room is not spacious but is manageable. There is free WIFI which is great. It is expensive but the location makes up for it. We took the airport Roissy bus to the Opera which was 10 euros. It is about a 10 minute walk from the drop off point.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Buck M
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend away in the beginning of December. The staff were all great (especially at Breakfast), as were the staff at reception. When we got to the hotel late Friday night I was disappointed that our room was looking into the court yard. I made request to be moved to a room with a view. The next day they changed our room and had an a fantastic room!

Reviews.Title: “satisfied customers”
Reviews.Author: karran10rodes
Reviews.Content: We can recommend this hotel. Very clean and nice, close to attractions, the staff very friendly. Traffic outside the hotel was busy but you heard nothing of it in the room, very well insulated. Can also recommend eating in the restaurant. We were very pleased with this hotel and if we return to Paris we will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Cynthia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three wonderful nights at the Hotel du Louvre. This was our second stay at this hotel, the first being 10 years ago. We've been back to Paris a dozen times since, but had not gone back to the Hotel du Louvre again until now. We're glad we returned! As it is February, we got a fantastic deal on the room. Perfectly located in the heart of Paris, and literally 10m from the Metro, Hotel du Louvre is convenient to everything you want to see and do. The valet service at 35€/day is quick, easy, and not really more than what it costs to self park. The staff are very welcoming. The concierge booked several meals for us and the desk, brasserie, and bar staff were as nice as could be. The room was small but very well appointed. The bathroom was, by contrast huge! We had a 2nd floor room facing the Opera. There was a little traffic noise (horns) in the mornings but nothing too disturbing. Breakfast was not a bad deal at 19€. It was a very good buffet. Dinner was exceptional and the by the glass wine list was truly outstanding. The hotel offers free wifi with a good signal. We connected easily from the room, lounge, and outside patio. We were even given a 30€/day hotel credit for use in the lounge or restaurant. If I have one complaint it would be that the prices in the lounge seemed a bit high. Great quality drinks, but I think the brasserie's prices/selection were better. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: barriefolks
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location but did not fully realize what a great find it was until we emerged from the Metro station located directly behind the hotel. Unsure where to go from that point my daughter & I simply walked around the corner and found the front door. From the moment we stood on the sidewalk outside of the Hôtel du Louvre the staff took control and relieved us of our luggage, allowed us to check in early and asked if there was anything they could do for us or help us with. Any stress we had been feeling to this point dissolved. Our room was a decent size, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was well stocked, even supplying wash cloths. I feel a little silly saying this but I found the quality of the toilet tissue is the same that I would purchase for myself at home. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels and have found that they cut corners in this area. We had no view to speak of but considering all of the other plusses this was not a big deal for us. The one thing I missed in the room was a clock. There was one imbedded in the television but unless the master light switch was on it could not been read. Fortunately my daughter travelled with her ipod so we were able to use it for an alarm as well as a clock. The staff in the attached restaurant are also very friendly, our waitress from lunch stopped by our table at breakfast the next day to enquire about our holiday. The food is of decent quality however I found drinks to be very pricey. My daughter ordered water & ice tea and it cost somewhere in the neighborhood of 13 euro. The hotel is very convenient to the metro, the Louvre and lots of restaurants & shopping. Overall I feel the price we paid for the service & quality we received was deserved. Would definitely stay and recommend this hotel to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The food is delicious. The location is perfect. Smack dab in the middle of everything you want to see in Paris. Beautiful setting. Located right next to the Louvre. very nice staff. The cost is pretty high for what you get, but otherwise, it's a real nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and excellent service! The friendly and professional staff from the front desk, concierge and room service, to the weighters at the bar and restaurant, made our stay very pleasant. However, I should mention that we were lucky to receive an upgrade to a juniour suite - this certainly contributed to the overall very positive memories from Hotel du Louvre. We will most certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel for our stay”
Reviews.Author: geeLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: paris may be perfect for lovers, but it was the perfect trip for mom and two daughters celebrating 16th and 21st birthdays. from our incredably perfect triple room with windows that opened to view the boulevard toward the Opera, to the perfect coffee served at the best buffet breakfast in Paris, we were perfectly located to chose a direction and spend the day walking and discovering the different neighborhoods of the city. Other than the train trip to Versailles, we walked everywhere and ended our evenings watching the glittering Eiffel Tower for a few minutes before walking past the Louvre Pyramid toward our hotel. It was truly a special trip. I was unable to book a room here when visiting Paris last spring, and really did miss the location and the breakfast. I look forward to returning to the Hotel du Louvre on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: svalkenborg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located near THE Louvre. All shopping areas and museums are in walking distance. The hotel has a known status in Paris and mostly visited by tourists. Check in went very smooth and very kind. I have been advised by friends to have a room overlooking the 'Louvre des Antiquaires'. This side of the hotel is less noisy as the hotel is located in a busy area with lots of traffic. Another option would be to ask for a room at floor 4 minimum. The rooms are very 'French' and all comfort is available. Although the bathroom looked quite standard and doesn't match the ambiance of the room. Turndown service is ok, but they forgot to check the bathroom. Staff in the corridor is very kind and greets every guest who passes. The (female)concierge on the other hand was not the kindest person in the Hotel and i never have been greeted by her. The breakfast is 'buffet' and all product were available. Although a personal touch is missing there. I enjoyed my stay at The Louvre Hotel and would recommend this hotel for business and pleasure purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Old, small room with no view”
Reviews.Author: nleow
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. It is true, it has an excellent location, right next to a Metro stop and within easy walking distance to the Opera, Comedie Francaise and of course the Louvre. My husband and I were greeted by friendly staff at the front desk, however we were much more disappointed by the room that we were allocated. It was very small (even for 2 people), old and faced the internal "courtyard" of the hotel. Despite the hotel advertising that it has exceptional views of multiple attractions, both our party and another party we were travelling with had the same type of room. Additionally, there was absolutely no sound cushioning. We could hear every footstep in the hallway outside (including the maid's trolley) and of course, I am sure every person could hear what goes on inside the room too. Good luck if you want to have a romantic weekend away! The room is so small that we could not even open the wardrobe door to its full extent, and the safe was quite inaccessible at the base of the wardrobe. The mini bar was small and had the remnants of the previous person's chocolate that they had obviously stored in the refrigerator. The buffet breakfast was included in our stay and this was located in the restaurant. The variety was fine. I was told to find myself a seat upon arrival and had to request coffee three times before, finally at the end of my breakfast, I received it (after asking the person at the front of the restaurant). We stayed for only 2 nights and honestly, the hotel was not full. I would have thought that they would try and at least allocate rooms in the hotel that had a better view for their guests. Unfortunately, I would not recommend this hotel unless you are prepared to pay high prices for location only.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: DAWiles
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel du Louvre whenever I am in Paris. The quality of the staff, the rooms, the restaurant, and the location cannot be beat. I have stayed there yearly for 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: CoolPilot
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location for tourists- Louvre is just 1 minutes walk and seen from windows. Near the entrance is a tour bus stop (hop on hop off). So spending 5 days learning the historical centre of Paris we almost did not use transport. Shops are not far as well. Building is rather old and need renovation, there is a little smell of dust and the old air, however it worst to stay here. Breakfast was good, even quite expensive. We got a lot of advises from reception ladies regarding better time to visit museums and other tourists places.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaDmonteiros
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Louvre has an excellent location, adjacent to metro, to the Louvre Museum, to the Opera, Galeries Lafayette and Printemps. In short close to everything! Hotel staff is very good, especially Josie, MAGALI who speaks Portuguese and is very attentive, Christine and Stefano, very gentle and polite! Thank you! Adriana e Abrahão, from Londrina Paraná. Brazil!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights. The room was pretty small and the AC did not work correctly. However the great staff, the excellent beds and the location make you forget this. The rooms are extremly clean. A better location is almost impossible to find, 1 min from the Louvre, 10 min walking distance from Opera, 15 from Notre Dame and les Champs Elysees. We also appreciated the small gym and the fact that small dogs are allowed without supplement. All in all it was a very good experience and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: 77Mako
Reviews.Content: Incredible location if you want to explore Paris! We stayed for three nights and we could not be more pleased with the room, staff and breakfast. The room was larger than expected and must have been recently remodeled. Conveniently located for the subway, museums and relaxing walks around this section of Paris. I would not hesitate to return to this property. We did not get a view of the opera house but that did not diminish the stay at all (we will ask for the view upon our return). A visit to the bar at the end of your evening is a great way to wind down before retiring. Nice mix of Europeans and Americans in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mloborec
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Louvre is a fine old building, the exterior blends with all surrounding buildings and is situated in front of the Louvre - The staff are friendly and very helpful, they also do an exceptional job with what they are given to work with - the rooms are like the exterior -old, unfortunately old carpets, creaking floors, very drab decore and plumbing that I am sure was installed in the middle ages do not make a comfortable room...it looked like they were starting to renovate which would be an excellent idea because at the moment staff, location, location is the only thing good about it. Sleeping was difficult, the window could not close properly - wind would blow open through the night, you could hear people walking past your room because of the creaking floors, shower next door etc.The Louvre is central...everything you could want or need is in walking distance or walking distance to the subway/bus terminal. ..An excellent place to drop off your luggage and explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves 3 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Philie4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights, for business in this hotel. The floor wasn't really clean, there was 1 cm of dust along one of the walls, glasses weren't changed. Staff at the reception were nice but they were rude at the conciergerie. I requested for them to find me a phone number concerning rats that saw in an outside of the hotel restaurant and they just rudelly told me that it was normal in Paris, and that there were some in the hotel. The bed was really confortable though! The restaurant is ok for breakfast but poor for dinner (service is long, food is average). I would not recommend this hotel. I would rate it 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jro_11
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say. Two things make this hotel great. First, the staff is very, very friendly and helpful. They arranged an english speaking driver to meet at the airport and bring me to the hotel (the Driver Dany was exceptional -- on time, professional and very polite). In addition, after my long trip the hotel arranged an in-room massage for me. Again, a very professional therapist. The second thing that makes this hotel nice is the great location, it is close to everything. You can't beat it. Unfortunately, the hotel itself needs some work. It is loud (housekeeping staff is very noisy) and the rooms are tired. I literally had black water run from the shower (gross). In addition, my room had hair on the towels. Even tough everyone was very nice, I will not be back to this property. I recommend the Westin or the Ritz (still a great location, nice people and much cleaner) Sorry Hotel du Louve.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and at our service”
Reviews.Author: schultzemily03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over the New Years period. From the moment we arrived to the hotel the staff were more than helpful. They were able to book us train tickets, shows and great restaurants. Everyone spoke English. The room we had was big and beautiful. Everything was clean and classy. We would def stay here again. Great location next to the Louvre and you can walk to most places. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful to place to stay when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ktomichi
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Paris this year for Christmas. When looking for a hotel I wanted one that was centrally located and the Hotel du Louvre Paris fit our needs. Once we got to the room we were extremely satisfied with it. The hotel staff answered all our questions with extreme politeness and patience. (they had to have answered these same questions a hundred times over but they always acted like it was a pleasure to help us.) If I ever get back to Paris I will definitely book my room here. I will recommend it to anyone who asks if I know a good place to stay in Paris. Before I left on this trip I had so many people tell me not to expect too much from the French people because they hate Americans. Well, I can honestly say that not only did the hotel staff make us feel at home but while we were out and about touring the city, we did not meet one person who made us feel unwelcome. If I could rate this hotel a 10 than I would, but I wasn't given this option. Don't pass up this treasure when looking for a place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Classic first class, comfort and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Culturetraveller_11
Reviews.Content: As the first big and modern hotel in Paris, Le Louvre is still going strong as a good first class hotel and keeps a historic atmosphere run by excellent service with a friendly attitude. Have stayed for serveral times around Christmas the last years, for several days in de luxe rooms and junior suites. The rooms have always been nice and well kept with comfortable beds, working space, sitting groups and bath rooms.These rooms also have wonderful views in any direction to famous historic architecture . Breakfast is excellent, and so is also the cituation with the main attractions of the city center within walking distance through pleasant neighbourhoods. And entry to the metro is just around the corner. All this are good reasons for me to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: saadb
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and was somehow excited about the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Du Louvre but unfortunately my experience did not live up to my expectations. I arrived at the hotel at 9 am and was told that my room would not be available until 3pm and could not even get a room to change. I tried to pay for a room for a few hours but was told the hotel was sold out and I felt that the front desk person did not really try to accommodate. I took occupation of the junior suite, which was spacious but had dated furniture. Breakfast was included in my package but on weekdays, breakfast ends at 10AM and essentially the staff starts packing and preparing lunch tables at 10:01 making the experience a bit stressful with tables and food carts being moved around. In most hotels I have stayed at, breakfast typically goes until 11am and even later on weekends (10:30 on Saturday and Sunday at this hotel). Upon checkout, I asked if I could keep the room a bit later because my flight back to the US was in the late afternoon and again was told that the check out time was 12 noon and that the most they could do was 12:30. This was another indicator that the staff made very little extra effort to make my experience memorable by going the extra mile, a very important attribute of “luxury” hotels. Perhaps the reason is that the hotel is always sold out due to location and does not need to brand itself around hospitality. I was also very surprised by the rates used for local calls from the hotel. Buyers beware and do not use the hotel phone lines to make calls to cellular phones (including local ones). Rates are prohibitive if not outrageous. The bright spots were location and concierge services but unfortunately these positive elements were not sufficiently compelling to make me want to go back. This experience did not feel like a five star experience and I believe there are a many other hotels in Paris that understand service and hospitality a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “3* rooms, 4* service, 5* location”
Reviews.Author: PekoePeony
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights for a business trip. We chose this hotel due to corporate policy but most especially location, which was amazing -- we opened our hotel window and saw directly into the windows of the Louvre across the street. Even better, the metro stop is right next to the hotel, making it super easy to get around everywhere, plus I had a beautiful 10 minute walk through the gardens of the Palais Royal to the office which was near the Bourse. The room itself was so-so -- size was on the small size, but okay (larger than London rooms). However the room itself looked a bit dated and smelled quite musty. It was also excessively warm despite our turning off the heat (this was early December), so we had to crack open the windows to let in fresh air but sadly that also made the room quite noisy -- I had to put in earplugs in every night to sleep. The bathroom was a decent size and nicely done in white marble, though I was bummed that no hair conditioner was supplied (ladies, bring your own). This is definitely a 3* or so hotel -- after checking out here, we then checked into the Park Hyatt Place Vendome (where we stayed for fun and not work) which is a real 5* hotel, as was the Four Seasons Georges V where we had lunch one day. On the plus side, there's free WiFi at the Hotel du Louvre, and the concierge / front desk were very helpful with our requests. That said, it seems a little expensive for what you get, so bear in mind that you're paying for the location and don't expect much from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: mikeschlueter
Reviews.Content: Although I have realized, after three Paris trips, that you can stay pretty much anywhere and use the subway to get where you are going, I do like being in the middle of the action. The Hotel du Louvre is in such a great spot. Near shopping, near The Louvre (obviously), near the Opera House, and most importantly, right next to a subway stop. I have stayed in more interesting hotels but had to walk 1/2 mile to get to the subway. I will never make that mistake again. Hotel is clean and nice. People are friendly and helpful. The room was much nicer than I expected. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchmanTheHague
Reviews.Content: Compared with others in Paris Euro 320 per night for this 5 star hotel seemed very reasonable (paid 300 for a 3 star the previos week) a nd weifi was included in the price. Room was nicely decorated and aresonable size (Paris hotel rooms generally seem to be very small). Location very good , adjacent to the Louvre, near the Opera area and with a Metro station next door. I didn't eat here and therefore can't comment on the food. The cocktails in the bar were good though, but at 50 for 3 drinks (one opf which wasn't alcholic) so they should be. As usual in this sort of hotel breakfast is best taken in a nearby cafe at 5 euros for coffee and a couple of croissants rather than euro 28 in the hotel. Not sure this hotel really is 5 star more like 4 or 4.5 I would say. Reasonable value so would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location of Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette17
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great/central location but is overadvertised on the net. The staff and service is excellent, but the rooms are outdated and small. The bathrom was big and comfortable. Top floor has quiet rooms. The bedding is very fresh and comfortable. Overall the stay is good and caring staff makes it for t he old fasion feel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Outside, Small Inside...”
Reviews.Author: Donny H
Reviews.Content: It might be normal in Paris for small room, but I was in Milan for 2 nights and the impression there was nice with bigger (or I might say normal) room. Hotel du Louvre was in the heart of the city. Musee Louvre was just 3 minutes walk. The Opera was 15 minutes walk or 5 minutes by Metro. Receiptionist was so nice, but again the room as small as one king bed plus some spaces for your luggage. I feel it's a bit overrated but again location beat it all. Overall, it was nice 1st night in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “trip 11/11”
Reviews.Author: donna l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location (right across from the Louve). Metro around the corner. Hotel was clean, well kept and the employees were helpful, friendly and courteous. The buffet breakfast was very good. Recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a superb location with courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: chris_explorer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous, with the outside matching the Louvre across the street. It's convenient also for shopping, with Rue st honore just downstairs and it's many brand stores. The staff were courteous and helpful, and it's become one of our favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overpriced,snooty”
Reviews.Author: anzlondon
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you're traveling to Paris, be prepared to be stripped clean of all your money, and for people to be rude about it. It's the Parisian way.I've been to Paris 6 times in my lifetime...I still find people rude in general, and unfriendly. And this is despite my majoring in French Literature as an undergrad, speaking French reasonably well, and being very well traveled. The euro is still very strong right now despite the economic woes of the country and the dollar is not, so it is not like the days of the franc where there was some value in purchasing. Good things about the hotel: location is great. Plenty to do nearby, close to metro, food, etc. Staff is reasonably accommodating for Parisian standards. (Again, Parisians aren't known for their warm and fuzzy demeanor). Customer service is not really their "thing" . But compared to other visits to Paris in the past, I thought the hotel staff was nicer overall. The room was large for Parisian standards. Nice decor, updated light fixtures, etc. Bathroom was excellent. The concierge is tremendously helpful. They answered all our questions in detail, and never rushed us to go away, like the front desk. We bought tickets to the Louvre here and didnt have to wait in line. Also, they booked dinner and tours for us which was very helpful. Bad things about the hotel: -After flying all night and being 6 mos pregnant, they only allowed us to check in at 3 pm. If checkout time is at 12, does it really take 3 hours to make a room ready? We were able to go to the Louvre for the day, but it was really exhausting. -The bed is hard as a rock. Some people like this. Again, being pregnant, it was not comfortable for me at all. Also, it is not a king bed but 2 beds put together and you can feel the divider in the middle. -Very loud in the morning. -Bath products are watered down (to save money??) but have the Annick Goutal label. -We were told we got a 30 euro credit per day for meals at the restaurant, but when we checked out this was not applied to our bill. It took some arguing with the front desk staff for them to admit we were correct. The general attitude was very snooty and dismissive. But hey, its Paris. Normally, I wouldnt complain about a lot of these things, as I have stayed in much worse accommodations, but it's especially painful to spend nearly $400 per night and not have a comfortable bed, etc. Perhaps its is just a bad time to visit Paris, because everything everywhere in the city is expensive. It is a magical, romantic city, we will definitely go again, (after the Euro weakens for sure) but probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: twhite4809
Reviews.Content: First the positives on the Hotel du Louvre: If you want to stay near the Louvre, this hotel cannot be beaten. From our room, 305, you could literally see into the museum (Richelieu wing). Also, the entrance to the metro stop is no more than 50 meters from the front door of the hotel, 5 meters if you go out the back door. Also, not a huge factor, but the free wifi worked fine. Lastly, we had a deluxe room (not a suite) with a king size bed and found the room to be spacious by Paris standards. Now the negatives: Housekeeping left no toilet paper on the second day of our stay. It took 3 phone calls to the front desk/housekeeping and almost 1 hour to finally get someone from the front desk to send some up. On another occasion we had to twice call housekeeping to get 2 glasses that housekeeping had forgotten to leave. The water temperature in the shower was awful; as soon as you would get the water to a comfortable temperature it would suddenly turn hot or quite cold. This was consistent throughout our 7 day stay. The secret seemed to be to wait it out rather than try to adjust it back to a reasonable temperature. Early in the morning you could hear the trains underneath the hotel from the metro. It wasn't so bad that you couldn't get back to sleep, but you can hear it none the less. I suspect that it was partly due to our room facing east, which is where the entrance/exit to the station was located. Not directly a hotel problem, but do not waste your time and money on the hotel food. It expensive and so-so. We didn't really care too much about this as there are many good cafe's, bistros etc. very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn T
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris & our 20th anniversary. We loved the location of the hotel the most. It is an older building and the rooms are a bit dark and small by US standards, but the location and value were enough to win us over. We will definitely stay here again, soon I hope! The breakfast was very good, but extremely expensive, 28 euros = about $35 each!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: JLHS15
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful! We had an overnight flight from the U.S.and were able to check in to our room at 11:00 a.m. The concierge was more than helpful and was always willing to answer questions and help with arranging restaurant reservations and taxis. The breakfast was great with a lot of choices. The room was clean, spacious and pure luxury. The greatest part is the location of the hotel - it is near the Louvre, within walking distance of wonderful restaurants and shopping and near all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Paris? Stay At Hotel du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris. We loved the Hotel du Louvre. It is a beautiful hotel. Our room was exceptional. And the staff was very helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast each day at the hotel. The buffet breakfast were superb. The food selections were high quality, healthy and plentiful. It was always a great way to start the day. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is close shopping and the Louvre is right next door. It was also fun to sit at the cafe across the street and have a snack. There are many, many restaurants close to the hotel. We couldn't be more pleased with everything about the Hotel du Louvre. What a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: timkent007
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when in Paris. It's the perfect hotel, great staff - get a junior suite for a tip top room. Great location - everything is walkable. The best steak in Paris is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “no temperature control in rooms, uneven treatment of guests”
Reviews.Author: Jaunt
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a king room and were given a much smaller bed and told there were no others. and only the manager can address such issues. were literally told to 'take a walk' until the manager could deal with us. Really, leave your bags in the lobby and 'take a walk". after a wait, the manager appeared, no king rooms. We realized that we had to sleep with the window open as there is no way to lower the heat. 5 star? We were told that 'all the paris hotels had central heat'. there is no a/c. well, we spent the prior weekend at Hotel Henri iv Rive Gauche and could control our own heat, so that's just not true. the next day at 6 PM we received a call that a king room was available. quickly awoke from our nap, packed again and went down for the keys. The manager had gone on break, and we would have to wait for her return. I have never been at a hotel when there the front desk can do nothing without the manager. While I was waiting, another couple came to check in. They were told theirroom would be ready in 10 minutes, and they would be getting a big upgrade, would they like some drinks in the bar while they waited. So I understand the rave reviews by those who were treated well. We were told to take a walk and they were offered cocktails! Maybe we werent dressed fancy enough for their bar. Yes, they have a great location by the Louvre, but because of the way we were treated and having to sleep with the window open in a noisy area, we will not return. There are many better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluenose1961
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our twentieth wedding annivesary. On arrival at the reception we were treated like celebrities. Our cases were whisked away and delivered and waiting for us on our arrival with the bell boy who carried the cases in and did the usual 'proper 5 star' room tour. After thirty minutes a bottle of champers/chocs were delivered from the management for our anniversary. Very impressed. The room directly faced the Louvre museum and the view was not lost on us. The rooms amenities were standard for a five star with a decent size for Paris and the usual trimmings, bath robes slippers, pillow choccy's, up market bathroom goodies and '60 channels and nothing on' (the TV ). But we were not there to watch TV so this was of no consequence. We did eat at the 'Brasserie' restaurant one evening but was a bit underwhelmed as we were expecting something that suited the hotels fire star status, think the restaurant let the side down somewhat, but believe this has since had a revamp and change of restaurant management. All staff are very accomadating and warm and so very helpful, the concierge is a diamond! I am loathe to leave a negative comment about this grand old lady as we had such a wonderful stay but it would have been fair to say at that time (August 2009) the place was in need of some TLC to its furnishings and fittings. We 'popped in to the bar on our last trip to Paris and it seemed the place had indeed had a sping clean. Great venue for cost and full of history and old world charm. Would deffinetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for our first trip To Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anntmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 60's and decided to try Paris on our own for 6 days. The Hotel Du Louvre, with its friendly and helpful staff and proximity to major attractions and a metro stop, more than met our expectations. The deluxe room was spacious with plenty of closet and storage space, and a working safe. The buffet breakfast was very good with a large selection. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. Even though our room looked out on a busy street and a metro station entrance, we were not bothered by any noise. Our main suggestion for improvement would be better lighting in our room, especially near the closet, but in all other respects it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: princessofvisconde
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days it was very pleasant,super located,friendly efficient staff,rooms very nice,air condition excellent,huge bathroom,very good room service,all round a very nice stay,

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Wish I had more $ to stay longer!!”
Reviews.Author: Padilha1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't cheap at all! I would say it's perfect if it was a little bit cheaper! But I know Paris is expensive!! At least they honor their $$$ - the room was amazing! two showers and a tub + robes and sleepers and a separate "guest room" attached to our bedroom perfect customer service and location!! So worth the money! We didn't have breakfast there so I don't know about their food, anyways all the food I had in Paris (this was my second time there) was expensive and bad so it didn't matter much. If we had an extra 260 bucks per night we'd stay more! Loved it!! P.S. we stayed there July 2010 (TripAdvisor won't let me go that far in this review)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Due Louvre”
Reviews.Author: SarfrazKhan
Reviews.Content: Located in center district of Paris. All the main monuments are at short distance. Has simple but comfortable rooms. The Service in the Restaurant is efficient. Staff is friendly. The architecture is very historical and therefore is recommended if you have some extra money to spent on accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Catbabe
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel based on the location and the reviews. We found everyone that we had contact with front desk, concierge, porter, housekeeping, breakfast servers and servers at The Defender (lobby bar) were all professional, helpful and made us feel welcomed. I think if you go to any country where the primary language is not your own, it does make a difference to attempt to learn about 10-20 phrases. We found that most people seemed to appreciate that we had respect for their country and made an effort to communicate. It was very apparent that we are Americans and so after a brief greeting in French everyone would then speak to us in English.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Nice room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie N
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel du Louvre for 6 nights and we liked it a lot. We didn't spend a ton of time in our hotel but we did shower and sleep here and we did actually call it a day early at one point, so we went upstairs to our cute, clean little room up on the third floor, snuggled in bed and watched Paranormal Activity 2 (the movie would get negative 5 stars btw..). Anywho, the food here in the hotel looks good but we wouldn't know.. the staff is nice, professional.. when we first got to our room it was freezing, we asked them to fix it and they immediately sent up a ginormous space heater! Later that night we got a complimentary bottle of wine and macaroons ;) The location is as clutch as it gets. We are 2 minute walk from just about everything (everything = great cafe's, cheese shops, high end boutiques, low end boutiques, other specialty stores like stores with doggie clothing, fast food if you want it, the Louvre is literally right next door, the metro is also literally on our block). I think the only thing I found to be slightly strange is that they lock the front door to the hotel at midnight for security and it's not like theyre fully staffed at 2o'clock a.m either. It took a couple minutes of hard knocking before someone let us in last night.. No biggie though, just sayin =)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Right Bank location”
Reviews.Author: 1nytraveler
Reviews.Content: Near the Louvre and the Tuileries, just steps to luxe shopping on St. Honoré, and a 10-minute stroll to the trendy Montorgueil quarter. The buffet breakfast is fabulous, with fresh fruit, juices, salad, eggs, charcuterie, cheeses, yogurt, and the yummiest of pastries, not to mention wonderful coffee. Lots of personal attention from the whole staff, especially Amirul, a 15-year veteran in the dining room who provides impeccable service with a big smile. We love the Annick Goutal products in the bath—so French!—and the bed is nice and firm. Go for the Deluxe rooms—the less-expensive top-floor rooms have been nicely renovated but are a bit claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulF71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated. It has an old school luxury feel to it, and delivers. The staff are polite, helpful and attentive. The room was spacious and airy, I had a balcony overlooking the square which was nice. The only slight problem was a bit of noise from the underground station. Apart from that top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: cajFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel du Louvre for 5 nights 9/20-9/26/11. We found the hotel extremely convenient to sights (around the corner from the Louvre) and the Metro. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were comfortably appointed. I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “I'm Sorry that I Have to Leave”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: I am a 64-year-old woman and I came to Paris alone. I was quite nervous, but I soon felt right at home here. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful, and with the great access to the Metro, I was soon getting around easily on my own. The single elevator was not working for a brief time. I had to walk up to my room on the third floor, which proved difficult. I hope that that doesn't happen too often. If I return to Paris, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: AdvofJoshNCheryl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel du Louvre twice on our two week trip to France. The first time we were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary upgrade to a Jr. Suite. It was like having our very own spacious apartment with a nice terrace overlooking the city! The location cannot be beat---very walkable to major sites and a short distance to the subway. During our second stay, we thought we had misplaced our computer charger and our computer was nearly dead. We notified the Concierge and they told us to bring it down and they charged it right there. Very friendly service and helpful in confirming our dinner reservations and also giving us directions. We also splurged on one of the hotel's Sundaes, which was worth every Euro!

Reviews.Title: “The Pissarro Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Hawet
Reviews.Content: When in Paris, we always like to stay at the Hotel du Louvre. The location is great, close to the Louvre, the Tuileries, the Palais Royal and other wonderful sights. Staff are always friendly and knowledgeable, and we love the characterful, historic building with its large diversity in rooms, each one very tastefully decorated. This time was rather special. When checking in, we were told that we were being upgraded from a junior suite to the Pissarro Suite! This luxurious suite consists of a large sitting room, a bedroom with a very comfortable kingsize bed, a walk in garderobe, and two bathrooms (separate toilet). The decoration of the rooms is inspired by the paintings of the impressionist painter Pissarro, especially in the colours used. The view from the suite is unforgettable: you look straight down Avenue de l'Opéra, with the Opéra Garnier at the end – just like the view that inspired Pissarro. Furniture is very luxurious, and the bathrooms are just wonderful. One has a very large jacuzzi, and two washbasins. The other has (a.o.) a large enclosed shower with several options, including a steam shower. There were four bathrobes (for two persons!), slippers, and loads of lovely Annick Goutal toiletries. In the sitting room we found (a.o.) a DVD Player and a Bose Sound System Home Cinema. We also got a complimentary bottle of (good) red wine. So, if you want to pamper yourself, or if there is something to celebrate, I can only say: don't hesitate, but choose this wonderful suite in the Hotel du Louvre!

Reviews.Title: “A Bonafide 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlina34
Reviews.Content: Summer rate led me to this hotel and I have paid more for far worse in Paris. Clean! Our group of 6 stayed here. It was unseasonally warm in Paris and we were thankful for the a/c. It was roaring loud though.

Reviews.Title: “A broken dream”
Reviews.Author: barrenstar
Reviews.Content: When we traveled to PARIS before, me and my husband were young and stayed in quite modest hotels. Each time we happened to pass by those golden lit windows of Hotel du Louvre, we would steel a glance of its luxurious lobby and dream that one day we would afford our stay there. Time passed an after traveling all over the world and staying in various hotels, we finally landed in Hotel du Louvre. Oh, damn! What a disappointment! The luxurious lobby got really worn out, the old, very old room was not just SMALL, it was miserable! I am a short girl, though it was almost imposible to move inside the room and the ceiling was literally on my head. I felt like overgrown Alice in wonderland. If my husband made a move, he either fell on the bed or into the bathtub. There was also nothing special about the treatments by Annick Goutal (and they tried their best not to bring the new bottles every morning. If something was left in the bottle of shower gel, they would not bring the new one). Breakfast was okay, but nothing special. Just okay. Hotel du Louvre claims they offer 5 stars. NO WAY! Something around 3. What was great about Hotel du Lourve? LOCATION is no question.The reception stuff was also great. Extremely helpful and polite. Ah! The Customer Care speaks no english!!!! I called to the customer care for the slippers! It took me like 15 minutes to explain what I wanted. I stayed on the line while they were looking for someone who spoke english. I respect the different cultures and basically I can use some of any european languages to make communication easier, but I did not know the french words for SLIPPERS! Alas! Not any more!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely way to celebrate a special birthday...”
Reviews.Author: newforestpony
Reviews.Content: We went to the Du Louvre at very short notice and were very impressed by the hotel – and with Kirker Holidays who booked it all for us. We very much appreciated the beautiful platter of fresh fruit organised by Kirker in recognition of my husband’s birthday – it was lovely. Our deluxe room was gorgeous – beautifully furnished with fresh and crisply clean linen. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. If the windows are open when you arrive you hear the noisy “Parisien soundtrack” but with them and the inner windows closed it is extremely quiet and we slept very well. The bathroom was superb – twin basins, bidet, toilet and bath with shower over – spotless and very spacious. It led off a small hallway between the bedroom door and the bedroom itself, which gave privacy to anyone using it. As you might expect from a hotel like this, bathrobes and slippers are provided, as are quality toiletries and very fluffy towels. We only ate breakfast at the hotel and it was a plentiful buffet with a great deal of choice. The one downside was that the cooked items were not as hot as they should have been and sometimes a little tired. If you take tea with milk you do need to ask for cold milk or you get it frothy and warm! Our room overlooked the Louvre and the Place du Palais Royal, where you are entertained every evening by the skateboarders practising their skills. I spent a lot of time standing at the open window, simply absorbing the atmosphere. There is a Metro station literally outside the hotel but take care to avoid the “mute” petitioners asking you sign their clipboards and soliciting donations – watching them, we realised they weren’t actually mute and chatted amongst themselves when not badgering people! The one small criticism we would make is that some of the reception staff were a little “distant” and didn’t come across as being particularly friendly or approachable. The concierges, however, were extremely helpful, friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. We felt very bad that when Dimitri took our luggage to our room we didn’t have any suitable Euros to tip him (we felt that 50 Euros might have been seen as ever so slightly ostentatious!). Unfortunately, he was about to go on a few days’ leave so we never did see him to put matters right. He was a great guy – very friendly, informative about the hotel and the local area and a real credit to the hotel. We’d spent a few days in Paris last year and “did” the usual tourist attractions then so this year we took in the Grande Arche at La Defence. It’s an amazing edifice and gives the same sort of butterfly feeling standing under it as you get standing on the edge of a tall building! Unfortunately, it’s not open to visitors and the lifts aren’t working (for which I was grateful!) but it’s still very much worth a visit. The Opera Garnier, just "up the Rue" from the hotel, is another.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, and then some!”
Reviews.Author: gring0mama
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice rooms, marvelous bar and brasserie. But most of all, Hotel du Louvre has one of the best locations in Paris--our room offered a view of L'Opera, and the Louvre. What more could one want in Paris? Walk to everything, or use the metro which is right outside the hotel door. I'd stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: windycitytraveler21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and all I can say is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Lovely hotel and within walking distance of many sites. Even though located in a busy area, the rooms were very quiet. Hotel staff was always readily available. Would recommend highly

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tcakaren
Reviews.Content: Great location on the right bank close to the Louvre, the old Opera house and Les Halles. the tour company that does daily trips is right around the corner also.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, elegant”
Reviews.Author: Euroedmus
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris in July staying for a few days after an exciting trip to Disneyland. I booked a different hotel first through LHW but the hotel contacted me just 4 days before the trip saying that suit can not accommodate 2 adults and 1 five years old child...so I had to quickly find a different place to stay. I decided to go for Hotel de Louvre and was not disappointed! Arrival was smooth, check-in very fast and efficient. We were taken to a room and it was on a top floor (as requested by me). The room was not big but we were happy with a size considering that usually rooms in Paris are extremely small. Rooms are somewhat dark. I think some renovation for windows is required (at least some frames painting). Breakfast is served in the hotel main restaurant and we found it somewhat not up to the standard, but it was not poor at all. Just not what we like. Hotel's location is just perfect. It is next to the Louvre. What else to wish? What we did not like: - hotel staff seems to be demotivated and not always helpful. This is especially noticed on cleaning and maintenance. We had a tap broken in the bathroom but nobody seemed to care, none of the hotel employees was pro-active enough to fix it and was leaving it for the next one hoping they would do it for them. Typical for human being in general, but I found it unprofessional for the hospitality industry. - room service is good, but food is not tasty. We liked the hotel's restaurant and dining is a pleasure in it. But food served to your room is not as tasty as at the main restaurant for some reason (we were told it is coming from the main restaurant). - cleaning. Very poor. You get a bottle of Champagne on arrival but nobody bothers to clean bottle and glasses when you are done. It is left in your room for the entire stay. I just took it all next to a lift the other day as it was really not nice. Those are a few things which we did not like. Rest was just perfect and we look forward to coming back to Paris soon.

Reviews.Title: “Subtly elegant and perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: Pattyfromjersey
Reviews.Content: This trip was our delayed honeymoon and my husband planned everything and surprised me! The hotel is literally around the corner from the louvre museum and a great anchor hotel for a starting point to all the areas of Paris you'll want to see. We stayed in a suite and it was gorgeous and we kept the balcony windows open our whole stay. Breakfast is included in your hotel rate and they really put out a nice spread each morning. May I say that having breakfast on the patio while watching Paris come to life in the morning is one of those simple pleasures that leaves an indelible mark in your memory? We will stay here again and next time we will rent a scooter for our stay and explore the cobblestone streets of the city by motor to really get the local experience!! If you want an elegant hotel experience without feeling like a tourist, you will love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beatuiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KerrieLS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quintessentially Paris. Fantastic concierge who just knows everything! Rooms of average 4* standard, and very comfortable. Great location - close to Metro, Louvre, buses and major attractions. We would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great plave and Central...two small quibbles.”
Reviews.Author: Ray148ca
Reviews.Content: We were there in late July. Excellent hotel, we would stay again. We did not find it noisy. If you open the windows it dos get noisy, but then , you are in the middle of the action. You can just close them when you want quiet. I have two small quibbles, about this hotel. Two comments: Comment # 1 : TV My wife had a stroke a few years ago and needs to take breaks. For instance, an afternoon in the room. Her relaxation is to watch TV. I must admit that the hotel TV service is poor. The only english channels were three "news" channels. When the hotel advertises Satelite TV , i expect to get at least one major US/UK network, or at least more english tv, other than news. Comment # 2: Internet I was told WIFI access was free. It is free, but next to useless for attempting to do business, or access the net. Then i found out that the "useless" WIFI is free , but for a fee i can get this other service that has a cost (wired connection). That service has a cost but it works fine. Needless to say, this annoyed me, and i can't help but think it annoys others. Why not give up the charade, put prices of the room by a buck or two and give free "real" access. Otherwise quite happy. Roger

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: overall_gr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel du Louvre for 5 days (4 nights) at the beginning of September, together with my husband . The hotel has a great location, in the center of Paris, just across the street of the Louvre Museum. We didn’t need to use the public transportation, as everything can be approached by foot. The only one exception was the visit to Montmartre, where we went by metro. The metro station is just next to the hotel. I guess for someone not willing to walk, this could be very convenient. Also we have been to Versailles with a tour organized by a touristic agency near the hotel. They came to pick us up from the hotel, joined us during the visit and brought us back to the hotel , so we basically didn’t need to make any effort for this visit and we just could enjoy it. We booked this tour with the help of the hotel’s front office employee and we are very grateful for it. The room was not too large and it had no view at all, but it was clean and with a huge and very comfortable bed. So, the missing of the view was balanced by the great quality of the sleep. The room was cleaned twice every day and the towels and bed sheets were changed on customer’s request, as often as we needed. The breakfast buffet was very nice, although not as rich as we found in other 5 stars hotels. The minus of the breakfast was the fact that every day they were serving exactly the same things, with no variations at all, but the quality of the food was very good. The last day we also served the lunch there and I have to admit that the food was excellent, the chef deserves our congratulations. The personnel was very prompt and polite. Actually I believe that one of the greatest qualities of this hotel is its personnel. Everybody was very polite and willing to help, with a very professional behavior. And most of all I would like to thank to the gentleman from the front office (unfortunately I forgot to ask his name, but I observed him in the gallery photo on the site of the hotel). He was more than helpful every time when we needed support and information and we would like to thank him by this way. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in Sept 2011. Upon arrival all the necessary information was already prepared by the hotel and our room was ready (although they charged us a 20Euro fee for early check-in). The baby cot we ordered was ready also. We had a junior suite which was good but not great. All the furniture looks worn with scratches and the bathroom, although it was clean, had some very noticeable scratches in the sinks that should have been fixed. Also the bathroom door was not locking properly. Also the sound insulation was very bad. The service on the other hand was excellent. The staff were courteous and when notified about a problem (like the bathroom door) they fixed it by the time we returned in the afternoon. And when we requested an iron and an ironing board, they were delivered promptly. Our room had free WiFi and the speed was acceptable, but steer away from the wired one which is not free. All I got was a 2Mb connection that drops frequently that I wasn't able to complete the update for my Garmin GPS. The location of the hotel is excellent if you want to visit the Louvre and the other museums. The Louvre is practically next door and the metro station is also just across the street. But if you want to visit the Champs-Elysees it's a bit far and you better take the metro. We had the breakfast which had a good selection of hot and cold dishes and I enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Most definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: Barb W
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel from the minute we arrived. We need two conneting rooms (2 adults, 2 children) and would request rooms 283 & 281 again. While the rooms are small, being connected made them perfect for traveling families. Nicely appointed rooms, comfortable & quiet given the busy streets near-by. Housekeeping was excellent. Great value too relative to other hotels we researched and visited. Location is exceptional, steps from the Louvre, close to Metro, wonderful cafes near-by. Added bonus was 40% off in the hotel bar on beverages and complimentary ice cream for the kids at night.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service!”
Reviews.Author: OllyBean
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. Booked the Hotel Du Louvre for 3 nights from the 16th of August for its location and we weren't dissapointed. Its close proximity to the major sights made travelling to and from the hotel easy. For those who dont want the walk, the Metro is next door to the Brasserie.Local buses also pass by regularly.There is also a taxi rank opposite the hotel. Arrived early, our Junior Suite was ready but we could only use the room if we paid 50 euros. We opted to go to the Louvre and come back later at check in time. The Junior suite on the 5th floor was spacious with a clean marble bathroom, fluffy towels and large thick bathrobes.Our suite had a bigger closet, which helps if you are staying for the 4 days. Clean white crisp sheets . Our view of the Opera Garnier at night on the balcony made this Aussie visitor to Paris feel like she was in a dream. Only problem was the aircon wasnt working which meant on the first night we had to open the floor to ceiling windows so there was street noise. But, I have never seen staff at a hotel take so much trouble to resolve the situation. The duty manager and her colleague treated us as if we were the only guests in the hotel and August is peak season for Paris.They worked extremely hard to find a solution for a problem which was really out of their control. We appreciated how much trouble they went to to make us comfortable. I note that in a previous review there was a comment to how quick housekeeping was to respond. Its true,we had the same experience. Breakfast in the Brasserie at this hotel allows the guest to feel that they are getting an authentic Parisian breakfast. Cheeses,cut from the wheel, baguettes, fresh pastries and croissants.Personal pots of coffee or tea.But at the same time you were able to choose something that was more familiar to home. I inquired by email to book a special lunch and both concierges were quick to reply within 24 hours. With a suggestion and then a confirmed booking. ALL the staff at this hotel seem to take their positions very seriously. If you want a hotel that has a quaint Parisian feel but the safe option of a bigger room this is the place for you. You can have both at the Hotel Du Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashion Paris Charm”
Reviews.Author: trishaNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms for 4 nights at the Hotel du Louvre. This hotel is filled with old fashioned charm. If you are looking for sleek and modern this is not the place for you! Our double room was typical European size (with no view at all) but the junior suite was quite spacious with lovely large windows overlooking the street (surprisingly quiet at night too.) I would opt for the upgrade if possible. The breakfast, included in our rate, was a HUGE hit with my family (so much to choose from) and the service was wonderful. Location was the best feature. Close to so much and easy Metro rides everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxRox
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to many major sites in Paris. This was my third trip to Paris, but the first for my parents, DH and sister, so we wanted to be near all of the action. This was my first time staying in the 1st arr. Previous trips I stayed in the 9th and 16th arr. We had three junior suites booked and were given rooms on the first floor, which is really the second floor for Americans. My sister had a corner room that was a bit smaller than the other two by had views of both the Louvre and a side street. Her room was the size of a traditional American hotel room, but huge by European standards. My room and my parent's room were practically identical. They were much bigger than my sister's with a separate sitting area. The toilet was separate from the rest of the bathroom. Our toilet had a sink in the room while my parents had to walk around to the other bathroom to wash their hands. There's been a lot of comments about the noise of the metro, and I wanted to note that being on the first floor, the metro never bothered us. You could hear the vibration, but not feel it, just ever so slightly. I thought it sounded like an air conditioner starting up. A couple of days later, my mom said the same thing. Not once did the noise bother us. We could not hear the noise on the street besides the occasional sirens, which you get staying in a city. If you're worried about the noise here, stop worrying. You'll be fine. I've also seen comments about the staff. In our experience, the staff was wonderful. We had great service at the concierge. They recommended some great restaurants and provided guidance when we needed it. Housekeeping was sometimes slow. We would return to our room occasionally throughout the day to take a break and a couple times our room wasn't made up by 2pm despite the "please make our room" sign that we had posted. Turndown service was often around 6pm, when we were getting ready to head to dinner or rest before heading out for our second wind, so we often just got the knock on the door and were handed our chocolates instead of having our bed turned down. Not a big deal at all though. We did have an issue one day with our AC not working well. I think it's because we lost power that night. We called the front desk and they sent someone up to fix it. We never had any issues again. The AC was nice and cool besides that one time despite being 80* F out. As I said above, the best part of this hotel is the location. We walked just about anywhere, the Louvre, the Opera, Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, and more. If we didn't walk, we took the Metro, which was great. I love the Paris Metro. It's so efficient and there are lines that go everywhere. Be smart and watch for pick pockets. It's pretty obvious who's trying to pick you. If someone is staring at the handbag and pocket level, watch out. Again, just be smart. I would recommend this hotel to others. Go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette R
Reviews.Content: Dimitri met us at door with smile. Took bags up and was ever available. Treated me and my companion as though he'd known us forever. Laurent and the other concierges were exceptionally kind and helpful. Our stay for three nights was very pleasant. In spite of missing our dinner reservation by one hour the first night (we didn't realize the time change from England), the dining room staff was understanding and seated us with great courtesy. Breakfasts at the hotel were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I did not want to leave. I Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan12344
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that we were treated so well that I did not want to go home. We were pampered beyond our expectations. The only down side is that I think the hotel needs some updating but that would not keep me from staying there again or recommending to others. The location was perfect for walking to all the Parisian sights. Very easy access to the Metro.The two small verandas were perfect for nightly champagne or wine toasts and aperitifs The best customer service we have had anywhere and we have traveled extensively and stayed at many quality hotels. This one beats them all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but not sure it deserves the 5 stars rating”
Reviews.Author: Alina781
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there a couple of times already. A pretty hotel in an excellent location, i.e. right in front of the Comedie Francaise and of the Louvre, close to Opera Garnier and the designer shops on St Honore street, as well as nearby metro stations for some adventure. Add clean, well equipped and fairly spacious rooms for Paris (if u're not taking the cheapest), nice personnel and a touch of history (seems it was mentioned as Sherlock's accommodation in one of Conan Doyle's detective stories). You can also see the hotel in the very first scenes of The Tourist movie, note the place where Angelina has her coffee you will find it right in front of your hotel :) That said, unless they have refurbished the rooms and have added a pool, am not sure it pays off the current rates, which are more than double the ones I paid last time I stayed there. For 200 eur/night it was a great deal, for 500 as they are now asking i will probably head to the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Cherhar
Reviews.Content: I recently returned for a wonderful stay at Hotel du louvre. This was our first trip to Paris and it was important to us to stay at a full service hotel. The staff was friendly and accomodating with a concierge team that was eager to help us plan the best way to get to each of our destinations. The hotel itself is very nicely appointed. The location is perfect; very centrally located and the metro is right outside the door. I would definietly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “The trip of a lifetime!!"”
Reviews.Author: Donna81Us
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for our anniversary in July staying four nights. We were upgraded to a suite which was very clean and spacious. It had large windows that opened to street below. Im a light sleeper and I never had a problem with noise. Location was great! Conceirge was very helpful. . We had a small issue with one of the tours that had been arranged for us and the conceirge promptly contacted the company to advise and we were surprised that night with a bottle of champagne an as apology --very nice! The carpeting in the common areas could use replacing and the restaurant (where we had the buffet breakfast every morning) could also use a little dusting and update but thats the only issue I can think of. Plenty of nice bistros/restaurants near by as well as the metro stop. There is no real lobby to speak of - just a front desk, conceirge, door man and elevator. There is a large bar area though. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Maria012365
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel in a very convenient location. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge really helped us with our plans. View of the Louvre from our room was lovely. First time visiting Paris,but will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: laxcruising
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel du Lourve for four nights in late July. We can absolutely rave about the diligent and knowledgeable concierge staff., The pleasant and attentive bellmen. The location cannot be beat. However, the room we were given was very dissappointing, as was the attitude of the front desk staff. We arrived from an early morning cross atlantic flight to be told check in was not until 3pm but that they would try to get our room ready earlier. We stored our luggage and took a walking tour until we returned at 2:45pm. It was then that the front desk clerk called house keeping. We were told that they were checking the room, it would take 10 minutes and could we relax in the bar. The clerk would come to get us when the room was ready. Any other hotel might have offered a complimentary drink for our wait. Exhausted, we waited and waited. I finally returned to front desk ( no line, no other guests waiting) and inquired about the room and, without a blink of an eye (cannot imagine clerk forgot she had sent us to bar to wait and had promised to come get us) she called housekeeping again to find out room was, indeed, ready. Room was nothing like we imagined. Nothing like website picture. Bathroom was stark. The shower door leaked water all over floor no matter how we positioned showerhead. However, we were quite tired and so we moved in. It was not until the following morning that I realized that bathroom was the way it was because it was set up as a handicapped bathroom. I called and inquired to find out it was handicapped room. I asked to be changed because of the wet floor everytime we showered. (can't imagine it was too safe for disabled person - not to mention us). Of course told there were no other rooms except an interior room overlooking the roof of the first floor (had specifically paid for a deluxe room in order to have an outside room). We were told that there may be a room at 3pm. Spoke to manager who reiterated this. I cannot imagine why hotel did not know whether or not there would be a room available (were they waiting for cancellations?). I asked if others would be checking in that day, did not get clear answer. If there were people checking in, there would be people checking out and therefore a room for me to switch to. Of course, when we checked at 3, there were no rooms available to move to. Our travel agent contacted the hotel by email, as well but had no response whatsoever. Needless to say, late at night we rode up elevator with new guests checking in. Their conversation was that they had booked "standard rooms" but they they had been upgraded to larger outside rooms. I was appalled. The capper is that, 7 pm the night before we were to check out, the hotel manager called and offered us a new room.(After we had been there three out of four nights) She said she had been trying to call us "all day".
