She said she heard we had been unhappy. Wish she would have made that call on second day..... I have stayed in many four and five star European Hotels. I have always been extremely satisfied with the staff and our treatment at these hotels. The front desk staff at this hotel truly ruined my experience there so that I will not stay here next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Service, Nice Accommodations, a bit Pricy”
Reviews.Author: richardneworleans
Reviews.Content: We booked half the room nights (total 8) with hotel directly and the other half through Hotels.com. Better overall deal this way for some reason. Splurged on a Jr. Suite (not much difference in cost) for the extra space and it was worth it. Had a corner room: lovely french doors that opened and you could stand out (no room for seating). We were on the 4th floor. Loved it. The bed was comfortable. Bathroom was wonderful: large, double sinks, separate bath from shower. All marble, clean and fresh. Nice towels and bathrobes. Carpet was clean but kind of cheap. For the price, we expected nicer drapes, carpeting, pictures on the wall and accent furniture. We paid about $400 US dollars per night! Breakfast was good, pricy. But the hotel offered a special rate for guests. 8 mornings of the same breakfast was not good. I would recommend if you're staying long like we did, if you don't have breakfast included in your rate, save a couple of days to venture out for breakfast. Concierge service was excellent. Booked us a tour to Mont Saint-Michel and to Saint Chapelle for their concert, both added to our hotel expense and no mark up! We had the best station for the concert thanks to the Hotel's connection. Loved the free high speed internet: don't bother using the wired at a cost. Quality of wireless great! So, depending on your budget, I would highly recommend this hotel if you're not spending the kind of money it takes for the Ritz, Le Crillon or other top hotels. Very close to the Louvre, Muse D'Orsay (a common metro connection and the closest to get to the Eiffel Tower), shopping and cafes (though cafes are everywhere!).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable rooms but lacking in areas”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Convenient location - to the Louvre, transport and on the Le-open-bus route. Room was well styled and functional. Bed mattress had definitely passed it use-by date. Safe very small - could not take A4 size folder Cupboard sliding-doors (mirrored) were very heavy and very difficult to open/close. Bathroom was spacious and well equipped. We were disappointed to have in inside room - no view at all - just to another rooms across a grubby yard. Although we booked a Deluxe or Superior room months in advance, I guess this is what happens when you arrive after 6pm! (all decent rooms have been allocated) We'd not be too concerned if we were only staying 1 or 2 nights, but we were there nearly a week, so very disappointing. Concierge - (Laurent) was exceptionally helpful. Other staff were okay - to be polite - they seem more to go through the motions than be genuine. Room staff were friendly - although often our room was not made up by 1-2pm (despite us leaving it signed to be made up at 8am) Overall - it is an average hotel that gave us no passion to re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: boots_is_alive
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on a business trip and was pretty impressed with the place. The staff are really friendly and go out of the way to help out and make you feel at home. The hotel itself is impressive and the rooms are quite small but really clean and comfortable. Only time I ate in the restaurant was at breakfast but the service was great and the food was very good too. There is a metro station right outside the restaurant so its perfect to go out and about in paris or just cross the road and see the louvre !

Reviews.Title: “You Will Find Better Hotels Nearby”
Reviews.Author: Mirabbeau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Paris frequently but had not stayed in the Hotel du Louvre before, the location is fantastic, unfortunately this hotel is resting on its laurels. It was supposed to have made a significant investment in decor, etc., if that was so, then the owners should ask for their money back. However, the main problem appeared to be simple poor management. For example, on our first night there my wife and I had a glass of wine each in our room then went out to dinner. We returned to find that the bed had been turned down and new wine glasses had been left with those little paper top covers.- wrong, when we lifted the glasses they were the same two UNWASHED wine glasses. Dirty dishes, glasses and empty wine bottles stood on the floor in the hall outside our room for two days, and the list goes on and on. Small things admittedly, but in a hotel charging premium prices the customer should expect better - this cannot be blamed on the staff, these are issues that relate to a lack of proper management. There are hotels within walking distance that are superior by far, some of those hotels charge similar prices but deliver a premium service, some of those hotels are much cheaper and still deliver a markedly superior service.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Kanuckian
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 2 nights as we passed through Paris on a tour of France. Our stay began with us feeling somewhat in debt to them - my hubby got his days wrong by one night, so we were fortunate to even get a room for our first night. However - they seemed to take advantage of this fact by charging us the same rate that night for a queen room and bed, as they did for our second night (our actual correct booking) for a king bed and room which was much bigger and more comfortable - both around 400 euro. It is rated as a 5 star, but this is too high. I would say no higher than 4, and that is generous. The proximity to the Louvre and other sights makes it good - but it needs some work if it wants to maintain this. Overall - rooms are comfortable, but small, location is good, breakfast was good (for 28 euro).

Reviews.Title: “disappointing anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: artist4
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room for our 35th wedding anniversary. We chose a 5 star hotel, and were expecting something special . Being disabled, I use an electric scooter, and things didn't get off to a great start when I had to enter the hotel through the tradesman's entrance! There should have been a ramp to enter through the main entrance. Being a disabled person on a electric scooter we needed a bit of space around the bed. When we booked in we were shown a room by the bell boy - it was shabby and small - the bell boy said it was a standard room. We went back to reception and we were told there were no more rooms, but we could have a suite for an extra 200 euros per night. As it was 4 o'clock we felt that did not have an alternative. The suite was OK but it never felt like a 5star hotel not even 4star -probably 3 star at most. One evening we asked for a bucket of ice we had to ask 3 times and in the end after 45 minutes my husband went to the bar and got it himself - not a 5 star service I think. Finally,whilst we were waiting for our taxi in the lounge with all our bags,we were told to move as the table was reserved. The room was empty except for two other people. This was the last straw, and I certainly wouldn't give this hotel a 5 star rating. In fact I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: rlb6772
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic trip to Paris. Staying at hotel lived up to our expectations and even exceeded! From the early check in that was provided, to the friendly and helpful concierge (especially Laurent!)..the service was increadible. We included the breakfast in our stay at the hotel, and it was worth it. Delicious and wonderful variety. The rooms were spacious and well taken care of. We cannot wait to return and stay at hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely magnificent hotel that I would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: relyongrace
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 2-week stay in Paris at the Hotel du Louvre. From the outset I was very impressed with the service. From the concierge to the doormen, each person treated me with a professional friendliness and courtesy not often seen these days. I was welcomed into my room with a bottle of wine and a package of cookies. Each morning my room was cleaned; each evening my bed was turned down and 2 pieces of chocolate were left on it. Any questions I had (and I had many) were cheerfully answered, and the concierge was more than willing to direct me to one of the nearby (or not so nearby) sights. Although I know a little French, and my daughter is fluent in it, we found that the staff knew English and was happy to converse with us in it. The hotel offered a superb breakfast each morning consisting of various pastries and croissants, eggs, sausages, potato cakes, ham, cheese, fruits, juices, coffee and tea. Our room was a Junior Suite, and for a stay of 2 weeks, it was well worth the price to have the space to stretch out in. The rooms were clean, and the bathrooms appeared to have been renovated recently as the marble was still completely new looking. I liked this hotel a great deal. It probably is the nicest hotel I have eveer stayed in, and if I have the opportunity to go back, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ebelina
Reviews.Content: Its my favorite hotel in paris especially for christmans and new year eve. Its so nice build few steps from louvre and it has very nice and live bar. i really love it

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for 2 but not more in a room even a Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: KS6230
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 13 years ago and had a lovely double bed room with a view of the Louvre and a wonderful experience. But, my recent 4 day stay with my two daughters was not so wonderful. We paid a high price for a Junior Suite to accomodate the 3 of us but the 3rd person had to sleep on a 2 inch mattress on a pull out couch. And, our view was the rooms across from us. Obviously we were disappointed. The buffet breakfast continues to be excellent and the location is perfect for two metro lines, but, the room accomodations were not worth the price. I now wish I had stayed at one of the other 4-5 star hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: CLRF93
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel because of its proximity to most attractions in Paris. We could basically walk everywhere from the hotel. The airport transfer bus drops you about a half mile from the hotel, so it's not a long walk. The rooms are small and look a bit dated but everything is clean. The concierge staff was extremely helpful and they helped us find a good location to watch the Tour de France.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor service and rude- Soo Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nilly6777
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Paris, stayed at the hotel. It is definitely not a 5 star hotel. The rooms are extremely tacky and worn out, the service is so disapointing, especially when you pay for 5 star treatment and you have just come from Four Seasons des Bergues in Geneva. The concierge just give you directions, they cannot hold reservations at restaurants or get you tickets for museums or galleries. most of the time the bell boy is not standing outside to get you a cab, the front office manager are so rude and they act as if we are paying for a youth hostel. They messed up our tickets and the Brasserie is so filthy in the morning for breakfast, with crumbs all over the floor. The amenities in the room are minimal, in our fridge we had chocolates which were open by the previous guests who were occupying the room and not even removed !!! the person who turns down your bed, if you ask her to remove a tray , she tells you its not her job. the only good thing about this place is location and one of the staff in the brasserie, who i should mention- Amirul, very walm and welcoming. Does this sound like a 5 star hotel ???. I will never go back, we actually quickly plan a trip to versailles to avoid staying the last night, even though it was Paris and one cannot leave Paris. Hope M.Pierre reads this and doesn't only to the good reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: villager73
Reviews.Content: I did not have a good experience at the hotel. When we checked in on a Friday, the front desk told us that they were upgrading us since the room we were supposed to have wasn't available. I asked how long we were to have the room (knowing that we had 2 separate reservations), and was told that it was for the total 6 nights we were staying there. We unpacked and was enjoying our weekend. On Sunday I bought museum passes from the concierge and asked to bill the tickets to our room. The concierge looked up the room number and told us that it looked as if we were supposed to check out that day. I saw the woman who checked us in and she looked up our reservation, and then told us that she had made a mistake and that we had to leave our room asap. We were to pack our belongings and move to another room. But what really upset me was that they did not even have a room available for us to move into and that we had to have our suitcases packed by the door and the hotel will move it to our new room later in the day. We were almost out the door and gone for the day, and only by chance we found out about having to move. No one had informed us ahead of time, it was already noon, we were running late and had to go back to our room to pack. I was very upset by how this was handled. I had specifically asked when we checked in about how long the stay would be in this room, and the answer was the whole six nights. When we got back after a long day on Sunday evening, we came to our new room which was terribly small, dark and facing the interior. After making a mistake and moving us out at the last minute, they gave us one of the worst rooms in the hotel. However, I would like to mention that a positive to the hotel was the concierge and housekeeping staff. They were always helpful and patient.

Reviews.Title: “Top Rank Hotel, Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: msilvers50
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned travelers and for the facilities, staff/service, food and location this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. We stayed in room 201, a nice corner room with large windows overlooking the square and Metro station behind the hotel. the bathroom was a modernized marble with nice natural light from large frosted windows. The bed was large with comfortable bedding. The A/C was very good too for a European hotel. Housekeeping was on top of everything. Any request to them resulted in a knock on our door 2 minutes later with the extra towels one day, extra tissues the next that we would request. The front desk staff was attentive and concierge staff was knowledgeable and generally friendly. The breakfast buffet was substantial and of good quality, with outstanding baguettes daily. The hotel is a block from the Louvre Museum, walking distance from Notre Dame, the Seine River and the Opera Garnier. C'est magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and hope to return again soon.”
Reviews.Author: ParisTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Louvre has a great location-- just steps away from the Musee du Louvre with a subway stop around the corner, as well as nearby shopping and all sorts of eating. Other sightseeing is within walkable distances as well. The hotel property is what I would describe as an updated refined classic style hotel with friendly and helpful staff. If the rates fit within your travel budget, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets....”
Reviews.Author: Seattleguy6060
Reviews.Content: Does not get much better. This property has the best location in Paris. Beautiful hotel and very well run. Breakfast buffet (included with room) was amazing, fresh and plenty of selections, chocolate croissants are killer... Room on the small side but well appointed and very clean. Wi fi was a god-send for keeping in touch with loved ones. The concierge was the best, well informed and very helpful with the trip. Hotel bar was great especially when there was entertainment, the jazz band was one of the best Ive ever heard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lapis-philosophorum
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. It's really in the middle of everything. Louvre, Palais Royale, Faubourg St Honore, Opera, Ile de la Cite'... I was in town for work, but it was great to just walk around in the evening, walk to Le Fumoir for a meal, or just watch the river at sunset. I never get tired of wondering the streets of Paris. I never managed to make it to the shops in time (Astier de la Villatte and Serge Lutens are basically next door). The hotel is a very good 4 stars, classic, with an old school charm. Service is good. They'll get you a taxi even at rush hour, they will literally stop the traffic for you. Breakfast is extremely good for a 4 stars. Annick Goutal products. And you can even get Eurostar points, like in all Concorde Hotels. Room was ok, nothing major, a bit tired maybe. But fine, and very clean. It's the location that counts.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a WOW experience, stay here”
Reviews.Author: NillaTexas
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this....a memorable trip to Paris can be taken to the next level with a stay here. Location, location, location. But there is more. Wonderful, helpful staff who take the time to assist your every need. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and refined.”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the Hotel du Louvre on business. From check-in to check-out the experience was marvelous. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating and pleasant. My room was ready upon arrival and was roomy and elegant- A bit traditional for my taste by gigantic by European standards. Linens were terrific and the view from my window was beautiful. The marble bathroom was luxurious. I had been working for 12 days straight and enjoyed a wonderful night’s rest. The next morning I had room service deliver pastry and coffee and it was delivered exactly on time by a wonderfully attentive staff person. The location and amenities were brilliant. I would stay here again without hesitation. My only gripe might be how long the wait is for elevators. If you’re in a hurry pad your schedule to deal with the slow lift during peak check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gaume01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 glorious nights early May in a Junior Suite. We have been there 4 other times since the 1990's and had serious concerns given the recent reviews. We love this hotel. Room size excellent. Service friendly and excellent. No better location. Beds were firm and comfy. Room service can be expensive with full breakfast but you can also just order coffee. Find the little cafe next door to the entrance for bargain drink and food. To keep the room cool on hot days, keep the curtains closed and you have to avoid using the master light switch to keep cooling system going while you are out and about..

Reviews.Title: “Yet again the Hotel du Louvre comes up trumps”
Reviews.Author: foxesforever
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in a superb location. Faultless staff. Good meals and comfortable & quiet rooms despite being on the major road

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: srharper
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely superb. We booked our trip through Jetsetter and received a rate we were thrilled with for a Junior Suite. Our room was ready early on the day we arrived, and the staff was very friendly. I had contacted the hotel before we arrived to confirm our reservation and mentioned it was our honeymoon. The hotel had a complementary bottle of champagne and chocolates sent to our room the evening we arrived. What a nice treat! Also, I will have to say the concierge was great. We left all of our guide books at home, and leaned heavily on the concierge desk for advice, and were not once disappointed. My only complaint for the hotel was the prices of the drinks in the hotel bar (a bottled beer was 13.50 euros!), but this can be avoided by walking to any cafe down the street. All in all an absolutely fantastic hotel, great value, and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: micheletes
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary for 8 nights here. The hotel is in a great location for touring by foot and especially train which was so easy to navigate. The hotel staff was warm, friendly and very helpful. The concierge was especially helpful in making suggestions and dinner reservations in other establishments. The room was quite small, no wardrobe other than a large closet to store our clothes, the bathroom was nice except for the door stop right in front of the toliet bowl, ouch when you stubbed your toe on it! We were told we had the largest of the superior rooms. View was great and the doors to the outside balcony were great too. The wallpaper needed to be replace, but the bed was extremely comfortable. Large assortment to choose from for breakfast, good thing it was included in our stay. Expensive otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Classique Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Bees_10
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris in a year and our second stay at Hotel du Louvre. It will always be our home in Paris. Our reservations were for a standard room but upon arrival we were upgraded to a deluxe and an unexpected complimentary bottle of French wine & box of tasty Macaroons. Our gorgeous room overlooked the Avenue de l'Opera and the Opera Garnier; the view was stunning. The room was picture perfect; spacious, clean, king-size bed, a spacious modern bathroom with large tub/shower and the room was extremely quiet and relaxing at the end of our busy day. The entire staff couldn't have been more helpful. Everyone we came in contact with was courteous and polite. We can't think of one complaint. We feel the central location, accommodations, and service were perfect for us. If you really want to enjoy Paris and not have to worry what your accommodations are going to be like, then this is the hotel we highly recommend. We loved our trip to Paris, the people, the shopping, art & history, museums, the whole package. The Hotel du Louvre is part of our love for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great stay”
Reviews.Author: brunello_fan
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel due to its location and it being one of my corporate choices in Paris. I was not disappointed. Traveling with my two children(11&12), we had an enjoyable stay in Room 409. Great view of the louvre and the plaza below. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The Metro was also at our doorstep. The in house restaurant provided a great breakfast buffet. We also dined one evening in the restaurant and we had an excellent meal.They had a great menu for the children and the staff was superb. I would stay again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel; great location.”
Reviews.Author: kty-did
Reviews.Content: we loved being right at a metro stop, 5 min walk from the Louvre and in close proximity to the Tuiileries Gardens, Champs Elysee, etc. and lots of shopping and cafes. We had deluxe double rooms, but had requested adjoining and there were no connecting rooms. the rooms were small by american standards, but very French in style and ambience and very well done. the usual conveniences were not there, like coffee makers in the room, but 'when in Rome', and the weather was perfect then to have the windows open, but there is no air conditioning and i think it would be very hot in summer months. the staff were all most helpful and the morning buffet was out of this world. we totally enjoyed our stay and would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Eric1012
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the front door, the staff treated us with great respect - in an old world and charming sort of way - not the snobish reception you often find in such a nice hotel. We received an unrequested upgrade of our room, an unsolicited bottle of red wine from the hotel mamager, and terrific assistance from the concierge. On little notice, the concierge was able to get us a table for dinner at one of the hottest restaurants in town. The room had great views of the Louvre and Palais Royale, room service was great foir breakfast and a snack, and we had a large bathroom, as well as a walk in closet and dressing area. This was unusual for European hotels, which typically have small bathrooms, somewhat awkward showers, and little closet space. This place is great, steps from the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful hotel, wonderful staff. wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: MrBlue38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel du Louvre sadly for just one night whilst celebrating my 40th birthday. On arrival we were upgraded to a deluse room that had a view of the Oper house. The room wasn't ready but we were treated to complimentary drinks in the Defender bar. The reception staff were very helpful, polite and friendly and made us feel very welcome. The room was lovely and bed very comfortable. The bathroom large and spacious and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was included and the choice was plentiful and the staff again attentive and helpful. Paris is an expensive but fabulous city, this hotel is in as good a location as you could wish to find and is priced accordingly. However by shopping around various booking sites you'll find bargains galore on certain dates. I want to go back to Hotel du Louvre again....hopefully before my next major birthday milestone!!!! Thanks to all the staff at Hotel du Louvre for a memorable and enjoyable birthday.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with character, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hawet
Reviews.Content: When in Paris, we usually stay a few days on the Left Bank and a few days on the Right Bank. On the Right Bank, Hotel du Louvre is always our first choice. The location couldn't be better, we never have to use taxi's or the Metro (although both a taxi stand and a metro station are only a few steps away). So many views are within walking distance of the hotel. For the Louvre Museum you have only to cross the street. The lovely Park of the Tuileries is less than five minutes walking. The Opera can be seen from the front door of the hotel; just walk down the Avenue de l'Opéra. Next to Place Malraux where the hotel is situated, is the Rue du St. Honoré, with many designer shops. Or we might stroll along the quays of the Seine, to the Notre Dame. And just cross the place in front of the hotel to arrive in a world of pure magic: the garden of the palais Royal. The hotel itself is in a lovely old building. The reception area is beautiful. The decoration of the bar and the brasserie / breakfast room is done in style Napoleon III, the rooms are all different. This time we had a large room on the 4th floor, with marvellous views of the place de Palais Royale and the Rue de Rivoli / the Louvre. Of course, if you want a room with such a great view, you'll have to accept a bit of traffic noise, although the double windows are very efficient. (There are also more quiet rooms.) The room had a sitting area with a sofa and two easy chairs, a big writing desk (with a Bose radio), and a King size bed. Good lighting. There also was a big bathroom (with separate shower cubicle), a separate WC room, and a walk-in closet. The decoration of the room was maybe in some places a bit tired looking, but the floor covering was (almost) new. Needless to say, everything was spotlessy clean. The staff are very friendly and efficient, and we are always made to feel welcome. The turn-down service is very good, almost as if your room is cleaned twice a day! The hotel has its own brasserie (with a great terrace). In the morning, a breakfast buffet is served here.. If we could, we would just change two little things: the volume of the muzak in the breakfast room to be turned down, and to be greeted in the morning with a French "Bonjour", and not with an American "Good morning, how are you today". (Although we are very glad that everyone of the staff speaks English, whenever we are struggling with a French turn of speech..) To sum up: a beautiful hotel with character, a great place to stay, in a unique location.

Reviews.Title: “In most other places, this would be a two-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_A_DC_11
Reviews.Content: It is amazing to read the other reviews of this hotel--I can hardly believe they are talking about the same place. The reception staff were superficially friendly, but nonresponsive except when pressed pretty strongly. The room itself was substandard, with a nonfunctional HVAC system. Repairmen were in twice, the HVAC was not fixed, we were given a fan, and when that proved to be a failure in this hot room we were given a portable air conditioner that require the window to be open to the noisy Rue du Rivoli. At no time was another room offered. We were told the HVAC would be fixed in three weeks, when we would obviously no longer be there. The room itself was pretty drab and worn looking. Check-in was very disappointing. We arrived early on a trans-Atlantic flight and did not expect to receive a room. But the desk staff repeatedly offered misinformation about when our room would be available. When we finally returned at the official check-in time of 15:00, we were told we would have to wait another hour. The breakfast at the hotel was also rather disappointing--certainly far below what one would expect. Even the coffee was off--this is Paris?

Reviews.Title: “A high quality experience”
Reviews.Author: TravellingColoradans
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great location. Staff were professional, always helpful and friendly. We asked the concierge a lot of questions and he readily provided good answers. The hotel is not for travellers with a tight budget but worth every euro you spend on the room. The prices in the bar were a bit breathtaking, e.g., 18 euros for a martini. Interestingly we ordered room service one evening and the price of dinner wasn't too far from what we spent in a cafe around the corner on another evening. Our room looked across to the Comedie Francais and, as someone recently wrote, the windows open to let fresh air into the room. The gym is very small but ok. All in all, great location, nice staff, good rooms, pleasant surroundings (lobby) and acceptable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: bartyman007
Reviews.Content: Good location, good hotel, received an upgrade to junior-suite, tickets for visiting louvre ready upon arrival so didnot have too cue in line but entered via express entrance, nice dinner (it is a BRASSERIE, not a restaurant!). maybe a bit expensive, but what do you want!?

Reviews.Title: “Overall lovely”
Reviews.Author: divinemisspriss
Reviews.Content: Hotel is elegant but for the staircase surrounding the back elevator, which I found garish, but then again, Mom liked it. Room was simple but quite tasteful, with a spacious bathroom that sustained hot water indefinitely. Also crucial is the free wifi. Location is perfect for travellers seeking proximity to a landmark like the Louvre, but the very close proximity of shops, bars, cafe, and metro stops will please those looking for more of a "neighborhood" vibe. (If price is an issue, do note that tourist locale will coincide with high neighborhood prices.) One minor skirmish aside, the service is excellent. I joked the whole time that I could ask the concierge anything and get a poised and efficient answer. Since I work in customer service I'm often extra critical, but this staff was exemplary. I read tripadvisor reviews prior to booking, and I wanted to write again to bolster the confidence of anyone hemming and hawing. It's a fine hotel--just book it and go on with your life.

Reviews.Title: “OUtstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lynn85284
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I are staying at the Hotel du Louvre starting March 14. I have e-mailed the hotel with many questions regarding our stay. I've asked everything from where are the nearest ATMs to questions about hair straigteners! Every question has been answered the very next day. If the customer service at the hotel is anything like their on-line customer service, I know we are in for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room choice essential”
Reviews.Author: karamelgrl
Reviews.Content: You just cannot beat the proximity to the Louvre--literally steps away, and some room views actually look into the museum. The restaurant, Brasserie du Louvre was good--romantic atmosphere, beautiful glasses and table setting and plush red booths. Very good service, incredibly tasty food (I had delectable oysters and lamb with tandoori that melted in my mouth, also tender scallops). I found my room plain, not unattractive, but plain, accustomed as I am to textured, detailed French hotel rooms, though the hallway art was fun and interesting. Worst part was an ungodly rattling heater that came on at intervals and roared so loudly that my friend and I resorted to stuffing our ears and each sleeping with a pillow over our head. I do have friends who have stayed before and found their rooms decorative, so I recommend asking about the look of the room, and, of course, if that rattling heater has been sent to a well deserved grave. One thing: as we prepared to leave the room, bags in hand, at exactly two minutes past checkout, the phone rang and the front desk said "Yes? you are supposed to be leaving" or something to that effect. Ha! I assured them I was on my way down and out, lest the gendarmes come to escort me. But overall, I did like.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jimberooney
Reviews.Content: From a location point of view you cannot beat Hotel Du Louvre - located next to the Louvre and within walking distance of all the best parts of Paris. The hotel itself is beautifully presented and the rooms are pretty good. The heating problem described by some reviewers has been fixed and the temperature is perfect. The only negatives are that the showers lack water pressure and tend to run hot/cold, the concierge was a bit stuffy and not overly helpful (in stark contrast to the staff at the reception area who were very pleasant and helpful) and the bar was horribly overpriced (24E for a glass of champagne, 13.5E for a beer etc). We did not eat the breakfast (29E seems excessive when all you want is a croissant and a cafe espresso) but there are plenty of good breakfast options close to the hotel. Given the location I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “service and location great”
Reviews.Author: LaneFamilyLincolnUK
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were immediately impressed by the warm and effecient service of the reception staff, who took the trouble to show us to our room and carried out luggage - not a service you get very often these days. Hotel very stylish and comfortable, breakfast buffet style was excellent with huge choice and fast and friendly service. Room was ok, bathroom well appointed but at nighty the room was hot and stuffy - air con didnt work.. Our room was at the back of the hotel so if we opened the widow we were kept awake by thevery noisy air conditining unit. Bar was very good although pricey. Overall it was a good stay, location was great - just get your air con to work and we would be back for another stay

Reviews.Title: “More than I hoped for, better than I dreamed.”
Reviews.Author: Kathynye
Reviews.Content: First-class location, first-class hotel, first-class staff…The Hotel du Louvre is first class all the way. More than I hoped for, better than I dreamed. I have to start at the beginning. I booked my flights in July of 2010 for my Feb. 2011 trip to Paris, France. Planning to travel alone, I had over 6 months to find a safe hotel with a good location in Paris. For months, I researched hotels and reviews. Reviews are very important; the people tell it like it is. Location and price were my deciding factors. No matter how many hotels I looked at, I kept coming back to Hotel du Louvre. The only reason I didn’t book right away was price, I was close to my budget, but it was still higher than I wanted to go. I wanted a safe area, a room with a view and breakfast included. Every few days I would check prices with the links on Trip Advisor, i.e. Expedia.com and hotel.com and it was still out of my price range. I do not know why I did not go the Hotel du Louvre website sooner, but in November after 4 months of looking and comparing, I went to the Hotel du Louvre website. They had a Winter Special, if you booked 2 months in advance you received 20% off the room and buffet breakfast. That is a HUGE savings. I did not think of looking further and booked the room within 5 minutes. There were many emails from me, to the hotel, with questions about the hotel and rooms. The staff was wonderful and they answered all of my questions in a timely manner. They did not make me feel like I was pestering with all of my inquiring. Thank you, Virginie Picard-Lavergne. Upon check in, the smiling face of Mirna greeted me. Hint: if you are coming in on an early flight from the US and you arrive at the hotel at 9 am, check in is not until 3 p.m. So either pay for the night before arrival or request an early arrival and pay a little extra to get the room sooner. I did not do this and my request was for a specific room so I did have to wait until 3 p.m. check-in, my fault, not the hotel. It was worth the wait. Best room in the house as far as I was concerned. It had it all, a spacious bedroom and a marble bathroom with a view of the Paris Opera house. The bathroom had a wonderful Parisian balcony where I could step out to take photos. The bedroom had a balcony with a view of the Eiffel tower. It was almost a suite. In addition, it was one of the Superior class rooms. Wi-Fi was included. Hint: bring a plug that is compatible with the electric outlets in the room so you can recharge. If you forget, the hotel has some available. Bed was excellent, pillows and duvet, so comfortable. I had a small fear because of previous reviews. I have fibromyalgia and am very sensitive to firm beds. It was not a problem. Best night sleep I had in a long time. Some reviews complained about the metro noise. I did not hear it, my room was on the 5th floor but even when having breakfast or sitting in the lobby there was never any metro noise. Room temp was fine. I was cold, but adjusted the heat. I wish I had written down the name of my maid. She was a great help when I became ill (bronchitis). She gave me slippers for my feet to keep my feet warm in the marble floored bathroom and an extra box of tissues. She is such a kind woman. Concierge and bellmen.. all excellent. Standout.. Laurent… I traveled alone, had so many questions, and sometimes wanted to share a few words with someone. He made me feel like no question or comment was trivial. Laurent is very informative on many levels of Paris sites and travel routes. Breakfast buffet..food for all types of diet. Scrambled eggs, potato cakes, bacon, sausages, heated sliced tomatoes and mushrooms. Many varieties of toast, jams, nutella, butter , rolls, croissants,’ cold cereals and fresh fruits, Vegetarian items and a sliced cold cuts and fresh cheeses station. Beverages are tea, coffee, hot chocolate, orange and grapefruit juices. If you go away hungry, it’s your fault. The only problem I encountered was that the carafe of hot water was never hot enough to steep the tea properly. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel du Louvre. It may cost a little more than your budget allows, then again, maybe cost is not a problem, either way, a stay at the Hotel du Louvre is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptinal Service”
Reviews.Author: pedidocTx
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris to attend a Medical Congress. The venue for the conference was in a Hotel in Monparnasse which did not interest me as far as location, service, and convinience to transportation. I contacted the Hotel du Louvre with some questions after reading some comments on Trip Advisor. The Staff of the Hotel was very prompt in answering my questions prior to my arrival and solving any problems. Upon arrival to the Hotel the Staff was gracious and accomodating, the General Manager, Mr. Alessandro Cresta, send us a welcome letter and made sure our accomodations were satisfactory and indeed made sure we were happy with our room. The Bed was very comfortable, the pillows and linen were lovely. The entire staff is friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. We Dined at the Brasserie du Louvre and the service and the food were excellent. The Defender Bar was very relaxing after a long day and the Jazz music was fun to listen. As far as transportation, the Metro is right ouside, as well as multiple bus lines accross the way. You can not beat the beautiful square and the proximity to the Louvre, across the street, as well as all the beautiful landmarks and vistas of the 1er arrondissement. You can walk or take a short Metro ride practically everywhere from this beautiful XIX century building with all the modern amenities. I doubt I will stay anywhere else in my next trip to Paris. Thank you, to all the staff at the Hotel du Louvre!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel (3 star pricing) next to the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: jgrosenkrantz
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location with amenities that rival the name hotels like the Crillon and Le Meurice. Excellent lobby bar. Clean rooms. Classic.

Reviews.Title: “Parisien charm in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Firewalker50
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I had a business meeting before our leisure weekend started. It is across the road from the Musee du Louvre and right next to the Metro 1 line only 2 stops from the RER B train line. So it was perfect for walking and moving around to other areas. We found all the staff charming and very helpful. The hotel has a traditional feel which we like. The superior room wasa bit small but expected in Paris, and the bed huge and superbly comfortable. The bedroom and bathroom are probably in need of refurbishment, however, facilities are fairly good (lit magnifying mirror, hairdrier and free safe). There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The room was warm at bedtime and it seemed difficult to lower the temperature. However that did not disturb our sleep and we did not need to open a window on this occasion. We found the prices in the minibar and the lounge to be very expensive: Example: €8 for can of coke in minibar and €22,50 for 2 small bottles of perrier and one cup espresso in lounge. We did not eat in the restaurant since we were out most of the day returning late. The business centre costs €12 for half an hour. There is a small richly decorated lounge where people meet for afternoon coffee; a glass of champagne; for business; in the evening listening to live music; or simply enjoying the weekend newspaper. Breakfast is very fresh and includes delicious smoked salmon, a selection of cheeses and freshly cut fresh fruit salad. However, it costs 32 euros and seems expensive for what it is. Other hotels have a much wider range of breakfast. We booked a special weekend rate which included breakfast and late checkout (6pm) on Sunday which was a great arrangement for us. It is central to walk around shops,cafes; visiting Musee du Louvre and Jardin des Tuilleries . Within a few minutes you are walking along the Seine and within a few steps you can be on one of the main metro lines. Given the proximity of the Louvre, you should be aware it is surrounded by roads, however, we were not disturbed at all by noise. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would return. We congratulate the hotel on the quality of the service we received during our stay. (in the tick box selections, some of the descriptions would apply to some parts of the hotel but not others, however we have highlighted the words which apply to some/most of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bdk20
Reviews.Content: The Hotel deLeuvre has it all. Location: Across the street from the Louvre Museum: The rooms were beautiful, Old Paris at it's best. The bed was the most comfortable I've had at any hotel stay. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. I would highly reccomened. Romantic, and perfect for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with charming, welcoming and so helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonMaryR
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at a very busy time in the evening with confirmed and paid for reservation made via an unrelated website. The receptionist, Mathieu, could find no trace of it and after various searches, took the contact details of the website and he and his manager made phone calls to sort out the problem but all the time reassuring me that there would be a room for me. He could see that it was all very upsetting and distressing for me - he could not have been more hospitable. He and his manager then suggested that it would better for us to wait in the bar and we were offered a complimentary drink which was just what we needed! In the end, the problem was resolved - NOT one created by the hotel - and I was given a better quality room than the one originallly booked. I could not speak more highly of the attitude of staff. We also had lunch in the Brasserie the next day and the food was excellent. The redecoration of the Brasserie has really brought it to life. As you can see, I am a fan for life!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dora2602
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for it's brilliant location in one of our favourite areas of Paris. We also thought how nice the hotel looked from the street. We were very dissapointed. The room we had was very small with dismal and tired decor. The beds were as other posts have mentioned very uncomfortable and the room was very hot and stuffy. We could not however open the window as it was so so noisy outside, even after I had specifically requested a quiet room because we were there for work and needed sleep! Furthermore this is the most expensive hotel I have ever stayed in. Our bill for four cups of tea was 40Euros - when we even allowed in the bar, as residents of the hotel one night we were very rudely and abrubtly told the bar was full and we could not have a drink, even though there were plenty of free chairs. Over the whole trip the staff were less than accommodating. This is not a four star quality hotel and best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Hot small room”
Reviews.Author: Jedco42
Reviews.Content: The hotel de louvre has a great location and that is about it. Small over priced rooms that our very poorly climates controlled. Beds are horrible and hard as a rock. You can do much better for this money in paris

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fritzFlorida
Reviews.Content: I will deffinitely stay at this hotel again. The location across from the Louvre is amazing. It is also close to the Metro and the bus stop shuttle from the airport. The staff here are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice, with great bathrooms. The only complaint I would have is the beds weren't very comfortable. My room had no view, but my other family members had a beautiful view of the louvre from their room. This is a great hotel that has a boutique feel. Well priced given it's location and ease of accessibility to walking Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dannycarlucci
Reviews.Content: The hotel's best asset is its location. As the name implies, it is across the street from the Louvre. There is also a Metro station right outside of the hotel. It is also within walking distance of many other sites such as the opera, the d'Orsay, and Notre Dame (although this was a little bit more of a hike). The room was warm as the air-conditioning was turned off. There was a balcony, but you could not keep the doors opens due to street noise. As mentioned in previous reviews, you can hear the rumbling of the Metro trains as they pass underneath the hotel. It is quite loud and starts early in the morning but around mid-night. The food in the hotel's restaurant was good, but the service was lacking. The breakfast buffet was good, but the atmosphere was loud and frenzied. Certainly not relaxing. They also charge you to print a boarding pass - tacky! I would recommend the hotel to others, with the caveat that there is a fair amount of noise with the trains, but the location helps to make up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Wonderful Anniversary Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria721
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a great location. Close to shops, restaurants and attractions. The staff was friendly and helpful. The also offer great winter packages which include tickets to major attractions including The Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Just too hot during winter....”
Reviews.Author: LodonBrazilFrance
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel...the only problem was the central heating that was unbearable and the hotel staff was unable to sort it...you could easily sweat like a pig on the hotel floors and in your room and you heating controls just doesnt work because is set by a central...really bad! I had to keep windows open during night on a freezing cold weather outside to manage to sleep, then it would get too cold...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollynorfolk
Reviews.Content: I waspleasantly suprised after booking this hotel as part of a package,it definately exceeded my expectations.It was clean,lovely rooms,massive bathrooms and full of character.The staff were helpful and friendly.You really couldn't ask for a more conveniently located 4 * hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel ideally situated in downtown paris , rooms are fine as are the bathrooms, breakfast is very good but french so limited hot stuff ,service at the concierge and reception is average and I was very disturbed by the microscopic and expensive glasses of red wine you got in the bar of the hotel , If you are ok with a less ideal location you can have better value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but underground trains a big problem”
Reviews.Author: Brooke1403
Reviews.Content: In Paris you expect noise and the two sets of Windows shut out the traffic noise. But to lay in bed and listen to underground trains vibrate the building spoilt sleep on each of the 3 days. The air conditioning didn't work and the shower was broken. The location is the prime reason for staying but the rooms need investment. On balance it's ok but only for heavy sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “A quick jaunt across the pond to see some museums, shop and explore”
Reviews.Author: Carrie_Huguenin
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Louvre was perfect for our weekend trip. Considering how little research I did before booking, we really lucked out. The hotel is ideally located for our desire to see the sites along the riverfront. We had no complaints with any aspect of the hotel room or services. The room may be small by American standards, but it was totally adequate and the bathroom wasn't claustrophobic at all. We couldn't check in until 3PM on the day of our arrival, but there was no problem stowing our luggage in their secure baggage room while we explored Paris. We didn't use the free internet access in the room, but I imagine for a longer stay we would have used it. We were initially surprised to find that the room with 2 twin beds would have them set up as a single king bed with two side-by-side mattresses and two duvets. Again, the room wasn't huge, so this configuration was really the only option for the space and wasn't a problem for us. We had a view of the Comedie Francais from our window too. With no forewarning and a rather late-night request, the concierge even found us a great little bistro down the street late on Saturday night when we were exhausted and just wanted a quiet, relaxed dinner with copius wine. Everyone at and near the hotel spoke English to use when we failed to speak particularly fluent french (which was really nice, but unfortunate for us since it allowed us to wimp out on trying harder to use our very rusty french vocab).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and warm fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wiscolisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just back from our trip to Europe. Our first stop was Paris and we stayed at Hotel Du Louvre. It was an excellent location!! We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. The hotel was beautiful and our room was very nice and spotless. We were on vacation to celebrate our anniversary and the hotel had a complementary bottle of Bordeaux wine waiting for us in our room, thanking us for sharing our celebration with them. Check in and check out was a breeze, and the staff could have not been more gracious during our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel!! Only word of caution, is the breakfast is NOT included, and it is extremely expensive, so I would recommend going to one of the many restaurants in the neighborhood. I read that myself from a previous tip, and it was a good recommendation . The concierge there were very helpful. Don't hesitate to ask them to get you tickets. We bought our tickets to the Louvre through them and it saved us a long wait in line!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with average service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: picric
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week vacation to London and Paris. Having started our trip in London staying at the Mandarin Oriental, we were quite disappointed with the average level of service and accomodations we received at the Hotel du Louvre in comparison to the Mandarin (and the du Louvre was more expensive). The location is wonderful and that is obviously what you are paying for. Our room overlooked the Louvre and is in a lovely square surrounded by cafes, restaurants and shops. The disappointment was the quality of the accomodations and service. Everything is quite "tired" including the furniture in the rooms and restuarant. The staff is "pleasant" but no one goes out of their way for you. As a comparative, both hotels knew we were celebrating our 20th anniversary. The Mandarin welcomed us to our room with a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a bed covered in red rose petals. The du Louvre never made mention of our celebration in any way. The concierges at the Mandarin consistently made recommendations for us regarding attractions, restaurants, etc and always confirmed with a written note in our room. When making reservations at the du Louvre, the concierge told us he would let us know by note or phone call when something was scheduled but never did. We had to follow up with them. In our room, we had to call housekeeping twice to ask for more tissue paper because although we left out the empty box, it was never replaced. I also found it insulting that they charge you to use the internet when you are paying over $500/night versus 24/7 business center access at the Mandarin at no charge. Although our stay in Paris was certainly lovely, the Hotel du Louvre is definitely only "average" at 5 star pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms we had were not like in the photos”
Reviews.Author: vtipping
Reviews.Content: The room was quite nice, two sinks in a very large bathroom. Although did not look like the ones in the photos. The waiter service in the dining room was not very good. Not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: szjam
Reviews.Content: This was may third visit to Paris and by far the best hotel I have stayed in so far there but you do pay for it. We stayed 2 nights, location was great, very central and next to Metro station and The Louvre. Staff very courteous, we did not eat in hotel restaurant, but bar prices very expensive. Stayed in a deluxe room which was more spacious than expected given we were in central Paris - yes the rooms and paintwork are a bit old and chipped but it was clean and a problem we had with the curtain was fixed straight away. Our room overlooked a square and had views of The Louvre - it was quiet and had free WiFi access included. There is a cafe just outside front door of hotel and lots of other restaurants around and across the street. We had no real complaints and really enjoyed being in that location and the character of the hotel made our trip to Paris more memorable than staying in a big chain type of hotel. Would we stay there again? Maybe but not because of anything negative just that there are so many hotels in Paris and different areas to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: clf10
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not have been more perfect! The service was outstanding, especially the concierge. I will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value...”
Reviews.Author: dewarro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three wonderful nights in Aug this year, and I have nothing but praise for this hotel. Booked a room with breakfast and free wifi and found we were so close to everything including a super little pastery shop and wine store. We found we could eat a big breakfast and not be hungry again till dinner. This helps when you are trying to save a little in an expensive city. If we couldn't walk to a point of interest, the underground was right outside the door. And the staff were wonderful, especially the concierge! We spent several hours looking out the bathroom window with a glass of wine to the Opera house down the road and just watching Paris go by our room. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: preciosa919
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband. This hotel has an excellent location, right next to the Louvre and the Tuillerie Gardens, the Comedie Francaise and walking distance from Notre Dame, the Musee D'Orsay and various other points of interest. You're also right next to the Palais Royale underground train stop - so it's easy to get to other locations that are farther away. The hotel has a decent restaurant, but the service took forever - (even by European standards) our dinner was a 3.5 hour meal. The hotel bar on the ground floor was a cute place to hang out and they had two Excellent jazz groups play there for two nights of the week during our stay. However, be prepared to pay ridiculously high prices for the drinks there! The rooms were a good size, and clean enough. The concierge was very helpful when it came to booking reservations for dinner and making recommendations. I would recommend this hotel, and stay here again, but I would warn that it is a bit overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Great find thru an online booking service.”
Reviews.Author: Terese1972
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip back in Feb, 2010 and it was well worth the wait. I was a bit nervous because I got such a good deal on the package that I thought for sure I'd end up in some broom closet in the basement for what I paid for it. Plus I heard from a few people that a four star in Europe was more like a 3 star in the States and that the rooms & bathrooms were very small. That certainly was not the case at the Hotel du Louvre. My room had a king bed with nice high thread count sheets and it was very comfortable. We were on the 5th (top) floor with a breathtaking view of the Commedie Française - the Louvre Museum was on the opposite side of the building. The double doors leading to the balcony blocked out the majority of the sounds of the city so sleep came easy. Though the bedroom did not have a dresser there was enough closet space to accommodate both my fiance's clothes and mine. The bathroom was HUGE. Lovely marble everywhere - with a separate water closet with a bidet. The bathroom also had a balcony with french style door - with frosted glass so no one could see in. There was only a single sink, but it was an over-sized basin and the counter was long enough that two could stand there comfortably and not be in each others way. As for the location, it was perfect. The Louvre museum is literally right next door and there is a metro station pretty much right outside the front door. If you prefer taxis, there is a stand right across the square and the bellman is always willing to hail a cab for you. Everyone at the hotel was wonderful and so accommodating - especially Julien and Eric at the concierge desk. Props to them. A few tips - get the Museum pass. It's well worth it and it covers everything from the Louvre, to Versailles and everything in between. Moulin Rouge was a disappointment. We paid a little over $400 for the dinner and show after. Not worth half that. The Segway Tour (done by the Fat Tire Bike Co.) was awesome. Lastly, if you want to save some money, DON'T, I repeat DON'T buy sodas at lunch or dinner. I found that out the hard way. The price does vary from area to area, but in all the touristy places it runs around 5.50 Euros for a medium Coke and 7.20 Euros for a large coke. The sandwich was 6.5 Euros so less than a large soda. Unless you want to have a nice glass of wine, get the tap water at lunch and dinner. You can pick up a bottle of soda at one of them many small market stores for between 2-3 Euros. Oh and taxis have a minimum charge after a certain hour. I think it may be around 7 or 8pm. It's 6.10 Euro even if the meter only reads 4 by the time you reach your destination. Lastly, if you are planning on going, take a look a the metro station set up first. I am a native Bostonian and I thought that I would have the " T " down pat, but it was a very confusing set up. It would have been better had I done a bit more research, but it was an adventure. We had a great time, spent a lot of money, but it was worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Flawed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: Finding a good hotel in Paris remains a challenge. Having stayed in this city almost every year for the last decade, I am still not happy with any of the hotels I have chosen here. Maybe it is just that the standards in Paris are low by international benchmarks. Anyway, let me start with the positives on Hotel Du Louvre: it is in a great location across the road from the Louvre; it has a passable gym; the free internet was reasonably fast; the welcoming letter with bottle of wine was an unexpected touch; the reception area staff and room service staff were very courteous and friendly; and I slept soundly every night. But the negatives: for 320 euro for a so called deluxe room I expected a larger room - there was barely enough space to move. I cannot imagine how people in the next category down would manage. The bathroom, while nicely lined with travertine marble, had one of those over bath showers with a glass screen which did not stop water leaking onto the floor. Unfortunately the hotel is located over a metro line and so every minute or so there was a thunder like rumble from below. Fortunately, this seemed to abate from midnight to 6am. But the room soundproofing was poor, probably because it had an adjoining door to the next room where a lady and her dog could be heard readily. Noise from the street however was not noticeable even though my room on the third floor overlooked the adjacent square with a big window providing a wonderful outlook and lots of light. But it was the included breakfast and the manner in which it was provided that let the hotel down badly. Firstly, the breakfast ends at the ridiculous time of 10am. At 9:30 the staff concentrate on setting up tables for lunch rather than re-stocking the buffet. The buffet itself was quite varied but mostly of poor quality. The quality of the pastries was particularly low for Paris. Ready made coffee in jugs are already on the tables, but not necessarily full or even hot. The staff, while friendly, herded people into small sections of the already table congested cafe as if trying to avoid the necessity of cleaning up later. One morning I arrived and had to wait 5 minutes while a waiter cleared a table in a congested section of the cafe even though other tables were already set. I refused to sit where he wanted because the floor under the table was littered with crumbs, as if a pig had been eating there. The next morning they paid me back by locating me jammed next to the register. The overall impression is that they don't want you to have breakfast because you are an inconvenience. And so, I am disappointed with Hotel Du Louvre. I was expecting more, especially given it is a member of the Concorde chain, the operators of Hotel de Crillon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MichaelELee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 18th century style hotel, across the road from the Louvre, lots of great cafes and restaurants . Beautifully appointed junior suite , with great views of the plaza below. Staff were great Mirna at the Front desk was the most vibrant friendly outgoing and helpful young lady we can across on our European trip. highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: art1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. The location is very convenient. The hotel has an "old world" elegant feel to it. Very "Parisienne" The rooms were smallish but very comfortable. Very nice linens, pillows, etc. We had adjoining rooms with a king bed arrangement in one and twin beds in the other for our teenage children. The bathrooms could use a little work - the showers weren't so great. but otherwise clean. The breakfast buffet was very nice and worked well for starting our day. Overall a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tokyk
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Paris on several times and have discovered that friendly service can be quite hit and miss. I have to say I was presently surprised at how friendly and attentive the staff were at this hotel. The location is fantastic and the neighborhood has a great selection of cafes within walking distance. As a solo traveller it was nice to be able to pop into the bar and have a drink and not feel not feel out of place. I had secured a junior suite so the room size was quite nice, even had a walk in closet! My room was on the top floor (which I had requested and they accommodated) and faced the interior courtyard. At first I was not happy about the room facing in, but the advantage was it was very quiet - which can be an issue in Paris! Nice Hotel, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, amazing spacious, high threadcount sheets, big bathroom. An incredible breakfast. Perfect location. Spoke english. Great concierge. Nice little lounge . Lived It and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location! Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: frankviz
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from 3 nights staying here, and we were truly impressed! First off it's literally next to the Louvre, and well situated centrally to all of the spots my family and I wanted to visit. the staff, especially the concierge staff were really helpful, and made this a truly memorable Parisian vaction!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: flagfan
Reviews.Content: I had one day in Paris and had to prioritize my activities and at the top of the list was the Louvre--this turned out to be the perfect hotel, right across the street from the museum. But that's not the only reason to stay at this hotel--service was good; the room (mini-suite) was room and had French balconies looking out on the interesting streets, and the food (room service) was excellent. Also one of the best bathrooms I've seen--enormous bathtub and separate shower in a large room with 2 separate sinks and the toilet in a separate little room next door. Rates were also reasonable. But it's hard not to get back to the location. Not only was it across the street from the Louvre, but it was just down the street from the Opera House--a great street to walk down--a lot of nice little shops and a real feel for Paris. Could not have picked a better hotel for a nice little one-day stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vsingh
Reviews.Content: I was taken by surprise by this hotel. I booked it on-line and was not quite sure. However, when I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised by its location (on the doorstep of the louvre and les jardins des tullieries) and everything else. The hotel itself and its amenities were great. I had included breakfast in my package which was great although after 3 days I would have welcome some new items on the menu. The staff was helpful although I did not get my wake up call in time or at all on one occasion. Extra pillows, blankets and towels were available. The one thing that I did not like was that the second bed in my junior suite was actually a couch bed which was not really comfortable. There area lot of great restaurants close by. I would recommend this hotel. Vsingh

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ilpadre42
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Louvre is located across the street from The Louvre, a half block from the subway. it is beautiful. You can walk out the front door and look at the Garnier Opera down the street. You can step out on your balcony and look into the palace on one side and the Louvre on the other. You could not ask for a better location. The price was reasonable. My only complaint was taht I had a rather large amount of money stolen from my room in the hotel and the management did not seem concerned. My guess is that you would love to stay here--just keep your valuables with you or in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice size rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TexasKatdaddy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to London and Paris where we had several rooms to compare this one too. This was the largest room by far, we had a junior suite in most of our hotels and this one is actually similar to US rooms in size. The bathrooms were quite large and very nice as well. The toilet is separated from the bathroom which we found nice as well. We had a king with a sofabed for our son and the turndown service was always well done, arranging my son's stuffed animals for him. The location is great as well. Our room faced the Louvre which meant some traffic noise but it wasn't bad. The decor is not amazing by any means but was nice. There are lots of small restaurants nearby, prices getting better the farther away from the Louvre you get. We never found a great place to eat but if we had more time we would've looked in to it better. We did miss the taxis in London because you can't fit 5 people in to the French taxis and had to take 2 taxis everywhere we went. I would recommend seeing the Louvre on Wednesday night between 6 and 9pm, less crowded and spectacular lighting at night around the pyramid; visit the Eiffel Tower at night as well too. We took a small horse drawn carriage around Paris which was great, the concierge can arrange it for you. The carriage picks you up at the Eiffel Tower, it hold 4 adults but we fit in our son as well. The hotel has a very nice breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, fresh juices, etc. It was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful European hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 2Bees_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we spent 5 wonderful nights in this very comfortable hotel. Like others have written here, the location is ideal and the staff couldn't be more helpful or courteous. Our Deluxe Room had an extremely comfortable king sized bed and a superb bathroom. While we didn't have a whole lot of walking room around the bed, for the two of us it was adequate. After all, we were out seeing the sights most of our time instead of sitting in our hotel room. The hotel met all of our expectations and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lynninparis
Reviews.Content: We were treated so well at this hotel, patient, kind and helpful without exception. One of the best breakfast buffets I've ever had and the location can't be any better for central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, quiet rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: texaslady523
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 5th floor had two small balconies so we could step out and view the Louvre all the way to the Arc De Triumph. We were there on Bastille Day, the planes flew directly overhead, what an unexpected experience. Room was attended each time we left and returned. The do no disturb sign kept staff from knocking when we were in the room. They were helpful with voltage and current plug converters (ours would not work). They made reservations, got tickets and confirmed our shuttle to airport. No problems. Most important THE AIR CONDITIONER WORKED just like they do in Texas

Reviews.Title: “A good comfy stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Bache
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights last summer after having had 2 weeks in the south of France. We had a junior suite located in the corner of the top floor. This gave us a great view of the Louvre and could look down into the exhibitions from our room. The room was nice and spacious, with a tasteful 19th century decor. The bathroom was modern and had all amenities. The reception was friendly and helpful, with a good car valet service. The valet didn't remove my Jag from the front of the hotel at first, so the traffic had to manoeuvre around the car, mais c'est Paris mon ami. And nobody seemed to mind. The hotel is in walking distance of almost all the sights in Paris. The Eiffel tower is approx 30 min. away and Arc de Triomphe the same. If I should point out a negative aspect, then it would be that the hallways does look a bit worn down and it is annoying that the hotel doesn't have a proper car entrance. But these points are minor and I wouldn't mind coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Leajv
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Du Louvre is fabulous for taking off in any direction to explore Paris. The metro is outside the door, the Louvre (where you could spend a week) is outside the door. The cafe outside the front door serves the best coffee I have had in my life and the jazz music the hotel has in its bar a couple of nights a week was excellent. All staff a very helpful and speak perfect english. We had a deluxe room which was great iwth the doors opening up onto the little square bordered by the Louvre. The room was quite spacious considering europe standards. The breakfast in the morning was very good. This hotel is in a busy part of Paris but you are in the heart of everything. I would definitely go back again - which I intend to do!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey in High Season; but Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: aa9046
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located near Musee du Louvre. We stayed for 6 nights in a Junior Suite, Room 459. The room was well appointed and decorated in deep rich reds. This suite faces the front of the Hotel with great views of the Opera House. Our suite had two beautiful marble bathrooms. We had two flat screen TVs, a Bose Radio & CD Player, in room safe, Robes & Slippers and a Hairdryer. One great surprise was that the room was supplied with a bottleopener and corkscrew, which came in helpful when we bought and enjoyed some wine. The toilettries were from Annick Goutal and had a pleasant scent. The taps in the bathrooms were hooked up to a filter and were perfect for drinking water (we refilled our Evian bottles daily). The concierge is very approachable and found us some great bistros and cafes. You can purchase a Museum Pass directly from the Hotel (they will charge it to your room (it's a €2 surcharge) ). The only negatives I can report were: 1) the Air Conditioning on the 4th floor could not keep up with the 80 degree weather outside and the room got stuffy. 2) the Hotel is non-smoking, but we had smoke from neighboring rooms waft in. Overall, a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location,but expected more for the money”
Reviews.Author: buer
Reviews.Content: I was charged with planning all details of a grand, once in a lifetime trip to Paris and surrounds for my 80 year old mother in law. She was being accompanied by my 19 year old son, who is fluent in French. From all the Trip Advisor reviews I read and the photos featuring the hotel, I knew this would be a great choice for such an event. The hotel decor was indeed stunning. The jr. suite booked was a disappointment as the photos deluded one into thinking they would be more spacious than they actually were. I even ended up contacting the hotel after hearing their disappointment, to make sure they hadn't actually been put into a deluxe standard room. I was assured they were in a junior suite. Considering that the two travellers were spending an entire week at the hotel in a pricey room, I expected the hotel staff to be somewhat more attentive to their needs and questions. They weren't.. The hotel location couldn't be beat. Everything in Paris worth seeing was within walking distance or the Metro stop was just outside the hotel. Also, I had arranged for small bus tours to outlying areas in France. Because of this hotel's zip code, the two could be picked up and dropped off directly at their hotel-no need to walk a distance to a central meeting area tour meeting point. This was important, as my mother in-law has trouble walking. My next trip to Paris, I will probably stay at the Hotel du Louvre. I will arrive with lower expectations than I sent my two travellers with.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel located within walking distance to main attractions!”
Reviews.Author: triciadc
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here while we were in Paris! It is only about 1 1/2 blocks to the main entrance to the Louvre Museum - close to the Opera Garnier, Rue St. Honore, Tuilleries Gardens, Orsay and Orangerie museums, and restaurants - metro station right in front - fantastic hotel staff - friendly and goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Their breakfast buffet is delicious and massive! We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: MimiMountPleasant_SC
Reviews.Content: Every hotel has mixed reviews and we were a little concerned about Hotel du Louvre. Our concerns were not warranted. Everyone from the bell staff and reception staff to the housekeeping staff, concierge staff, and restaurant could not have been nicer. Everyone helped us very pleasantly although we have very limited French. The breakfast buffet was all you could ever want and ran the gamut from eggs and bacon to miso soup. Something for everyone. We had a lovely stay. My only advice: ask for an inside (courtyard) room as the noise on rue de Rivoli can be loud. The location is wonderful for exploring and a metro station is just outside the back entrance to the hotel. We walked virtually everywhere we wanted to go and used taxis only a few times.
