Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelatty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for our trip to Paris for the Memorial Day weekend. This was our third time staying there, and it continues to be one of the hotels in Europe we really enjoy. We arrived at 9:00 AM (check in time is 3:00 PM) and the room was not ready. We dropped off our bags, went for a cup of coffee and took a short stroll on the Rue de Rivoli, and when we returned shortly after 10:00 AM, the room was ready. The room was a decent size, and our window overlooked the Louvre. It was on the Rue de Rivoli but you did not hear any street noise. This hotel is perfectly situated for a short stay in Paris, seems everything is within walking distance. If you want to go further, there is a metro station right outside the hotel. The breakfast was very good, with hot selections as well as breads, meats, cheese, fruit, cereal and yogurt. The concierge was always helpful in making dinner suggestions and booking reservations. All the staff members we met were very friendly and helpful at all times. I highly recommend the Hotel du Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “If you are ? were to stay give this well located hotel a look”
Reviews.Author: 3PAG
Reviews.Content: Overall location was an A+++ Shopping food sites everything close enough to walk. We had a junior suite room 421 corner room very spacious. Walk in closet -Bathroom great, but you are in Paris out and about enjoy outside not the room. The room was very nice the staff great help with tickets etc. Umbrellas for the rain were available. Great location, great staff (spoke english) and Great city. Would not go wrong with this one also a bonus easy to find when you are there a football throw from the glass pyrmid.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and great hotel and bedroom”
Reviews.Author: SandySussex
Reviews.Content: Went away for three nights with My Brother and his teenage children visiting from Austrailia. It was their first time in Paris. The hotel was a package deal with eurostar. I am glad i booked before looking at some of the reviews as many of them were not good, we thought it was great value for money and in a great place. We had 5th floor rooms that we smart and modern. The bathroom was very clean with a great shower and bath. The lobby and was impressive and staff friendly. Our bugdet did not stretch to eating in the hotel.... although we did have a glass of Tattinger one evening that cost 35 euros for two glasses. One negative - the walls are a little thin.. When going back to Paris i will certainly try to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but be careful”
Reviews.Author: dandwDurham
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel when we stayed in December 2008. In fact we couldn't believe it was only rated at 4 star. Our room overloked the Comedie Francaise, the food was great, the staff were very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. We returned to Paris this month (May) and again booked the same hotel. This time we chose a Deluxe room, just to ensure we had an outward looking room. Unfortunately on arrival, we were given a room which had no view at all, other than the back of the inner couryard. Reception staff assured us that this was a deluxe room (and in terms of facilities it was fine) but we had particularly wanted a view. Beware, paying extra does not guarantee a room with a view. We insisted that the website from which we had booked the room had promised an outside view and so they swapped us to another room which overloked the Louvre museum. That was fine. The room was very comfortable, warm and well appointed. The breakfasts were excellent. One evening we chose to eat in the restaurant. This proved to be a mistake. The service was painfully slow and the food, when it finally arrived, was very poor. I had to ask to have another look at the menu to try to identify my sauce (it was so long since I had ordered it that I had forgotten what it was supposed to be, and the taste was no help). The hotel has a great location, it is comfortable, and the staff are helpful. But do insist on booking that you have a view, and avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kkfreeman
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here for 5 nights. I was so delighted with the fact our room was ready very early, so we could dump our bags and get going. The staff was wonderful, their restaurant recommendations were spot-on! There was a charge on our bill at check-out that was supposed to be removed. It took 5 frustrating phone calls to straighten out. All in all, I would stay there again; just check my bill early.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mollie232
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel du Lourve Paris from 4/26/10 - 5/3/10 and we were very satisfied. The purpose of our travel was to celebrate our 25 anniversary. Not only did the hotel allow us to check in at 8:30 am but they also upgraded our room to a deluxe room ( # 255 ) that was perfect and had a view of the Lourve and the Opera. Additionally, the hotel left a bottle of wine and flowers in our room on the first day to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel staff was simply wonderful to work with. The daily maid service was excellent and the concierge and front desk assistance was awesome as well. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and went out of their way to assist in any way the could. My wife and I speak very limited French and the hotel staff were more than happy to communicate with us in English. I would highly recommend this hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location and the hotel is very comfortable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Attitude at the Hotel Du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: ianjacksonbfp
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Hotel Du Louvre, Paris for my wife's birthday after the usual stress at the airports we were confronted at the reception by a demand for 400 Euros, as a deposit against any 'breakages' during our 4 day stay. (The hotel was paid for in advance) - We were told in a very unpleasant manner that this was standard policy all over the world (we have just been on a round the world trip and I travel for a living always staying in hotels and this just isn't any other policy but one of Greed in what was a very greedy hotel. Unless, of course, you don't flinch at 1 Euros for a small bottle of Evian. 3 times someone walked into our room at night shouting 'Service!' and though the rooms are very clean they are small (We had even upgraded to a king-size bedroom). Don't let this put you off Paris though as the city is beautiful, just avoid this hotel - poor value and a bad and arrogant attitude to their visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Opera, shopping or sightseeing, this is the ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: KarDavEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel du Louvre for a three-night honeymoon trip, and the choice was perfect. Although some of the staff were reserved to the point where they might be considered by some to be disinterested or even rude, they were in my view simply discreet and courteous, and their reserve sits well with the opulence and style of the hotel. Chirpy staff would be somehow inappropriate. The hotel interior is rich and plush throughout, and well maintained, giving the feel of a Royal Palais rather than a hotel. Our Junior Suite was well appointed, and spacious by Paris standards, always clean, if a little overwarm for Scottish blood (air-con was a token gesture). Location is impeccable, whether you want to shop, sightsee or go to the Opera Garnier (a short walk along Avenue de l'Opera). Views include the Louvre/Rue de Rivoli, or up to the Opera. We did not eat in, so cannot comment on the food, but a caution: we were charged 11.80 Euros for a coffee (best part of £10 at the time). On a three night deal this was excellent value for money and highly recommended. Splash out on a bigger room. A complementary honeymoon bottle of champagne on arrival only makes me even better disposed towards this excellent hotel. Overall rating of Excellent is justified despite some very minor faults.

Reviews.Title: “we couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: jobegrass
Reviews.Content: Our room and stay at this hotel, was perfect. The room, the amenities, the helpful staff, the convenience of the location all were just what we hoped for during our first trip to Paris. Making the decision to stay here in part due to the positive comments on sites such as Trip Advisor, and it was an excellent choice. We arrived early in the morning and since our room was ready, were checked in at that time. We were lucky, and we were grateful after a long flight from NY. We had one of the least expensive rooms, and were nervous about it, we were not disappointed and in fact were pleased and delighted with it. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, watch out for extra charges!!”
Reviews.Author: oldrugged
Reviews.Content: Great on all aspects save one. I tried to check in online with Air France, since that was the actual carrier for my Delta flight. Could not check in with Delta...was rerouted to AF. AF had no record of the booking. Called the conceirge who gave me a 'fast number' for AF...0 to get out of the room, and a 4-digit number. Now, AF never answers the phone in less than 15-20 minutes...when I went to check out...there was a 66-Euro charge for the call....concierge never once mentioned any charges at all, much less charges based on time!! They made a 20% reduction, but big deal. The room was great, but overpriced!! Service was very friendly....front desk personnel spoke English without an 'attitude.'

Reviews.Title: “Classic and great location”
Reviews.Author: ads8677
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Right behin the LOUVRE. Very helpful staff. The rrooms are a bit small but it is a vary old and classic hotel with moidern amenities. We were given a free upgrade as it was our honeymoon All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: elsaml
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Louvre was booked by our travel agent and we thought it was a reasonable price for being in such a great/central location. We were pleasantly surprised that it turned out to be a wonderful place with an exceptional staff. Twice we requested items from the front desk (outlet converter & scale), and they were sent up immediately. The room was surprisingly spacious and it was the first hotel room (after 2 weeks of traveling abroad) where the room temperature was just right. The bed was very comfortable as well. We received two passes for Le Louvre as well as a boat tour with our stay and the complimentary breakfast was great (Brasserie du Louvre). In summary, we highly recommend this hotel; accommodating staff, comfortable room and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: RAMDGM0330
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay in Paris at Hotel du Louvre and have not one negative thing to say. The hotel is perfectly located right next to the Louvre and immediatly out the side door is a stop to the metro. Nothing from this hotel was out of the way. The staff was very kind, gracious, and wanted to help us with suggestions and guidance to meet our interests. Carmelo, the conceirege was just amazing. The breakfasts were very good with lots of choices to eat healthy or fill "yourself up." Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the square to the Louvre museum, very nice view. Our room was very intimate, great bed, nice linens, double sinks in the bathroom. The cleaning service were as with the rest of the hotel staff very gracious and wanting to please. Language was not a barrier for us as most of the staff spoke very good English. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller65
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in Feb 2010. Hotel is centrally located right opposite to the Louvre. Everything is within walking distance - Louvre, Opera, Notre Dame, Pompidiou Center. The room was a bit old fashioned with blue wallpapers... Our room at 2nd floor looks right into Napoleon's Apartments of the Louvre. Room floor was not even so had to be careful, apart from that, I had good sleeps (the bed was just right) Hotel staff was very helpful when I asked about best ways to goto various places and they speak good English. Breakfast was good - coffee was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: wocaplel
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had the pleasure of staying in this Hotel for a total of six nights. Noise was not a problem even though our Junior Suite overlooked the street. The service was wonderful, Eric at the concierge desk went out of his way to help in any way he could. The front desk was also very helpful. Breakfast was very nice as well, there was plenty to eat and drink. Yogurt, meat, eggs, fruit, cereal,etc. The service at breakfast was quick and done with a smile. They did not chase you away. We had no problems whatsoever in this Hotel. It is centrally located, there is an taxi stand outside and a subway station down the block. The French Brasseries make wonderful coffee, they serve food or pastry and there are quite a few close by.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend To Anyone”
Reviews.Author: mmusic2004
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is convenient at a reasonable price, I recommend this hotel. As the name depicts, the Louvre is literally outside your hotel and close to the metro and shopping. The room was clean and update (bathroom, etc.) with a nice view of Paris. Lobby was inviting, yet not over done.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, I thought the rates for the hotel were pricey. The hotel was very beautiful...then we got to our room, I guess I'm used to rooms that are a lot more spacious! We didn't have much of a view, we looked out onto the courtyard. The staff were quite friendly, I never really needed to contact them for anything. The location was great. It was centrally located, very short walk to the Louvre museum, the subway just steps away, McDonald's was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: jimmysi
Reviews.Content: We actually were staying at The Bristol (review to come shortly) but were spending a lot of time in the neighborhood at the Palais Royale. This is a very high traffic area between shops on the Rue St. Honoree, the Louvre, etc...had ducked in earlier for a cup of coffee and then came back a bit later after shopping to use the washroom. When I asked where it was, the front desk attendant asked if I was staying at the hotel and before I could finish my sentence starting with no informed me I was on private property and that there was no restroom available for me. I did not even attempt to argue the point of having been there earlier...and at 2-3pm in the afternoon the lobby, bar and restaurant were virtually empty. No suggestion of another alternative (there are actually public restrooms within a block of the hotel as it turns out)...sadly it was the kind of behavior that Parisians are stereotyped with. I certainly understand hotels wanting to not have hordes of tourists use their facilities, but I would never suggest this place to anyone. Having read some other recent reviews of how unhelpful the front desk staff is this doesn't surprise me. My review of the fantastic experience we had at The Bristol is coming up!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not good value”
Reviews.Author: slk86
Reviews.Content: As the name suggests, the hotel is located near the Louvre. It takes about 2 minutes to walk to the Louvre. Also, as the hotel is located centrally in Paris, we used the metro only twice or so (for the Eiffel tower, and for Versailles), and easily walked to the other main attractions. The hotel is close to the metro station Palais Royal Musee du Louvre. If you are on a tight budget, it is also close to a Japanese restaurant called Higuma, where you can get meals for less than 10 euros. Our room had a kitchenette, which was convenient for making breakfast. However, the decor is quite daggy, especially the design on the carpet. If you look at it for too long, you can feel nauseous. I felt itchy whenever I was in the room, and I think I may have been because of the carpet or my bed. Plus, the '2 single beds' comprise of a single sofa bed and another single bed that you pull out from under the first bed. The instructions to pull out the beds were vague, and it was quite hard to pull them out. The second bed also had a slight slope to it. The bathroom was clean, but the absence of a shower curtain means that you inevitably get water all the floor, which flows to somewhere under the bath. They had covered the gap between the bath and the floor with some patchy woodwork, which is not impressive. Our room had only one chair, which is not enough for a TWO person apartment. So, my partner and I sat on the bed to have breakfast, using a small table and one of the bedside tables as tables. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful, especially Jamile. She was generous and really endeavoured to make our stay comfortable. She offered us 1 free load of laundry. We had enough for two, but she counted it as one. She gave us a receipt for it afterwards (21 euros), and reassured us that we did not have to pay. However, there was another woman at the front desk who I was not impressed with (I can't remember her name). I asked her for the best way to get to the Eiffel Tower. She suggested a complicated route on the metro map which contained 3 changes of lines. Luckily, I discovered that there was a quicker route comrpising only 2 changes of lines. She apologised and said that she had only about 3 hours of sleep, as it was Christmas day. I would have expected better knowledge of the metro system. Upon checking out, we were served by the same woman, and she charged us for the laundry, and at 21 Euros, it was a rip-off! What is also a rip-off is the shuttle service to Charles de Gaulle airport, at 34 euros for 2 people. My partner and I used the metro to get to Chatelet, then RER B to Charles de Gaulle, which did not take much time, and cost only 17 euros for the both of us. Overall, this hotel is not good value. There are 4 star hotels which are located near by, and cost only a little bit more and look much nicer, such as the Hotel du Louvre. Plus, the room was serviced only on our 5th day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LolaBabyAR
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful 4 nights at the Hotel du Louvre. The deluxe room (#211) was well appointed and large compared to typical Paris hotel rooms. It had a fantastic view of the Louvre to the right and the Palais Royal to the left. Breakfast was included and the staff was great. One of the waiters (can't remember his name now, something with an "A") made our morning! He was great, remembered what we wanted to drink and was very attentive. Hotel is in a great location, right next to a metro stop. I ended up being a little under the weather and the concierge helped us come up with a translation for the pharmacy. We were there celebrating our anniversary and the hotel sent us a lovely bottle of champagne one evening. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Well run, helpful, great location”
Reviews.Author: BeaumontB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 11 days at the Hotel du Louvre. The staff was very helpful and worked with us when we decided to splurge on an up grade. Rooms could use some refurbishment and can be very small. The location couldn't be better. With the subway at your doorstep and the Louvre across the street you're really set. We were impressed with the house keeping at this hotel. No matter what time of the day we left our room was always made up and very clean when we returned. The restaurant connected to the hotel is too expensive. There are many options nearby that won't bust your budget. Starbucks a block away. The hotel is well run and a perfect location for touring Paris. Add free wireless and newspapers everyday and you will have a comfortable, convenient location for your Paris vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MsEllen88
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for 3 nights, just before Christmas. We usually stay near Place Madeleine, but instead chose the H du L to be close to the Louvre, and WOW, a hotel closer to the Louvre than this would be impossible. Our two rooms (227 & 229) faced the Richelieu Wing of the Louvre and we could see directly into the windows and view magnificent sculpture. I would recommend asking for outward facing rooms if possible, but if you seek a quiet room, the inside views would definitely be better, but would lack any view. The rooms were compact, clean and with quality bed and bath linens. The bed was very comfortable and our rooms had flat screen TVs. The check-in agent (Mirna) and housekeeping staff were very helpful and polite. We found the best rate for this hotel on the hotel's own website, where we booked a family package that discounted the 2nd room by 50% and it included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but perhaps not a good value if your room rate does not include breakfast. (Starbucks is a five minute walk away.) Tip: Don't even think about opening the mini-bar! The prices for mini-bar items were outrageous. Within a two minute walk you'll find shops on the Rue du Rivoli selling mineral water and other necessities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: georgemAthens_greece
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel with my wife for 8 days. We are very satisfied from the hotel, the rooms are big for paris standards, are very clean and have all the amenities you want (incl. wifi free). The staff is good enough and try to help you and the breakfast very good with big variety of food. The price is a little high and the breakfast costs 28 euro per eprson, so try to get a deal that incl. the breakfast. Overall experience very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for romantic weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shawsieLondon
Reviews.Content: Staff and hotel lived up to all my expectations (well, minus running out of croissants one breakfast). Staff very attentive and helpful, hotel in good, elegant condition. Made our stay extremely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: DylanG1
Reviews.Content: Small rooms that are very nice on the inside and the hotel is a very cozy place,no facilities,great location right near the louvre museam. Mcdonalds and starbucks within 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back at the Hotel du Louvre everytime we visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: Emmettvoyage
Reviews.Content: 1st class service. Very clean. Beautiful rooms. Convenient location. Good value. Very good restaurant. We go to Paris yearly and from now on will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawngisland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our two young children after a long search for a hotel that could comfortably accomodate a family of four . This hotel is centrally located and is right next to the Louvre and Touleries Garden. We booked a one bedroom suite with the hotel directly and got the room offered at one half of the price listed on Expedia with a wonderful buffet breakfast for 4 people included in the price. The first night they also sent up a complimentary basket of food and drinks. The room was very large with three large windows that had Juliet balconies. There was a huge dressing room and a very large marble bathroom with separate shower and bath. Even by American standards this room was huge and luxurious. The concierge at the hotel was amazing and made great recommendations of what to do with the kids in Paris. Sightseeing was made easier for our kids since the Touleries Garden with its summer amusement park was right near the hotel. After going to museums the kids got to play on the way back to the hotel. We had a memorable time in Paris and a lot had to do with this wonderful hotel and its staff. I totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, unhappy with front desk”
Reviews.Author: shaelyn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Louvre is a very impressive hotel and understandably, it is pricey. The location can't be beat, it is located across the street from the "Musee Louvre", as well as walking distance to many attractions. The metro is around the corner as well. My only complaint with this hotel is that we booked this hotel in Feb. '09 for our trip in Sept '09, requesting a outside room with a good view. We were told every room has a good view. Great! When we arrived we were informed that they needed to clean several rooms, so they will store our luggage and to come back in a couple of hours. When we returned we were given our keycard, but to our surprise it was an inside room, NO VIEW! We went directly to the front desk to find our why we were given an inside room when we booked an outside room. The young lady behind the desk informed us that they do not guarantee outside rooms and this is all that was avabilable. I don't understand why they would tell you, "All their rooms have a view" especially when you request an outside room, and book the room 7 months in advance. Based on the price I'm sure we paid for an outside room. If I would of known that there was a chance we would actually be put in a inside room, I would of looked into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Terrific Service and a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: FinksburgMom
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. Around the corner from two metro stops and across the street from the Louvre. Walking distance to many sights. Hotel had a very European feel while still having amenities we are used to. Staff was very friendly and smiled as we stumbled through French with them although all spoke excellent English. Recommendations provided were good. The room was serviced several times a day with a lovely turndown service. When they caught us in our room, they came back later, which was nice. Room was extremely large (we had a junior suite for the three of us (family with 11 year old daughter) and bedding was very comfortable. Robes were a nice touch, liked the fact that the WC was separate from the remaining very large bathroom with amenities you would expect from a 4 star hotel in the US. The complementary wine and petit fours that were in our room when we came back to our room the first evening were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Location: magnifique ; service: médiocre”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem81998
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel at the center of many great attractions. Just steps away from the Musee du Louvre, we were able to take walks at night and enjoy the gorgeous night view. This allowed for many photo opportunities. During two months in the summer, the Tulleries has a carnival like setting with ferris wheel, etc. With kids, it also makes for an ideal location. We were in room 357 which directly faces the National Opera House and is by far the room with the best view. Room feels a bit cramped as the bed occupies 70% of the space but the bathroom is very spacious. The only slight negative comment would be that concierge needs "customer service" training. The one woman who always seemed to be there when I had questions or made a request was impatient and almost condescending. The other point to note was that security was very laxed. Anyone off the street could walk right in and take the elevator up to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else, eh”
Reviews.Author: Wanderkinder
Reviews.Content: As with most hotels in Paris, the rooms tend to be small. We were glad we packed lightly as there wasn't enough room for a large suitcase. Would have liked for housekeeping to vacuum or at least to have done a better job of it, but then maybe the machine couldn't move around in the limited space. Beware of the water temperature fluctuation in the shower. Very easy to get scalded. Location was excellent - right next door to the Louvre and short walks to loads of sights and great restaurants. Note: if you're a light sleeper, you may notice the rumbling of the Metro that runs directly underneath. Check-in staff needs to figure out how to juggle more than one party of arrivals. Staff of 3 all focused on one arrival party and made others wait without being very courteous about it. Overall, I would have been miffed to have paid EURO 300 per night for the room, but if location is important, you could do worse than this.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel in an even finer location”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a most enjoyable few days staying at the du Louvre on our way back from Switzerland. A very well organised Hotel, part of the Crillon group and most conveniently located immediately across the street from the Louvre and next to a Metro station so easy to travel around Paris. Our quiet bedroom was spacious with a good view across the street to the Palais Royale. Breakfasts were excellent with a wide range of choices at the buffet. We had dinner there on the Sunday we arrived and it was competent with good flavoursome steaks but we ate better elsewhere on other evenings. We have no stayed at the du Liuvre before but this Hotel will be high on our list when we return to Paris..

Reviews.Title: “Paris at it's best”
Reviews.Author: timkent007
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris a few times before, I decided to take my wife. We stayed at thie Hotel Du Louvre and were more than pleased. the hotels itself is glorious and clos eto everything I wante dto show her. The room was a good size and the staff were more than friendly and extremely helpful. Parisiens are supposed to be rude but every single person we came into contact with was very friendly - tip - speak a little French and the French will warm to you instantly!

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: Kizzeface
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful trip to the Hotel du Louvre, and highly recommend it. This was my eighth trip to Paris, and my fiance's first. I wanted to make it special for him so researched outside of my usual haunts and found the Hotel du Louvre. Boy am I glad I did!!! The hotel is right next to the Louvre, and there's a metro stop right outside. You can walk to pretty much everything, or take the metro if you prefer. The room was spotless, so charmingly decorated, and BIG for a Parisian hotel. Plus, it had a nice-sized fridge, so we could go shopping and avoid the big expense of a sit-down breakfast or late night picnic along the Seine. The staff was amazingly friendly (we travel a lot, and have rarely encountered such a level of service), flawlessly slipping between French (which I preferred to practice) and English (for my fiance). One day, there was a note on our pillow indicating that we had forgotten to fully lock the room safe, so the housekeeper had re-set it and to please call her for the new password! We were mortified that two veteran travelers had forgotten something so rudimentary, and were so thankful that we faced an honest staff willing to go above and beyond. You really can't go wrong for a romantic Parisian getaway at the Hotel du Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Paris as we like it : Charm, style and for once friendly”
Reviews.Author: chchanoi
Reviews.Content: Great location for sure as you are in the middle of everything including all the main transportation hubs. Velib station is also just down the hotel. Old charm hotel and very nice smart team always in ood mood even when they look very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Note as good as described”
Reviews.Author: Van57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Louvre in Sep 2009. Pros This is a few minutes walk from the Louvre. Cons After staying in Italy for 2 weeks the hotel room was smaller and had old patched together furniture If you book the hotel through Expedia then breakfast is not included in the room (surprise) The room was very noisy

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: need2travel2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Hotel Du Louvre for 4 nights in July. It was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in & if we get back to Paris someday we'll stay here again. Our room was spacious, beautifully furnished & spotlessly clean. The wide windows let in a lot of natural light & the view was great. The bathroom was also spacious & spotless, modern & lovely. The staff were all very nice & helpful (especially Francoise at the concierge desk) and there was no problem w/ the language barrier. The bar was a relaxing place to have a drink & the cafe was delicious for dinner. It was a 2 minute walk to the Louvre, right next to a Metro stop and within walking distance to many sights. If you want a gorgeous upscale hotel without a "stuffy" attitide this truly is a perfect hotel, you can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: PapaENTDOC
Reviews.Content: Very accomadating. Extremely helpful in planning our days with two teen-age grandchildren. Helped find the best deals. No language problem. A little pricey, but we got our monies worth. Great location. We could walk to all the major Paris Attractions. Supplied great customer service. Rooms were larger then I expected for a European Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WannaFlyJ
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights with my family at the property in mid July. The location was excellent!! A 2 minute walk to the Louvre and great resturants and cafes in the surrounding area. Ate once at the hotel resturant, was somewhat average - there was much better selection across the street. Rooms were clean and spacious. Would recomend highly and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent bathroom, abov average bedroom”
Reviews.Author: ditya6um
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel du louvre in July 2009 and we were really happy we picked this hotel. It is 50 meter away from the louvre museum,barely 50 meters away from the train station on line 1, which was one of the most frequently used lines during our stay in Paris. Hotel is clean, rooms are good (small but that's normal here in Europe) and bathroom was really a great plus point. Then there are some great walkable places from the hotel like Opera, Palace etc. The place is quite lively even at 11 PM in the night, so go for it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent all rounder”
Reviews.Author: thoma51ceman
Reviews.Content: Well what can we can say, Our first trip to paris and we could not have stayed in a better location and a wanderfull hotel, from the friendly bell boy to the house keeping staff, apon check in we were warmly greated and showen to our room ( 567) not much of view but we didnot come to spend time in the hotel room. The luxurious room was spacious and welcoming. Natural light streamed through the double windows . Warm colour combinations of creams and silvers create a contemporary feel and the flat screen lcd tv aint bad either,the bed is large and oooh so CUMFY just what you need after a long day of sightseeing ,before you head out for the evening . The comfortable chairs and a low table create a reading area and there is room to work at the desk. Bathrooms are light and airy with fresh pale marble and large enough to share with the mrs`s. Unfortunatly we never tried the in house catering - maybe next time - there are loads of little places to eat close by, get off the main streets and venture down the narrow lanes. The louvre museam is less than 5 mins and if your lucky to stay at the start of the month the 1st sunday is free entry , any other time its 6 euros and get there early its packed tight in there.dont try and walk to the eifel tower either my blisters are still throbbing .lol ( 1.45 hour ) a taxi is only 10 euros, but we wanted to walk along the river. Moulan rouche get a taxi 7 euros and a great livly row of pubs try Osullivans next door to the moulan, if you can pull yourself away from the sex shops. All in All We loved our stay at the Hotel Du Louvre and we will be booking again for next year, we would not want to stay any where else. many thanks for your hospitality. Mr callaghan .

Reviews.Title: “only average”
Reviews.Author: lrm52282
Reviews.Content: Originally chose this hotel for room size, location, and price, but upon arrival and sightseeing, we realized that location is only so so. What I mean is that if you stay here you are near the Louvre and Notre Dame, but far from the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triumph. Likewise if you stay near the Eiffel, you are far from the Louvre, so nothing is really central in Paris. The size was nice for Paris, but the AC was poor and I was constantly hot, so in retrospect I'd prefer a small room with properly working AC. We realized the price is pretty average after meeting and talking to other visitors whose rooms were in better locations and more luxurious for the same price. The most obnoxious part was that we got the distinct feeling we were being made fun of by some of the staff. There were chuckles and the word Americans overheard many times. We did nothing to provoke this from the staff as we are world travelers who do our best to represent our country in a positive light. I feel that the staff perpetuated the stereotype of the rude Frenchman who hates Americans!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tazz13
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel is the location. It is a very short walk from the Metro and many of the important locations are within walking distance. You are just a short walk away from the Seine. We stayed in a suite. The room was large but slightly dated. The bathroom was, however, modern and of a high standard. The rooms were well heated, at times it got too hot despite being winter. The windows were quite difficult to open, although we some effort we managed to!.We had a lovely view actually looking into the Louvre itself. We did not eat in the hotel, as there are so many great places around to eat. As with everything in Europe due to the weakness of the pound it was quite expensive to stay here, as indeed was the whole trip to Paris. The staff seemed friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jamex25
Reviews.Content: Our family of four including two teenagers stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for 4 nights. We had two rooms, one of which was quite nice and the other which was mediocre. The air conditioning in the second room was not working well and was not fixed despite our request. Beds and baths were comfortable. Rooms are small but OK and nicely decorated. The hotel sits on a very busy multi-angle intersection directly across from the Louvre, yet the rooms are quiet due to very good double sets of glass windows. Perfect location for walking Paris from Eiffel to Latin Qtr, river, Arc, Champs, Galleries, etc. Easy to get to and from. Staff was helpful. Wireless worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Louvre - perfect location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrssmythe
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel; the location is superb, steps away from The Louvre, Tuileries, shops and cafes. The staff were friendly and helpful, our room ( a suite) was a good size, clean, very large bathroom, and views onto the Louvre. Breakfast is served in the ground-floor dining room which also has tables outside. There was plenty to eat and it was very busy. The hotel's own Brasserie seemed rather over-priced, and for dinner, we chose to eat at several of the excellent local restaurants, which the hotel helped us to book. Minibar was predictably, very expensive. We look forward to returning to this hotel next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay , wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Bluecrab72
Reviews.Content: First let me compliment the staff that was always professional and curtious. We had wake up calls every day and every one right on time. There was a mix-up with our room compared to the one we booked and it was corrected without so much a eyeroll. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was while a little small more than enough. PS Paris is known for small hotel rooms so dont think you're getting taken. There is free internet via WI FI , unlike previous reviewer stated. If you plug in to line then you are charged ,just as stated in add. If you are the type to complain about everything then heres the one thing you cant complain about ,the location. With a running start you could jump into the Louvre or fall into the 2 , yes 2 , trainlines literally outside the hotel. And believe me as a tourist trainlines are life. Do youself a favor and get a Navigo Decourverte pass plus a Museum pass and you will bet set.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our visit to Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Bardos
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel du Louvre. The room was located on the interior courtyard and was very quiet, nicely decorated and for Paris, fairly large. The concierge was very helpful, we enjoyed sitting in the outdoor cafe every morning. Location was perfect for most sites we were interested in and convenient to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with my stay”
Reviews.Author: LFitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after reading reviews on this site and stayed 3 nights.  Arrived at 1:45 from London with my teenage son and told to come back at 3:00 to get into my room.  Room was NOT as described--orange wallpaper, furniture from the 1960"s scratched and beat up...and SMALL.  And an unpleasant smell in the room I think came from air conditioning duct.  Good news--yes it is air conditioned. My son and I left the hotel early one morning to take a tour of Normandy and were going to leave about 15 min before the restaurant was to open for the breakfast we had payed for.  I walked into the restaurant and before I could ask for some juice and a roll for my kid was told to"go find my colleague if you need help"...One elevator for entire hotel--but no major problem  and always took the stairs to go down.  Bathroom was fine.  Old outlets and was not able to plug in my adapter/converter.  Hairdryer in bathroom but could use my curling iron.  It is an old hotel.Pillows and bed comfy and their is a plasma TV--only 2 news channels in English--everything  else in French. Right next to the Louvre--which is open to 10pm on Fridays.  Just across the Seine from the wonderful D'orsay--which is loaded with impression art and open late on Thursdays.  Cafes everywhere--like every 20 feet!!  In this town, a liter of red wine is cheaper that a glass of Coke--payed as much as 15 euros for 2 cokes!!  If you ask for water and do not specify--you will get bottled water which is also pricey  Evian is much cheaper in the US.  Well that's it--folks in this town are not warm and friendly in my short experience.  Oh, internet connection NOT free --5 euros/hour, 10 euros for 8 hours. If this is a 4 star hotel, I think I need a 5 star in this town.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: robski_korsikoff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel du Louvre on the last weekend of June 2009. The hotel is a great location for the Louvre (unsurprisingly....) which is just a 2/3 minute casual stroll from the hotel. It is also 10 yards from a metro station, providing access to the rest of the City. For anyone coming into Gare du Nord, metro travel takes about 15 minutes (it took longer to buy the ticket at the Gare du Nord!!!), while we took a taxi back to the GdN which took about 10 minutes and cost 8 euros. The check-in was extremely quick and efficent, with the staff member being very polite and courteous. Our room was a standard room, so no view of the Parisien streets or The Louvre, but it was compensated for by its cleanliness and general quiet. I can imagine a room overlooking the street would be noisy until late at night due to the location of the hotel. The bathroom, although not large and a bit dated was spotless - I travel around Europe with work, staying in many 5 star hotels, and cannot remember a cleaner bathroom. The double bed was wide, and very comfortable. The hotel was not cheap, but that's central Paris for you. A couple of words of warning though: 1) Brasserie did not offer particularly high quality food, and was poor value for money 2) Hotel breakfast is 27 euros per person. Instead, why not try one of the many cafes that are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel and get a hot drink, fresh juice, a croissant, jam, and a small baguette for between 7 and 9 euros. If I came back to Paris wthout the children, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: OrlTerry
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location for your visit to Paris. It is within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, shopping, etc. and the metro is right around the corner for all others. The room was very clean and spacious. Beautiful view out our window. The staff is pleasant enough but did not go out of their way. The hotel bar was very expensive and not very friendly but there are other options very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UKDWB
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Paris and stayed at the du Louvre, you can't beat the location, just like everyone else has stated, its within walking distance of so many sites. we arrived at 5pm in the afternoon and before the night was done we had been through the Latin Quarter and had taken a night time Seine boart ride from Pont du Neuf. The Louvre is across the street. The hotel is great, if you want something different from the usual chain, then this will suit you well. Breakfast was included and catered for just about anyone, there are many tourists here as well as business people. The staff were very helpful and were eager to help if you had a question.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Paris: price, location, and the best staff anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: hipprof
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Hotel du Louvre was almost perfect. The location was great: within walking distance of much of the sights of Paris, with a Metro station next toa the hotel. Our room was spacious and overlooked the square next to the Louvre. The bathroom was beautful! The staff was extremely helpful, getting us in a room at 9am, getting us tickets and lots of helpful advice. The room was quite (except for some street noise when the windows were open. )

Reviews.Title: “great location and a very well run Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gwilliamsEngland
Reviews.Content: Overall very pleased with stay. Great location. Room and bathroom could do with update, but the bed was very comfortable. Laura on reception greeted us and was very efficient and genuinely helpful. Will stay again. The American guests seem to get star treatment I noticed, but that seems to be the case all over Europe. We are just from little England!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny, great location, service, property”
Reviews.Author: SeaPro
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Large clean rooms with seperate bath/shower. Frendily, knowledgeable staff. Good resturant. 5 minute walk to the Louvre enterence. Metro just steps from the door. If you are looking fdor an upscale hotel,offering a truly Parianian feel and great location, look no more. The Hotel Du Louvre is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: joop1
Reviews.Content: I never give five stars, but this hotel is very good price quality! I stayed with my mother in a very nice junior suite. Location is perfect, especially if you need (or like to take) taxis. Personnel is in general very helpful and nice. A few minus points, not really worth mentioning. One staff member was a bit "out of mood", but that happens everywhere. Many many English speaking guests, and that makes the atmosphere a bit "less Parisian"...of course the positive point is that staff is very bilingual, and everybody needs to feel welcome! All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anybody who can afford it and who likes the comfort of a nice "bigger" hotel, with all facilities. Breakfast is too expensive, but there are many other possibilities very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris charm”
Reviews.Author: cwnek264
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Louvre is exactly what you want for a Paris hotel. The staff was wonderful and polite, the entire hotel was gorgeous and spotless. Our room was large, especially for Europe, with a huge bathroom that was immaculate. The room was decorated in all blue and white and was very romantic. The windows opened up onto a square of cafes. Would never stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mackay08
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel and it was wonderful. We arrived before 9am and didn't expect to be able to have our room, but one was ready for us and the staff were so nice. The room was very large and and had a good size bathroom also. Beautiful room and loved looking out the windows at the Louvre right across the street. The location of this hotel is just wonderful, so easy & convenient to everything. A special thanks to the concierge - Carmelo. He was so helpful and friendly booking accommodation & train tickets to Avignon for us. I would definately recommend staying at Hotel du Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel for the $$”
Reviews.Author: CaryTravler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Louvre was everything good that we had read on Trip Advisor. We made our reservation through Expedia for a standard room - pre-paid, so we weren't expecting too much. We were greated warmly at the door, given a small but well-appointed room on the 3rd floor (which is really the 4th in France) with a great view of the Paris Opera House. The hotel is across the street from the Louvre - and the Louvre metro stop. There are some pleasant cafes and brassieres in the area. The beds were good, the staff helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Much more of a value than a hotel we had in London in Sept, 2008 for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful End to our Trip to France”
Reviews.Author: kpayne68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and were not sure what to expect. We arrived earlier than expected (before noon). Initially, we started by pleasant greetings from the doorman and staff. At our check in, we talked about our anniversary trip we were taking, and the check-in staff informed us that they had a room immediately availalbe for us and that the room was upgraded to a suite overlooking the Lourve, as we had originally requested. From that point, we continued to enjoy th e positive staff attitudes and helpful nature of them. Our room was amazingly nice. The beds were very comfortable; the bathrooms were large (especially for hotels in historical areas) with separate showers and large bathtub; room service was delivered each time as requested and at the time we requested; the views from the hotel balconies were fun. We sometimes found it hard to leave the room, and just enjoyed hanging out with a glass of wine and watched people in the adjacent plaza from our balcony. We were worried about the exterior lighting over the hotel and concerned about it intruding into our room at night - this proved to be no problem with the triple curtains they have at each balcony door and window.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: paristraveler12
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Louvre was recommended by friends so we tried it for this recent short stay. We have stayed at many different hotels in Paris and often don't think the value/cost is good. But we were very pleased with the rooms at Hotel du Louvre . We had a junior suite as that was all that was available as we had booked not too far in advance and the view from the room was incredible - looking down the boulevard to the Opera. Our friends were upgraded to a regular suite and their room was even nicer. We typically don't book junior suites - the two rooms are a bit cramped. We prefer one larger room. But on the other hand, this junior suite was quite convenient as we had two very nice bathrooms. The only negative this visit was that the bar prices (we wanted a coffee one evening) were extremely high. Ask for a room overlooking the opera if available.

Reviews.Title: “diamond theft”
Reviews.Author: jemgirl
Reviews.Content: Our suite was comfortable and spacious, but don't get too comfortable here. 2 pairs of diamond earrings were stolen and while this was supposedly being investigated by the hotel, the attitude was "c'est la vie stupid blond girl" for trusting to leave them out for 2 hours WITH a do not disturb sign on my room door. Be careful to put every little thing of value in the safe unless you want to find yourself at the police station. Also totally no help finding medicines, as the pharmacies don't open until 9am. Please plan on not needing medication outside the pharmacy hours. I have traveled around the globe and certainly will not be returning to a place that cares nothing for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, romantic and neat”
Reviews.Author: riaolson2008
Reviews.Content: peaceful and enjoyable stay. perfect for honeymooners and wedding anniversaries. my husband and i had an awesome stay here, staff were very friendly and the room is clean, accesible to almost everything...we definitely recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: DRPETE24
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable beds, rooms a bit small, good breakfast buffet, very friendly and helpful staff. Don't drink at the bar unless you like wasting money. 4 gin and tonics were 88 euros!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and classy - simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JohnJB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for 4 nights in mid-December for a special celebration and this venue surpassed all expectations. We booked a de-luxe room but were upgraded at no extra cost to a suite. This was the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. We had a floor to ceiling windows with balconies overlooking the Palais Royal in one direction and the Louvre in the other - wow!! The room itself was decorated tastefully and classically and had a large sitting area, a beautiful super king size bed and separate bathroom, toilet and hallway. Everything was spotlessly clean and facilities were to the highest standards. Above all else the location of this hotel cannot be faulted - it is steps away from the Louvre, the Palais Royal and the Palais Royal metro station is outside the door. Staff were all fantastic and the hotel's bar and restaurant made us want to linger much longer then we were able to. All in all perfect, perfect, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julie0958
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! I was there for 8 nights in April 2008 because I was meeting a friend whose tour group was staying here. I arrived very late at night and was upgraded to a lovely suite (room 446) without asking. I had a nice sitting room, 2 bath areas, nice bedroom with very comfortable bed and even a walk-in closet! I could look out one set of floor-to-ceiling windows and see into the Louvre and I could look out another and see the Opera Garnier, which is an amazing site at night. I found the staff to be incredibly helpful and nice. I had to ship some boxes home, so they brought me boxes and tape and took care of having them mailed to me. I found the breakfast buffet to be wonderful (it's expensive but it was included in the price of my room so I enjoyed it every day). There is a Metro stop literally outside the door, and you can walk easily to Place de la Concorde, the Tuileries, Arc d'Triomphe, Notre Dame, etc. The location is truly as good as it gets. I'm going back to Paris next spring and definitely plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Tres bon”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterMand
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband stayed for 4 days at this hotel, we had a wonderful time, staff were very helpful and the hotel is clean and tidy. Great location all major attractions within easy walking distance. Cafe Ruc across from the hotel was really nice, but on the expensive side, but food was fantastic. If you want something a little cheaper there was a small traditional french restaurant approx 5 mins walk - can't remember the name but turn right out of the hotel and keep walk it's on the left hand side. Food was great real home made grub.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: Travelsforchocolate
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Louvre exuded luxury as soon as my boyfriend, my parents, and I arrived for our stay in October 2008. It was very elegant and traditional without looking old or outdated. There were a lot of things I liked about this hotel. First, the room was very nice. The bed was large, plush, and comfortable. We slept very well. The bathroom was also excellent. It looked recently renovated, everything worked well, and the bathrobes and towels were soft and warm. I liked the view from our room, which was out on the large square next to the hotel. There were always lots of people out there, including some people doing tricks on rollerblades, which was fun to watch. We also could see the Louvre Museum from our window. It was a bit loud outside when we opened the window, but they were well sound-proofed and the room was quiet with the window closed. Lastly, the breakfast buffet in the Brasserie was the best breakfast I had in Europe. It offered an immense variety that would please guests from many cultures. To just scratch the surface, I remember there being a few kinds of bread, jams, honey, pastries, fresh fruits, cereals, yogurt, fresh squeezed juices, many types of sliced meats and cheeses, eggs, bacon, sausages, sauteed mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, hash brown potatoes, and rice. It was all delicious. We did have a few experiences that didn't meet expectations. We ate dinner at the Brasserie the first night, and it just wasn't that great. The food was weird, somehow trying to be imaginative but not coming up with much flavor. My starter course of a bland crab cake ball wrapped in a cabbage leaf is a good example. If you stay at this hotel, find your dinner elsewhere. Also, while I liked working with the concierge named Xavier (I think), my mom was not as impressed with the help she received from a different concierge. She thought the man she worked with was very pompous and made her feel belittled when she told him the price range she wanted to spend at a restaurant for dinner. I would warn business travelers that the wifi internet connection is fairly slow. I appreciate that the internet is free and available in all rooms, but I was not able to upload any of my photos to the internet due to the snail's pace connection. There is a business center with computers and a printer, but I'm not sure if the connection is any faster. I did not use it because I didn't know how to get a pass for access and I had heard that it was expensive. Overall, any problems were far outweighed by the clean well-appointed rooms, great location, and usually good service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: RCHI
Reviews.Content: Amazing, there for our honeymoon and they went out there way to help us and upgrade us. Brilliant location and everything. can't fault it

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced and in need of make-over”
Reviews.Author: leesville
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on the recommendation of a colleague. Whilst we enjoyed our stay there immensely, with fantastic staff, excellent breakfast and brilliant location, i think it is overpriced. I know Paris hotels are expensive but nevertheless i think they need to do the place up a bit. I have the following comments: Good Points: Location: hard to beat, right beside the Louvre and the Comedie Francaise. WIthin walking distance of everywhere in central Paris. Views: many rooms have views of the Louvre and down to the Arc du Triomphe, or of the COmedie Francaise. Breakfast: if you get a breakfast inclusive rate, the breakfast is really excellent. Full buffet, hot bacon, eggs etc, croissants and pastries; meats and cheeses, fresh squeezed juices, yoghurts etc and fresh fruits; miso soup. really excellent. Attic Rooms: little balcony overlooking the Louvre made up for small room and poor choice of decor. Concierge and staff: nothing too much trouble. excellent service. Reception and brasserie and bar very nice. turndown service at night. good toiletries and well equipped room. best shaving mirror ever! it magnified and had a light... Very busy traffic outside but our room was well insulated against it. thankfully our room had double doors to the balcony with double curtain which minimised the din. well managed as obviously an occupational hazard in busy city centre. Bad Points: Decor a bit tired on corridors to rooms, alot of worn carpet; grouting cracked between tiles in bathrooms.no fan in bathroom so it steamed up alot. Decor colours can be bad: our room on the 5th floor in the attic was a small room with a low ceiling and yet was painted a cross between brown and purple. made it very dark. bizarre. could have been beautiful if painted a lighter colour to brighten it up. Saw other rooms with lovely colours but were either higher category or smaller room with bed configuration unsuitable for us. Courtyard Rooms: our standard (called superior) attic room luckily had a view but some are smaller and over look the very unattractive inner courtyard. Toilet without wash basin was separate to bathroom. no bidet in bathroom. Very expensive. A coke and a single express coffee in the Brasserie was €13! Cafe Marly in the terrace of the Richlieu wing of the Louvre is cheaper and a far superior location. All this for €440 a night. That's way too much for a room.

Reviews.Title: “De Louvre was an expensive disaster”
Reviews.Author: drfarm
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location. We were given a room on the lst floor right on the main street which was very noisey. The Air Conditioning did not work but when I tried to open the windows it was impossible because of the noise. I did not sleep for two nights which ruined my vacation. I asked for another room the first day but they did not move me till the third day of our 5 day stay. The mattress on the king bed had a plastic spacer of some kind to make two singles into a double but it stuck up into the bed - what a disaster. We were charged almost $3000, American for a 5 night stay and it was prepaid by our travel agent. If it had not been prepaid, I would have checked out. This was our 4th stay in Paris and the other hotels had been fine, small rooms but clean and comfortable, this was the worst we have ever experienced. The TV cable stopped working on the 2nd day so we could not get CNN which was important to us as there was a hurricane in our home town. To get information, I had to buy an internet card which was 18 Euros for 60 minutes but the connection was not very fast and I timed out quickly. The breakfast buffet had soupy scrambled eggs and canned mushrooms every day - ugh. The coffee was terrible. I wish posters had been more honest about reviewing this hotel because I choose this hotel based on the reviews here on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: me_so_happy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a London and Paris holiday. I can say without a doubt that one of the highlights of our trip was this hotel. We stayed in room 461, which was probably an upgrade from our original booking. We had informed the hotel that this trip was in honor of our 25th anniversary, and not only did we have a gorgeous sitting room with French doors opening onto the Place Collette below, we also had a lovely bedroom and two separate bath areas, one with a shower and tub (complette with towel warmer, robes, thick towels, and good toiletries) and one with a toilet and sink. The rooms were charming, good piillows and linens. We slept beautifully there. When we arrived, we had a bottle of champagne on ice waiting, along with a box of chocolates and cookies and note from the hotel manager in honor of our anniversary. The hotel is lovely, small and inviting, with a grand circular staircase from top to bottom. We did not eat in the hotel. (The cost of a breakfast was 27 euros apiece! )We did have coffee in our room in the mornings and it was delicious, though really nothing can compare to the coffee in the street cafes. The hotel was fabulously located. You are not only adjacent to the Louvre and the Tuileries, which we walked in every evening to take advantage of the lovely breezes and the sunset, there are also cafes on every corner nearby. The cafe immediately adjacent to the hotel had the rudest waiter but the creme brulee was excellent. During one evening, we threw open our French doors to the Place below and were entertained by a string orchestra playing Pachelbel. It was magical. I loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. I never took advantage of the bar, and in fact only peeked in on the day we checked out, much to my sorrow - it is beautiful and intimate. The only negative in this hotel is that the lifts are very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sasa6girl
Reviews.Content: If you plan on getting your things taken, your privacy gone, and talked to with the least bit of resepect then stay here. The staff of the Hotel Du Louvre were rude and horrible. the housekeeping staff would enter your room even when the "do not disturb" sign was up. They would make you leave and then roughly go through your room and "clean". While they were cleaning our room they would take anything that was on the bed with the sheets. After my husband and I realized that out daughter's stuffed bunny that she had since her birth 5 years ago was missing along with a few other things we realized they all were on the bed last time we saw them. We realized that the house keeping must have taken them with the sheets that they changed. Although promised we never got her bunny rabbit back only a laugh at the fact that we were worried about a little stuffed animal. The restaurant staff has no personality and the food is overpriced and not even that good. I would advise not staying there unless you want your things to be taken. My daughter is still crying about her bunny rabbit.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Tripadvisor !”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that the value of the Tripadvisor site really came through here. On arriving for a 3 night stay I was given the key to room 350. Having read the "Room 101" review below, I asked if this was next to the lift and if so could I change as it was likely to be noisy. The receoptionist rather sheepishly conceded it was and that she'd find me a quieter room. Without this site I'd never have known and according to the reviewer would have had a few dreadful nights. I regularly travel to our office in La Defense, and although the Pullman there is good, I felt like a change. If you stay in the centre of town you can save a good € 25 by having breakfast in a cafe, and probably the same again by taking advantage of the wide range of good value restaurants in the evening. This place is a great choice for that - less than 30 mins from La Defense on the direct metro line, and a great location for restaurants and sightseeing if you have time. In addition, the wireless broadband is free, saving probably another €20 per day vs your standard business hotel. The building is beatifully appointed and I didn't find it all as tired as some reviewers have suggested. The bed was comfortable and everything else was fine although the air con struggled a bit with the July heat. The lifts are slow and I did have some problems with the key card but those are small issues. Overall a good value solution in a city where a reasonably priced room is becoming increasingly hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Food but ...........”
Reviews.Author: maryfraser
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was a great dissapointment in most ways, I should have taken more time reading the other reviews. The hotel building is very grand but old and the rooms were very nice, big for Paris and very comfortable and the food was very good. Unfortunately the concierge staff and the restaurant staff let it down. We booked a table on the terrace for dinner, when we arrived it was not ready, we came back 15 minutes later, we sat down, were given menus and we waited, and waited half an hour for our order to be taken, three quarters of an hour for starter to arrive and that was only after speaking to the manager of the restaurant who vaguely apologised. It took another half hour for our main course to arrive. The food was really good but after waiting so long when others were being served who had arrived after us, it took the gloss of it. On the morning of our departure, we checked out, left our bag with the concierge and went to have one last coffee, after realising that we did not have time we had coffee in the hotel and told the concierge where we were, The driver of the car was waiting at least 15 minutes even though were in reception waiting for him, he had told the concierge that he was there to pick us up and if I had not gone to ask him if he was waiting for us, we would still be there !!!. Overall the whole experience of the dinner fiasco and the slap-dash way the concierge did his job really ruined the precious weekend in Paris which up until then we had thorougly enjoyed. I must also mention that the housekeeping staff while very pleasent were not up to scratch, a plate used for fruit was left soiled in the room for the duration of our stay, together with an opened bottle of wine. This is only a small matter but for a four star hotel, this is not what I would have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive because of the euro”
Reviews.Author: MarylandGypsy
Reviews.Content: Those who think that the Hotel du Louvre is expensive for what it offers are right. It is. But if they are Americans, as I am, they have to take into consideration the decline of the dollar. We stayed at the Louvre a few years ago and had a deluxe room with a huge bath that looked straight up the street all the way to the Opera house. This time we had a much smaller room for a much higher price. This was our 8th stay in Paris, so we have sampled many hotels, and the Louvre is our favorite. We have not stayed in any Parisian 5 star hotels, so we are comparing it only with 4 and 3 star hotels. I guess we were lucky and had a redecorated room. The furniture was old, but the walls, carpet, upholstery, etc were very clean and fresh, and handsome. Our room overlooked the Palais Royal. Our air conditioner didn't seem to put out cold air, but we didn't bother to complain because it wasn't too hot, and we just opened the french doors a crack to let in some fresh air. We did mention when we first checked in that our sink drain wouldn't close enough to retain water for washing out some clothes. The maid called someone right away, and it was all fixed in a jiffy. Not only is the hotel across from the Louvre and near several metro exits/entrances, it is also across from the double decker sightseeing bus stop, which is a wonderful way to see Paris and get around, because you can get on and off at the major sights. Another plus is the proximity to the Rue du Faubourg St. Honore, with its many enticing shops. We had dinner one night in the hotel Brasserie, and it was good, and not expensive compared to most other restaurants that are pleasant and spacious. Most of the more modestly priced places to eat squeeze you into a table practically touching your neighbor's elbow. Be prepared to pay a fortune for everything in France, especially in Paris, partly due to the euro costing almost $2 by the time you pay the extra charges for the currency exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for the money”
Reviews.Author: dimassie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. For the money that we paid for our room, the hotel was not worth even half of that price. It was dark, nothing worked in the rooms, the towels were thin, crispy pieces of cloth. The keycards continued to get turned off so we'd have to take the ancient lift back to the lobby to get them turned on again. When we first arrived, we could not get in our room until 3 p.m., even 15 minutes before 3 p.m. Now you're telling me that the room was prepared within 15 minutes? They never prepared the room for three people even though three people were clearly staying in the room. So we never had three waters, three towels, three robes, etc. The bright spots of this hotel were the location and the eggs on the breakfast buffet. I would never return to this hotel even at half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: LovesTravel74
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed a long week end at this hotel and we were thoroughly impressed by it. It's a beautifully renovated boutique style hotel. The staff are all quite helpful, knowlegeable and fluent in English. The rooms are clean and elegantly fournished. The location couldn't be better for Central Paris with everything you want to do being within walking distance. The restaurant and bar in the hotel are a bit pricey - you can find plenty of less expensive cafe's very close!

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NautiusMaximus
Reviews.Content: OK, let's be clear about one thing. I liked this hotel. I'll probably stay there again next time I go to Paris. Sure, there were some niggles, but that's true of anywhere you go, and the niggles here were really pretty minor. The location is absolutely fantastic. It's in a very central part of Paris, with plenty of nice places to eat nearby. We were there to see an exhibition at the Louvre, and it really can't be beaten for convenience if you're visiting the Louvre. It's literally only about 1 minute's walk away. I was very impressed with the standard of service. The staff we interacted with were, without exception, extremely friendly, professional, and helpful. I've not always found that in Paris, and this hotel went a long way to restoring my faith in Parisian hospitality. They mostly spoke excellent English, but only did so if I was struggling to communicate in French. I find it quite patronising if someone immediately speaks to me in English, given that my French is good enough to handle most situations, and they didn't do that. But were nonetheless very happy to speak English if required. Not only were the staff clearly well trained and well motivated, but there were also enough of them. We never had to wait longer than was reasonable to get attention. The bedroom was comfortable enough, but rather small. That's probably inevitable in this price range in such a central location. No doubt there are bigger rooms in some of the 5-star hotels in the vicinity, but then you'd have to pay more than twice the price we paid here. The decor was a bit tired, particularly the paintwork on the window frame, which was flaking off and in dire need of replacement. But the room had all the things you expect to find, such as a safe, a minibar, and a TV with some international channels (although disappointingly no BBC World). Breakfast was good, with a wide selection of hot and cold food. It was, however, a tad on the expensive side. If you're on a budget you'd do better to find a local cafe and just have a coffee and croissant at a fraction of the price. However, if you enjoy a hearty cooked breakfast, you won't be disappointed. I made the mistake of ordering tea with my breakfast, fooled into thinking they might understand tea by their selection of different teas on the menu. Wrong. I think it's a fact of life that only us Brits understand how to make tea. Foreigners just don't seem to get it. They don't seem to be able to grasp simple concepts like putting the tea bag into the water (I was served a pot of hot water with a tea bag on the side). I had the coffee the following day, which was much nicer. So, to sum up, I think this hotel represents excellent value. It's not the smartest hotel in Paris, and it's not for those on a tight budget, but I think it's doing a very good job of offering something in between.

Reviews.Title: “Room 101 has nothing on room 105 in the Hotel Du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: LondonLangland
Reviews.Content: Such was the awful night in Room 150 (more on this later) that it's hard to be objective about the hotel in general, but will try. Pleasant and efficient check in, rooms large and attractive decor although looking a little tired and in need of a bit of attention , clean and well-equipped bathrooms. Great location for The Sights of Paris. A downside was the 5 star prices in what is emphatically a 3/4 star hotel. Two Cointreaus and two Whiskys set us back 71 euros, two tiny bottles of evian from the mini bar were 14 euros. Unless you have an inclusive B&B deal, avoid breakfast and go to a local cafe - a serving of coffee, croissants, rolls and jams was 27 euros a head. But all this could be endured if we had been allocated a different room. As we deposited our luggage on arrival I commented to my husband that it sounded as if someone was draining the water out of a gigantic bath. On returning to the room at midnight, we discovered the sound was the noise of the hotel lift scraping up and down the side of our room. This went on for the entire night, rendering sleep impossible - a variation on the Chinese water torture. (In fairness, we were travelling with another couple who were entirely happy with their room, but this was of small comfort when my husband and I spent the next day walking around like zombies). I complained to reception that it was entirely impossible for the management to be unaware of the immensity of the noise and disturbance in the room (and presumably in 250, 350 and so forth). It also seemed to me that the room was probably always allocated to someone staying one night (we were), as I would defy anyone to spend a second night there. Probably the most awful night I have ever spent in a hotel. There are some good reasons for staying in the Hotel du Louvre, but if you are offered any room ending in 50 I would demand another.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchieFrenchie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived in Paris on Christmas Eve morning. When we arrived at the Hotel du Louvre, we were checked in and upon request, were upgraded to a junior suite at NO extra charge. That night my boyfriend proposed to me and on Christmas Day the whole front desk staff cheered for us when we came down from our room. They sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne and macaroons too. Our room was beautiful, it was incredibly spacious: We had two sitting rooms, two bathrooms (the toilet was separate from the shower/ jacquzzi) and we had three floor to ceiling windows looking out onto the streets of Paris. Research led me to believe that all hotel rooms are tiny, but this junior suite was anything but! The housekeeping staff was great and quick to reset our fuse box or bring extra towels... The bar staff poured some of the best drinks we had (though we learned on Jan. 2nd the bar had become a no smoking bar) and recommended some very nice places for my fiance and I to go for the "night life."
