The location of this hotel is amazing. The Louve is literally across the street- there's a secret underground entrance to the Louvre here if you want to miss the lines. From the Louvre, through its courtyard, onto the Place de Concord which meets the Champs Elysees, it's 2.5 miles from the Eiffel Tower, less to the Arc de Triumph; the Opera House sits facing the hotel at the opposite end and just beyond the opera house is the Galleries Lafayette. We took a cab to the Sacre Cour, but walked all the way back to the hotel. It is literally within walking distance from anywhere you want to be! Please don't be fooled, walking distance is still a distance- bring your sneakers! And the side streets are full of surprises. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I certainly recommend it to others! Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PVmomLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: Absolutly loved this hotel! Charming room with a view of the Opera house. We were given special treatment because we were celebrating our 25 anniversary and my 50th birthday! Staff was very accomodating! Great location..can walk to most main sites and if not, the metro is right outside the door! Would definately stay here again! Thank you Hotel du Louvre for making our first trip to Paris special!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: TLD310
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on Eurostar but decided to book it direct to save a few pounds! Emailed the hotel several times with requests and was always promptly replied to . Stayed in a deluxe suite and it was wonderful. Large double aspect room with beautiful furnishings overlooking Louvre and square. The staff are excellent, reception and concierge were very helpful and knowledgeable. Ignore all bad reports our stay was faultless. Breakfast was vast and set you up for the day. Thank you for making our stay in Paris perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great location but tired”
Reviews.Author: leiceterboy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, if you want location then this is it. Right next door to the Louvre surrounded by good quality restaurants and main attractions unfortunately my experience was soured by the fact I found the air conditioning in the room poor and ineffective. Not only this but it is extremely noisy. This then compounded the problem that the rooms on the inside of the hotel, facing the courtyard, are poorly ventilated. If you open your window then you have the noise of the external ventilators whirring all night. Admittedly I am a terrible sleeper when it comes to such noises but I had to change rooms at 1 a.m. as I was covered in sweat (I had turned the aircon off) and couldn't sleep. The next room was slightly better but not ideal. I suspect a room that faces out of the hotel is better but I guess they are more expensive. Overall the hotel decor is a little tired and could do with an update.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, hotel a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the Hotel Du Louvre (part of the Concorde group) is in a great location. As the name suggests, it is near to the famous Louvre museum in a very busy area of Paris with great Metro connections and tourist sites and places to eat and drink (at all price ranges). The other positive is that the staff at the hotel is all efficient, friendly and welcoming. This is true across all departments and levels at the hotel. You are made to feel welcome and looked after. The downside for me is the style and rooms. The hotel is in a beautiful traditional Parisian building on a large open intersection. Inside though the decor is very much stuck in the past, and is very dark and old-fashioned for my tastes. I am sure that many would find it rich and impressive - but I see it as overdone and oppressive! A few months back I was in a few days of meetings in their main meeting hall. This was like being in a chocolate box cover with murals and gold everywhere! The bedrooms are a good size for central Paris but terribly dated. The furniture is old dark wood, with functional beds that are not especially comfortable. The room I was in was a superior room as they had upgraded me when I checked in (kindly!). It did not feel worth the close to 300 Euros it cost. The TV is old style and had a fairly wide number of channels, though for English speakers there were 2 (CNN and BBC Choice). One thing I really appreciated was that wireless internet was in the rooms and meeting rooms for free. This is a great and very welcome thing. More hotels should do this. The breakfast in their Brasserie was a good spread and really good. The staff in there, as with the entire hotel, were really chatty, welcoming and would make a point of recognizing you had been in the day before. An easy but nice feeling! To be honest, while I love the location and the warmth of the staff, I would not hurry back as the rooms are just too dated and oppressive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hotel du Louvre!”
Reviews.Author: ksneddon1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for 2 nights at the start of our honeymoon. Neither of us had been to Paris before, and we were a bit worried about some negative comments on this site. However, when we arrived, we were very happy! The location was superb, you really couldn't be more central. The staff were very friendly, and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was fabulous. The room was huge, and had 2 balconies overlooking the square, which was great! The only downside was that they upgraded us to a smoking room! We didn't notice until that night, as I noticed that the bedlinen smelled of smoke. This really affected my sleep unfortunately, and if I had known it was a smoking floor I would have refused the upgrade. As it was, I didn't feel like I could ask to "downgrade", and couldn't be bothered to either! The hotel also sent us up a lovely bottle of champagne on our first night which was a lovely touch. Breakfast was fine, nothing spectacular but definitely fine. Concierge was very helpful with getting taxis and booking restaurants, etc. All staff were very forgiving of our lack of French! Definitely recommend it to others, and would return if I went back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this Place. It'sFrance. But Moreover it's Paris.”
Reviews.Author: rooster70
Reviews.Content: This one's a gem. I'm totally surprised that other folks don't like it. I sneak in about once every 5 years and it never changes. That's the charm of it. Yes, it's not contemporary, but it's not supposed to be. This is the hotel that Conan Doyle had an evil secret agent holed up in,while Sherlock Holmes tried to figure out whether the old Brit Empire was going to fold due to the secret plans he had stolen--it's that old!!!! I find the whole place a treat. I'm not sure I'm alone either. I seem to be endlessly bumping into famous folks in the lobby. Regretably the most famous thing I ever did was get to Monoprix (its like Wallmart) down the street to get wine without getting run over--no small feat I can tell ya. No doubt it's not trying to be a holiday Inn, but its all the better for it. Parisians (and their hotels) don't really change. It's a love it or loathe it thing. Personally, I love it. Try it out. But remember: don't slap her because she's french, embrace it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended To All”
Reviews.Author: Anderssen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel a few days before Christmas. We were initially a little concerned having read some quite negetive reviews on Tripadvisor just a week or so before. However, we were nothing but satisfied with our stay at the hotel. It was grand, and it's location excellent. The staff were friendly, and always helpful. Their English was also excellent. Despite booking a super saver package, the room itself was spaceous, in good condition, very clean, had fabulous views, a mini balcony, and was serviced twice a day! I look forward to returning on our next trip to Paris. Recommended to all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Brilliant and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Par3Buckinghamshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as the organiser of an event to be held there, the conference room they provided was so small we could not use it and the bedroom they gave me was so small that there was just room to walk around the bed and no more. I paid a corporate rate and it was still very expensive for what was provided. On the positive side the staff are great and they quickly organised a new conference room at another hotel for us to use and offered to change my room on my last night when they were not fully booked. hotel 4/10 staff 10/10 I would not stay there again but it is perfectly placed if you want to visit the Louvre, one minute away!

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Trap Moldy and Crowded”
Reviews.Author: seery1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was moldy, smokey, and overrun with too many tourist. My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights. The service was rude. The bellman never even said a word. The concierge was rude and unhelpful. The room smelled moldy,and smokey. It was suppose to be a non-smoking room. The twin beds were lumpy. The weirdest thing was how the bathroom and tiolet were on opposite sides of the room. When we left the room, the lobby was full of tourist off a bus. They crowded the entrance and made it very uncomfortable. Earlier in the week, we stayed at the Hotel D'Aubusson. It was more expensive, but well worth the cost. Only positive aspect was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Beautiful Facade / AWFUL ROOMS!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBear
Reviews.Content: Recently chose to stay at the Hotel Du Louvre after reading reviews on this site, but was very disappointed. PROS Fantastic location / right next door to the Louvre and central to most of the main tourist areas. Great little restaurants, etc in the area. Beautiful facade and entrance lobby Helpful valet BUT THAT'S WHERE IT ENDS!!! CONS We had booked two rooms and both of them were a disgrace! I can live with extremely cramped spaces (I am used to Europe), but I can't live with dirty spaces!!! Our room in particular was dingy and faded with serious signs of wear and tear. The sixties style orange and red furnishings were in a very poor, grubby state and more suited to a cheap run down bed and breakfast. The wood of the desk / table for the tv was very chipped, warped and heavily stained!!! It was the sort of room that made you reluctant to touch anything and I'm not particularly fussy! My children's room wasn't that much better, albeit slightly bigger. The only good things were the bathrooms which had obviously been redone! When I complained at the state of the rooms and their total dissimilarity to the photos on their website, the girl at the desk did admit that some of the rooms were being renovated. Obviously ours wasn't one of them! On top of all this my ac didn't work and this was summer time so it was desperately needed. I complained three times by phone and after no response (several hours later) ended up having to go down to the front desk. Strangely enough there was another couple there complaining about problems with their ac. Someone was eventually sent to fix it and assured me that it would start working (by which time it was time for bed) and predictably enough.....it didn't!!! After a sweltering night (reluctant to open the windows because of the noise of the traffic) I complained again the next day (only more strongly). They sent someone again who admitted that it wasn't working and that they couldn't fix it!!! I then had to leave to go sight seeing only to return to find that their solution to the ac problem was to install a big, unbearably noisy unit with large wide hoses which had to be extended through the open french windows to get the air from outside. Not only did this take up the little space that I had so I had to clamber over the bed to get to the door, but it didn't solve the problem as the outside heat coming through the open window counteracted any limited cooling effects, plus we now had to contend with no privacy or security (we were on the first floor) as we had to leave the french windows fully open and we also had to deal with the constant roar of the traffic outside as well as the nosie of the unit itself.!!!! Despite lots of complaints, no one at the hotel was prepared to help us as I gather they were fully booked (peak season) and therefore it was our hard luck! They did eventually (on our last day) send two technicians to fix our ac and it took them an hour and a half to do so, but it was too late as it was our last day. I don't know if we were just unlucky as no doubt the hotel was full and possibly some of the rooms were better than ours, but I do know that we have stayed at other hotels in Paris and had much better quality and service. DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE BEAUTIFUL FACADE AND GREAT LOCATION!!! Or make sure that you go at a quiet time of year when you may be able to find a better room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: Hate to disagree with all of the rave reviews, but I did not find the hotel tremendous. Stayed at hotel du louvre in mid-August. This was a family trip, and we had 4 rooms. The room my husband and I had was smaller than the others, but it was all right. Two of the rooms were more of an old fashioned French style, two were more contemporary. The bathrooms were modern and pretty good-sized. This hotel seems to cater to large groups/tours. It is run like a large hotel, and does not attempt to offer much in the way of personalized service. One thing I found particularly annoying was that all 4 of our rooms were booked and paid for together and were supposed to all include breakfast. My husband and I changed the number of nights we were staying, and somehow this eliminated our breakfast, despite the fact that the other 3 rooms still had breakfast included. OK, the breakfast is not that great, but it would have cost my husband & I 54 euro (appx. $75 US) per day to eat it. We tried repeatedly to clear this up with the hotel and even had our travel agent call, but the hotel did not budge. I really thought this was poor customer service. We paid for 4 rooms in Paris for a week, and they could not give us the breakfast that we had previously contracted for? It's not like breakfast for 2 was going to actually cost them much in the scheme of things. But it did lose them loads of good will. For those of you who do not get breakfast included, the cafe st. honore down the street offers a lovely breakfast menu for a fraction of the cost (ex: omelet, salad and baguette for 8 euro). The comedien cafe around the corner is not as good, but it is also much less (continental breakfast for 9 euro). The hotel location is right across from the Louvre Museum. This location is very touristy and not very quaint. There are vender stands everywhere. My family chose to stay on the right bank, but I prefer to stay on the left bank, which offers a little more Parisian charm and better restaurant options. The hotel is all right, but I would not recommend it when there are so many other more charming options available in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozi_Traveller31
Reviews.Content: After staying at a dodgy hotel in London, my wife and I were anxious about what we would find in Paris. We were pleasantly surprised by this lovely hotel which had all the ingredients of a great hotel……top location, great rooms (our marble clad bathroom alone was bigger than our entire hotel room in London), fantastic reception staff and all at the right price. I know where I will be staying on my next trip to Paris! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Louvre is the Center of Attention in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMcGowen
Reviews.Content: Located in the center of Paris, this hotel is great! Across the street from the Louvre (hint: back door entrance has no lines to access the museum), and down the street from L'Opera, and the retail mecca of Galeries Lafayette, and the best hot dog in town at Harry's New York Bar (where the bloody mary was invented!). And there are 3 metro stations right there. Its a well-lit safe area, even for women travellers. The hotel itself is grand and luxurious... with a large, dark, velvety, sexy bar to sit and have a smoke and a cognac after a long day of shopping and visting the museums. The standard rooms are big, but not huge. Ask for an upgrade. The bathrooms are large with tub and double basins. The exterior rooms have great views but the interior rooms are quiet. But the best part of the Hotel Du Louvre is the breakfast buffet! This is no continental petite lite fair, mais non! This is where you load up on carbs and protein for your long day of shopping and sight-seeing! The best french toast I've ever had! It was thick, and rich.... and the scrambled eggs were creamy and rich.... an assortment of deli meats ... fresh squeezed orange juice... and the breads and patisseries make my mouth water just thinking about it! The concierge staff is friendly and helpful. Overall, a great place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: saratoga4
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in 2 rooms at the Hotel Du Louvre with our two children in July (age 14 and 11), and we would recommend this hotel highly to American tourists, including families. Service was very good, everyone spoke English, the rooms were nice, with high-quality amenities (beds, linens, towels, free internet access), and the location cannot be beat. The hotel is literally next door to the Louvre and walking distance to many of the attractions in Paris. Service was exceptional from everyone, from the front desk clerk to the housekeepers and the concierge. The concierge was very busy, so one might have to wait a few minutes while he helped another guest, but he went out of his way to assist everyone. The rooms were small (very typical of Europe), but very nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable, the air conditioning worked well (sometimes a problem in Europe), and there was adequate storage in the dresser and closet. We had the breakfast buffet one day, which was a bit expensive considering we only had yogurt and coffee. There was a Starbucks about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, as well as many small cafes nearby. Since we were in Europe for almost 3 weeks, the concierge directed us to a nice laundromat and a dry cleaner which were walking distance from the hotel. This was great considering the hotel charged about $14 to launder a shirt. The fitness center was below our expectations. It only had one treadmill, one bike, and one weight machine, and there was often a wait for the equipment. I used a nearby Club Med gym two blocks away that the concierge directed me to. This was a full service gym, which met my needs, but it cost more than $35 per day. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay !”
Reviews.Author: WTP73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance of a lot of major tourist attractions. The Louvre is about a 3 minute walk. Rue de Rivoli is also right near the hotel. I believe a few tour companies have their meeting points on Rue de Rivoli. I was only in Paris for 3 days so having a hotel in a great location and easy metro access made all the difference in being able to see a lot of the city. The hotel itself is not very fancy, but I think it would be considered a 4 star in North America. Other highlights or comments. 1. I stayed in a Junior suite. The room was spacious and clean. The decor is very European. 2. A metro stop with access to two Metro lines (#1 and #7) is located right near the hotel. The easiest way to enter is through the station stairway entrances in the open square right behind the hotel (about a 1-2 minute walk without crossing any streets). The name of the metro stop is Palais Royal/ Musee du Louvre. 3. I found that every person I encountered at the hotel was able to speak english - which was unexpected. All the hotel staff I dealt with were very polite and accommodating. 4. The hotel restaurant was only open for buffet breakfast. The sign listed the reason for lunch and dinner closures, but I did not pay too much attention. The buffet breakfast was 27 euros. 5. The hotel is located on a busy street. The room windows block out a significant amount of traffic noise, but you can still hear some of the traffic. Neither myself or my travelling companion had any trouble sleeping and even while we were awake I would not describe the noise as distracting. But based on the room I stayed in, which faced on to the road, I would not call the hotel quiet. But even having said that, I will stay at this hotel again and even in the same room, if I ever return to Paris. 6. I had read some of the other comments on this site about this hotel and a couple of people who had a bad experience with this hotel seemed to have booked through major travel website (ie Expedia, Travelocity etc....). So I decided to book directly on the hotel's website and I had no issues with this hotel. I do not actually know if matters which way you book your room, but I wanted to avoid the bad experience others had. 7. Check in time was 2 or 3 pm (sorry, I can't remember the exact time as we left our bags and went exploring) and check out time is noon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: geo007
Reviews.Content: After searching this site,booked a 1 week stay with a Virtuoso Travel Agent,that gave us daily breakfast,upgrade to the next room category,welcome fruits and wine,as a celebration of the relationship with my significant other. Arrived in the hotel 17hs15.At check in,my upgrade "was not in the sistem".After some time,the management resolved the situation and gave us the upgrade to a junior suite on the 1st floor(suite 121).Room size is 48,6 sq meters.Separate toilet,tub and shower,amenities Annick Goutal,CD player Bose. Breakfast normal untill 10hs00. Room very noisy,despite double "soundproof"windows. Manager assistant solved 1 serious problem,but only next day. Assistant Concierge M.Bourguignon helped us with reservations in very good restaurants,and even at Alain Ducasse. Besides that serious problem,very nice stay at 350 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved this hotel! It was just what I was looking for.”
Reviews.Author: dallasdoodle
Reviews.Content: This was not my first choice of hotels for our trip and we had planned to change hotels mid-way through our vacation, but after our experience I was sad to leave. The location was excellent! Of course, very close to the Louvre and just down the street from the Opera, Cafe Au Paix and 2 blocks from the Seine and a stop for the bateaux. I was looking for a hotel with European elegance and this was right there with the wallpaper, moldings, sconces, etc. We could see the Opera from our room and the rest of the surrounding buildings have very beautiful architecture. I was worried the bathroom would be small, but it was very usable and clean and larger than I expected. The concierge helped us with reservations and some excursions and we were very pleased with his warmth. It was also very convenient, as there is a taxi stand right at the same corner. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jumpingmonkey
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through expedia for our honeymoon and couldn't have hoped for a better location. The hotel is beautiful to look at and comfortable and relaxed. The staff made our arrival even more special by leaving a complimentary bottle of champagne and truffles in our room. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a hotel that is close to everything in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 33map
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely staff, adequate space in the room and very generous breakfasts. My only complaint was that the air conditioner was not adequate and if you open the windows there's a lot of street noise. Eventually they supplied us with a window cooling unit which made a huge difference. I would stay there again if on business otherwise I prefer the left bank, EF

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything but the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: vintagefilmlover
Reviews.Content: Like the others reviews say the location is awesome! The hotel was very nice and the staff was great. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was TERRIBLE. It's not that the food was bad the service was just awful. Also stay away from Cityrama for a dinner cruise. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGal99
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Paris trip. 4 nights at the Hotel du Louvre in a plain room on the 3rd floor facing the Louvre. It wasn't noisy at all because of a double window/soundproofing. The room was large (by Paris or NYC standards) but probably small for anyone expecting a typical US sized room. The bathroom was very nice (white marble) with fluffy robes. I wish they used a bit more bleach on the wall tiles, but it's wasn't bad enough that I was skeeved out (and that is easy to do). We used the concierge to make reservations for a dinner and they were very helpful. The business center is nice and always available. Listening to other reviews, we ate breakfast elsewhere. There is a restaurant just outside the doors of the hotel that serves a fine petite dejeurner (sp?) for 9 euro and add eggs for an extra 2 - compared to 32 euro for their breakfast. The location was great. We took the metro or walked everywhere without any trouble. I highly recommend the all day metro pass because it costs less than 4 tickets and you're sure to do that on any day you're not in the Louvre. We booked through Expedia but paid $2000 for 2 tickets from NYC and 4 nights. I figure we paid about $225 a night and I think we got more than our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roadmap40
Reviews.Content: After booking my room because of it's rating and it's location, I had stumbled upon this website and read two bad reviews. Naturally, I was concerned, perhaps even scared of what I was to find. On my trip during the week of May 6, 2007, I found this hotel to be charming and indeed a four star hotel. The rooms are not spacious by American standards, but they are typically European, adequate and well appointed. The bathroom could have used a bit more space. The hotel was extremely clean and, when engaged, the staff is cheerful and friendly. The hotel bar is elegant and charming and the wait staff is warm and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TMD50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from April 24-29. We originally booked 2 rooms from the 24th - 27th. They had an Easter special still running so the rooms rates were quite good (250 Euro's). The rooms were spacious enough and well kept. The towels and other bath items were of high quality. So we don't understand the comments of some others regarding very small rooms and run-downed furnishings or accessories. We are not big breakfast eaters so the included breakfast buffet was more than adequate. What's really special about this hotel is how they helped us out in a jam. One of our party became very ill on April 26. She had to be taken to a hospital. We were originally scheduled to check out on April 27 but the doctor said the soonest our companion would be discharged was Sunday. Paris had gorgeous weather that week and the hotel desk said they were going to be completely full that weekend. They were, but somehow they found us other rooms in the hotel for Friday and Sat night and those rooms were just as comfortable as our previous ones. The upcharge for the weekend and non-Easter special rate was only 50 Euro's. Of course one might say that this was the only decent thing they could do given the circumstances or that hotels always say they are full but they always have extra just in case rooms set aside. However we all have many more stories about places that didn't help us out in a jam or charged us some incredible penalty. The management and concierges of this hotel were simply very human and wonderful and we will remember their kindness forever. TD

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Du Louvre nice but not the price”
Reviews.Author: sandrene
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently (April 07) .Lovely Parisian style hotel. Very near the Louvre and many other attractions. The hotel was clean nicely decorated. Our room was listed as a superior room was quite small , bathroom large. Service from the main desk to the maids was wonderful. Most spoke english. the Breakfst Buffet was terrific and plentiful, gave us a great start to each day! We ate our last night in the brasserie there outside at a little table ,ordered the fixed price menu. Very nice. Something magical about Paris I will never forget. Romantic! The only thing negative was our room , the decor was old and kind of shabby, not as portrayed in the pictures of a superior room. We were also facing another building with no view. The bed was a queen and I could have used a new mattress. Yet since I have never stayed in Paris before maybe this is what is to be expected. We did pay 350 euro p/night which is quite expensive.(breakfast included)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KAALSB13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel in July. The only positive thing about this enterprise is a wonderful, unbelievable location. The Louvre is literally in your backyard. Well, this is where the awe ends. The rooms are small, run-down, and just plain uninviting. This hotel needs some major renovations. The only ray of bright light was our maid . She was from Africa and she was a wonderful lady, very kind. Like I said before, location - A++++. Hotel - C----.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Tshark
Reviews.Content: (UPDATING FROM A PREVIOUS PROFILE) We spent a week in the hotel in April 2005. I had sent an e-mail in advance, indicating that it was my daughter's 9th birthday and her first trip to Paris. The hotel upgraded us to a quiet, deluxe room and made sure that there was a welcoming gift for my daughter waiting in the room when we checked in. Then on her birthday they sent up a large tray of desserts and sweets for her, as well as a personal note from the general manager. The entire staff was friendly, knowledgeable, personable and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: mycMarietta
Reviews.Content: April 7, 2007: We just returned from a week in Paris -we stayed at the Hotel du Louvre and it was a wonderful experience! We were first told that our room would be on the first floor (actually known as the second floor) and I asked if we could be on a higher floor. We were put on the fifth floor-great because the traffic noise can be loud. The room was rather plain in decor and the bed was a queen rather than a king, but the bathroom was large-almost as large as our room. We had two small balconies that faced the Louvre. It was rather warm in the room at night, so it was great to be able to open these balcony doors! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a problem when we didn't receive an early wake up call for a day trip. Luckily, we woke up on our own and was ready when the minivan came to the hotel. The manager and the young lady who was responsible (and perhaps new on the job) apologized. When we returned to our room that evening, there was a bottle of wine and two glasses for us--very nice gesture! The location was fantastic-we could walk to many of the sights and there were many cafes around. The hotel has quite a presence and at night it is beautifully lit up. We spent alittle more than we wanted on the room, but it was worth it!! How often do you go to Paris?!

Reviews.Title: “Good location/family”
Reviews.Author: ferdia35
Reviews.Content: The hotel had been in the middle of renovation when we had stayed here, but it didn't affect our trip. Manager (can't remember her name) had left presents for the kids. Hotel (from memory) is the oldest in Paris, although I could stand to be corrected. We stayed in two interconnecting rooms. Strength in this hotel is its location. You are truly in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: uncgena
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early February. Room was ready for check-in early, around 10:30; in the meantime, they accomodated us in the dining room, which serves an amazing breakfast that was included in our package. Room was tidy, linens and pillows of high quality. Bathroom was quite impressive for a European hotel, towels plentiful. Room service and concierge were prompt and helpful. I would recommend doing some research on restaurants, as concierge's suggestions were a bit touristy. My only complaint is that our room got extremely hot at night. However, our stay was extremely comfortable, and I would recommend this hotel to friends (for the location, especially--hard to beat!).

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JKNY329
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked for a business trip for 3 nights at 289 Euro a night. Upon arrival at hotel around 9:30 am we were told our room was unavailable due to the early hour. We understood and they took our bags and we asked when it would be ready. The friendly desk clerk suggested around noon. We came back after 12:30 but were told the room was still not ready and to try back in 30 minutes. Came back at 1:45 pm very much wanting to shower and were told that the room was still not ready. We balked and the now different desk agent called housekeeping and apparently there was an internal error as the room was ready for release. We were given a room on the first floor which was very disappointing. The king size room was VERY small. There was no room to put two regular sized luggages and still walk. I understand rooms are smaller in Europe but at this price point, one expects a reasonably larger room. However, far more disconcerting was the shabbiness of the furnishings. All the furniture was significantly chipped, scraped, etc and also covered with tacky glass coverings more reminiscent of a banquet hall than a 4 star hotel. We were aware that the hotel was full so we immediately called the front desk to request a new room for the next day. The next morning we were transferred to a room on the fourth floor which was significantly larger and in somewhat better condition. It also had two sinks in the bathroom which was a plus. However, the lack of a shower curtain or doors was annoying. Guests make due instead with a partial glass screen that pivots out of the way to enable access to the tub. It was definitely cramped in the bathroom. One plus with both rooms though was windows that opened into half-balconies, permitting fresh air. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. I have to believe that at this price, better options exist in Paris. I do admit that the location is terrific as the location is central to all the city has to offer, including close proximity to the Louvre museum as well as the Musee d'Orsay. If you do wind up staying, make sure to request a room change if the first room is unsatisfactory. We are most glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: jditta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Du Louvre for 4 nights. We loved the hotel. We stayed in a Jr. Suite. The room was nice size for a European room. The staff was extremely friendly and all spoke English. Breakfast was good too. A nice buffet with eggs, french toast, pastries, cheeses, meats, etc. Breakfast was included in our rate. The location is absolutely perfect. Right in the middle of everything. You are literally across the street from the Louvre (a minutes walk). The Opera is right up the street (you look out at it as you exit the hotel). Shopping is all around you...Champs Elysees is a bit of a walk, but Concord Square (Hermes, Cartier, etc.) is just up to the left of the Opera and all the jewelry stores are close by. There is a metro station just outside the hotel too. Great restaurant recommendations. Would definitely go back. One word of warning. If you need a taxi for 4 people, plan ahead. The drivers don't like to take more than 2 people. Hire a driver to get you to the airport. We waited 30 minutes trying to find a big enough taxi for 4 and luggage. We finally split up.

Reviews.Title: “Average .... for the price, not a great value”
Reviews.Author: NDcouple
Reviews.Content: Room was quite spacious and comfortable and our window overlooked the Palais Royale. Location was great. The service was acceptable and we had a wonderful stay in Paris. Stayed 5 nights at this hotel, then went to normandy for 4 days and then returned to Paris for an overnight at Hotel Rive Gauche IV (prior to flying home) which was just as nice (rooms a little smaller) and less than half the price than the Hotel du Louvre. When we come back to Paris, we'll stay elsewhere, most likely.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific again”
Reviews.Author: Kleedaddy
Reviews.Content: Posted a review about a year ago on this hotel and I wanted to follow it up with another excellent review of the hotel. This is the 3rd time we have been to this hotel and the 3rd time we have stayed at a Junior Suite. Excellent location, service and staff. Nice hotels can be costly in Paris, but if you are looking for a nice hotel in a great location I would recommend the Junior Suites at this hotel. It is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “French Charm”
Reviews.Author: Gunter1
Reviews.Content: I was whisked away as a a birthday surprise on the oh so easy eurostar. The hotel is situated in a wonderful location and full of old world French charm, our room overlooked the square and was well furnished with a very nice bathroom. The bar staff are attentive, though it does get pretty smoky and it's not cheap. I was treated to a champagne breakfast on the day and a trip to see the Moulin Rouge, an amazing show but a word to the wise, eat somewhere else beforehand, the food is awful, mass cooked and gave my wife food poisoning. Elsewhere the food is to die for, L'Imperial on the Rue Ravioli is extremely good but again it will cost you. If you're eating out anywhere good on a Sat night then book as we found out. If you go to the Sacre-Cour be aware of the idiots putting bracelets on your arm and then trying to charge you but ignoring them seems to work. French culture lives on, fine wine, good food, top entertainment and shamefully their English is considerably better than our French.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fish-T
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through American Airlines and were worried after reading reviews posted on this site. Our worries, however, were unfounded. Our room #211 was spacious, quiet, comfortable, and recently remodeled. It faced the square and was on a non-smoking floor. The full American breakfast buffet was great and there was a large selection of items to choose from each morning. The staff was extremely helpful from front desk to restaurant staff, barmen and porters and the Concierge staff was exemplary in booking tours and giving us local information - and all were well versed in English. One could not have a better location, directly across the street from the Musee du Louvre adjacent to the Palais Royal Metro Station, and close to the best shopping on Rue Saint-Honore and Rue de Rivoli.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Melicity
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money, though very centrally and conveniently located. The staff is very friendly and nice, but actually getting service is another idea completely. We had to make multiple requests for the same things on multiple occasions, and usually ended up having to take matters into our own hands in the end if we wanted things to get done (and the hotel is too expensive to have to do that, frankly). We travelled for business (mostly) and the business center and internet connection are sorely lacking - the only wifi is in the super-smoky bar area and the business center itself is small and does not offer much. But I adored the restaurant staff and the bellmen - very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I know Paris is expensive but....”
Reviews.Author: rider2
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money or points. I dithered too long on Paris hotel choices with AMX points and was left with only a couple of hotels. We have been to Paris at least a dozen times or more and this was the most disappointing hotel we have stayed at while there. Our deluxe room was going for 500 euros a night and the hotel was full the 3 nights we were there - the clientel looked like a mix of tour groups and indipendant travelers, with lots of English speakers. Pros: It is a good location, but really any place in the city near a metro would be good. The staff speaks excellent english, and I love the Annick Goutal toiletries the Concord Hotels use. Cons: There are a bunch. Traffic noise and fumes are really pretty bad. Traffic noise is not too bad with the windows closed but then you will need to rely on the AC. It was warmer than normal when we were there in October, and our room was hot and stuffy. The front desk explained that because we were between seasons, the air conditioning had been turned off. We couldn't open the windows at night because of the traffic noise and bus fumes. We were promised a fan (twice) but it never arrived. I begged for an interior courtyard room, but was told it was not possible. The carpet was filthy and there were red wine stains on the wallpaper. This may not seem like a big thing but there was no place in the bathroom for me to do my hair or makeup. There were 3 places to plug in a shaver in the bathroom, but no place for any hair appliances. The makeup mirror and hair dryer were in a far corner of the bathroom - with no place to set anything other than the toilet, and the only place to plug in my curling iron was next to the front door, again with no place to set anything. There was no refrigerator in the room, the mini bar was warm and we had to call room service for ice. I know this is France, but this hotel caters to an awfull lot of ice loving customers. Anyway, now I sound like I'm whining, but I guess the bottom line is, I could ignore all of this stuff in a 150-200 Euro/night room but at these prices I would expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LvnLaugh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Sept. 21-24, 2006 . We took an airport transfer van (14 euros/person) for the trip in. The hotel is ideally located right next to the museum and within walking distance of virtually everywhere...the left bank is just over the bridge, there are several good bistros right across the street (Cafe Ruc) Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower can be done with a bit of effort while walking!! The lounge/bar area is great for free internet wireless access (although not always working). On the downside, the rooms are TINY, the beds uncomfortable as well as the pillows, and the hot water on our first morning took 15 minutes to warm up. On the plus side, The housekeeping staff was very efficient and so was the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck Yuck Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: cocoajean
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed one night at the Hotel du Louvre on our way back from a nice trip to Switzerland. We were in room 139 (first floor) for which we paid $404 Euros! The room was small, the carpet was stained in many places, the "desk" was beat up and chipped (not shabby chic, just shabby) and best of all there were numerous bugs squashed on the wall--mostly above the bed! Disgusting in every way! The room was stuffy and the AC did not work. When we opened the large window, the noise from the street below was absolutely deafening. But, this was the only way to breathe in the stuffy room so we had to keep the windows open (probably why the bugs were in the room in the first place!) Yes, we looked across to the Louvre and it was the only saving grace. At first glance we thought at least the bathroom was clean, but once we opened our eyes we saw tiles without grout, cracks and more squashed bugs on the floor. We decided to rename the place Hotel du Bug and spent all of our time out of there. We were leaving for the airport early the next morning and were too tired to stop and complain and ask for a room change. Stunningly, when we checked out an American couple in front of us were telling the front desk how lovely their visit was and they'd be back soon. Yikes--no thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: schamber
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. Next to the Louvre and the metro station. Our room was a good size. The electricity went out several times but it was at times we didn't need it and we would tell them on our way out and it was fixed by the time we got back. The few times we asked questions downstairs we had good service. We did not eat in the hotel as we had heard how expensive it was. There were lots of cafes and restaurants in the area. On the first night smoke came into our non-smoking room during the middle of the night. We had the windows closed so it wasn't coming from outside. We should have complained but didn't. We had the door to the entryway closed and that's where the air return was so we opened the door the rest of the nights and didn't have the smoke problem. During the night some times I would hear what sounded like a train underneath me. Don't know if it was the metro or carts going down the halls. We were on floor two above lobby and service floor? My husband was able to sleep right through it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous suite and location”
Reviews.Author: GypsyPhyllis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and were very impressed. The suite has a separate bedroom, dressing room, lots of storage space, and a fabulous, huge bath, plus a powder room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Situated across from the Louve, it is also next to the Metro, and has numerous cafes nearby as well as one in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to europe”
Reviews.Author: knowlzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed our first night in Europe on our Honeymoon. Great location, with attractions, beautiful buildings, nice cafes, Rivoli shopping district and metro station all within a couple of blocks. Go across the street to the Ruc cafe and have the Onion Gratin soup! No seriously, do it. Room was old school elegant but not overwhelming. This was a grand hotel at one time and has a great location...but a litle pricey for what you get

Reviews.Title: “4 star location, 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: Burnfin
Reviews.Content: I have travled on business for several years and know what to expect from different levels of hotels. My wife and I recently took our honeymoon in London and then on to Paris. The Chesterfield Mayfair was an amazing hotel in Mayfair that I can't praise enough in every category but that will be on their review from me. Then we took the Eurostar to Paris where we checked into the Hotel Du Louvre. It is literally across the street from the Louvre. The first night I thought that the room was a little stuffy and I cranked the air down all the way. The next morning it was no cooler in the room, it was actually cooler outside. The room was very nice and spacious so we cracked our french doors open for a little breeze. Paying @€350 a night I should not have had to do this and later that day I went down to the front desk to address this problem. I spoke to a gentleman, well, a staffmember named Sebastian. He quickly explained to me that hotels in all of Europe didn't get as cool as hotel rooms in the US and that 20C. was as good as it would get and there was nothing more they could do, and good day! I found this odd considering that at the Chesterfield Mayfair, my room was a chilly 16C. the whole time we were there. I went back to the room dissapointed and later as we left, I complained that our room was hot to the housekeeping staff that was working on our floor. They barely understood English and my broken French but amazingly when we returned back that night, there was an auxillary air conditioning unit that had been placed in the room, I'm sure becuase of them, and the room was nice and cool. I will try to keep this short. We had prepaid €22 per person per day for the deluxe breakfast. You would be asked if you want coffee on the way in, they would bring it to the table, and that would be the last you would see of your server. Then at the buffet style breakfast, the would run out of everything. I can understand running out of eggs or bacon now and then but the giant container of orange juice would almost always be empty, then they would come out and pour in the equivelant of a large cup in and it would be gone after the next two people got their glasses. The electricity went out in our room twice in two days. The second day I had had about enough. One of the staff members came up, a young man in a suit and tie. As we sat on the foot of the bed in the dark, he climbed a ladder near the front door and began to push up and ceiling panel to look for the problem, he said it could take a while and that maybe we would like to go wait in the hall. AT THIS POINT I LOST IT!!! I let him know that my stay here to this point had not been very pleasant and that for the money I was paying this was rediculous. Several choice words followed and I said that if he had any clue of how to satisfy customers he would have us go down to the hotel bar for a drink on the house. At that moment a very, very small lightbulb when of inside his thick skull and as his voice cracked he said, "We'll if that would make you happy?" I grabbed my wife and stormed out of the room. At this point I was on a roll and stopped by the front desk to give them a few more reasons to dislike Americans. I let them know about the experience as a whole, and especially about the restaurant. She said that they would take care of the breakfast situation, especially fresh coffee. Funny that from here on out our stay had a different, more attentive feel to it. We had our free drink and the next day when we came back to the room in the evening there was a small bottle of wine and pastries. Definetely a step in the right direction. For the rest of the week not one day was the coffee refilled. If I walked into this restaurant from of the street and paid the kind of money they request for the food and received the service I did, I would walk out. If you have any specific questions about this hotel, please e-mail me at: thefin10@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, flaky around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Diggadave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for the weekend at the start of July. The hotel is in an excellent location for sight seeing, shopping, museums, etc, and access to public transport is good (plus there were also always taxis at the rank across the street). My over all impression of this hotel was of 'old money' gone to seed: The decor was in need of touching up; The bathroom needed a refurb; The a/c cooled the entrance hall to our room (as you pass the bathroom), but barely touched the bedroom (it was +30C while we there in Paris). Our double room (good size) also lacked extra pillows, and the bed was that old favourite of two singles roped together. Versatile for the hotel, uncomfortable for the guest. It all spoke of a hotel at the end of a long period of use, in need of a refurbishment. In it's defence, I understand that some of the rooms have been refurbished this year, and are very nice, but the side / floor we stayed on was still on the waiting list. The public areas were clean and the staff were friendly. The food (at least at breakfast) was fine, with a good selection of hot & cold foods. Although the restuarant had plenty of staff they lacked direction and it took too long to get service (even just some coffee!) The bar was If it is location you want then this is fine, if over priced. For me, when they have fully refurbished the hotel I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teaveling-Kate
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler and have been to Paris many times. I booked three twin rooms because I was bringing first time visitors to Paris and the location is great. The hotel was very dirty, very very hot (the ac was barely working) the restaurant was closed for repairs, the staff was nonexistant and not very helpful. We only had one pillow for each bed and were told that the hotel had no more pillows available! I will not stay there again. Love Paris, hated this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tfaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Louvre mid June 2006 for 9 days. We stayed in a Superior Suite. Overall, it was a great experience. The location can't be beat. The hotel is very centralized and close to most of the major attractions. The hotel staff were very helpful. Everyone spoke english, which helped alot. The service was prompt. I have only been to Paris once and have only stayed at the Hotel du Louvre, so I don't have much to compare it to; but for the price (which is pretty up there) I expected the rooms to be a little more....luxurious, I suppose. I was a bit surprised that it wasn't a little more "done up", if you will. But like I said, I don't have much to compare it to. The bathroom was a great size. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location! June 1-5”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLLB
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from this hotel after a 4 night stay the first days of June (yes, I am still a bit jet lagged). This was an excellent hotel with a spacious room and quality amenities. The local boulangerie for fresh morning baguettes and croissants was three blocks one way. The local supermarket (Monoprix) was three blocks towards the Opera house, and the convenience store was one block the opposite way to the bakery. But the highlight is the central location and ease to get anywhere. Walk to the Seine, the Louvre, Notre Dame, Tuileries, or Metro to Versailles or any other destination was quick and efficient. The hotel staff were attentive and helpful. Their suggestions were very good for dining. Do note that Paris shuts down on Sunday, except museums for any shopping you may be thinking of doing. We enjoyed an open air market north of Mont Martre, but it would have been better in town. Restaurants tend to open up at 7:30PM for dinner (hard on little ones) but brasseries can accommodate earlier eating. This was my third time to Paris and each time I feel as though I have just scratched the surface. The Museum pass was a worthwhile investment. It saved me a 2 hr wait at the Musee De L'Orangerie. Phew! It was also good for Versailles as well. Paris trips always end too short, but I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. It has all you can ask for!! Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad thing to say about the hotel. My husband and I stayed there in September 2005 for four nights. We had a room that looked inside of the Louvre, which was very cool. I wasn't sure I was going to like the location when we booked it, but I ended up loving it. Everything was close. It was easy to get to the metro and sighting tour buses, if you're into that. If you plan on spending time at the Louvre, this is the perfect hotel. It's easy to beat the crowds and lines. I would definitely go back and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and next to Metro station”
Reviews.Author: AprilHolidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 13 to 17 April, 2006. Got a good price from kayak. We enjoyed the hotel very much and the location is fabulous - next to Louvre museum,Palais Royal, and walking distance to many attractions and the Metro is just outside the hotel. We arrived at 8 am and the hotel let us have an early check-in and upgraded us (a couple and a 13 year old) to a Junior Suite. - no view but a quiet room on the courtyard. The Concierges were very helpful but beware the recommendations. If you want to dine with Americans and older French people and pay $250 for a mediocre meal, then Chez Pauline is the place for you. La Vaudeville is good but Le Dauphin near the hotel was very good, service was great, and the price was better. Cafe Truc across the street from hotel was pretty good for dinner but the hostess was not very nice and seated us next to the door even though the place was half empty and we asked for a table that was in a warmer area (got the feeling that tourists are second class here). Rue de Richelieu near the hotel has small grocery stores to buy wine, soft-drinks, snacks, etc. We would stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: robertlb
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent loaction across the street from the Louvre and the Palais Royale. A metro station also across the street. Everyone at the hotel speaks English. Everyone was very helpful. The rooms are very adequate with excellent bathrooms. You cannot go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lisa73
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 days in Feb 06. The hotel is beautiful and the staff friendly. It is in a central area, the rooms are pretty, the bathroom was really good, all very clean and modern. We had a smoking room, and sometimes these are not as nice as the non smoking, but this didn't seem to be the case at all. The only complaint I could make about the hotel, if pushed, is that they did not have tea or coffee making facilities in the room, but there are shops nearby where we bought fresh juice, which we kept in the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I expected a much larger, more modern hotel based on the description and web site. However, it's actually sort of smallish and not really modern. The floors are carpet over old wood, which makes them a bit unlever and creaky. Anyone stayed at the DelCoranodo in San Diego? It reminds of that place. Anyway, there is no internet in the rooms! I had to "steal" it from Cafe Ruc accross the street. The signal went in and out. The bar downstairs is very cool. Very French and red. The restaurant is GREAT for breakfast. It's buffet (try the french toast) but classy and relaxed. Very good. I was a little surprised at $21 Euros per person for a breakfast buffet, but what the hell, I paid $10 for a coke on the Champs Elysees......France is out of control in the expensive department. Recommendations- easilly walkable to Louvre (duh), Notre Damne and Opera House. There's a Starbucs nearby. Get some snacks at a local shop on Honre......it will save you big $$$. Also, it's 1 1/2 mile walk to Champs Elysees and Arc D'Triomphe. Eiffel Tower is about the same; but, it seems longer. A REALLY good idea is to exit the hotel and turn north (right) on Richeleau. That this about 1/2 mile to MontMarte and turn right. This street has all kinds of action, pubs, cafe's, restaurants (including Hardrock). I found this to be MUCH MUCH better (and closer) than the Champs Elysees!!!! If you go to Hardrock, say high to Matthew (short guy with a Mowhawk). He's a very nice guy and speaks English okay. We visited him most every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveWapping
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a wonderful location. The staff were all very friendly and efficient. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Service, Pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We landed at the hotel at 9:30 am, not expecting to get a room. The people at the front desk were very helpful and told us they'd try to have our room ready by 2 pm, which they did. We'd booked a junior suite and were pleasantly surprised to find that there were actually two separate rooms that could be locked (the floor plan on the web site didn't show it). We have a teenage son, who was delighted to have his own room with a bed and TV (it was actually the living room with a bed). The room faced inwards on to a courtyard. Although we didn't have much of a view the room was quiet. It did tend to get a little warm in the evening, but we would open the windows and it was comfortable. They did have one outlet in the bathroom which is 110V. The shower was funky - you actually had to turn on the water, turn on the handheld shower and then the main shower. Water pressure was OK. One morning there was no hot water. They apologised and sent up a bottle of champagne to make up for it. As others have written it is extremely convenient to musuems, transportation, cafes and shops. The hotel staff are very nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend it and stay at the hotel again. One little tidbit about changing money - I found that you get the best rate when using the ATM to get money out. There's a bank right across from the hotel (the concierge will tell you where to go to withdraw money) and the ATM charges $ 2 per transaction. The rate I got was 82 cents for one euro. If you have dollars which need to be exchanges, go across to a shop on the right (when facing the hotel). They have a rate that's only marginally worse than the ATM (it was 80 cents per euro). The rate at the hotel tends to be much worse (It was 71 cents to a euro)

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: TXMoving_soon
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel du Louvre after early Eurostar train from London at ~1200 h. Our room was not ready yet (which was ok, since their check-in time was not until 1500 h). We checked our bags with the concierge, who then gave us a much better city map than what we had from our guide books and directed us to take a walk along the Seine down to Notre Dame and explore for a while and by the time we got back, the room was ready. While in London our electrical converter got fried, so after we started unpacking in our room we called the concieger to ask if they happened to have a converter to American power and within a couple of minutes an employee had delivered one to our door for our use the next 3 days while we were at the hotel. We booked one of their "Superior" Rooms and were pleased with the quality of the furnishings and view (unlike one earlier reviewer, we had an exterior room with a view onto the plaza, and if we looked right we could see the Louvre from our room). This hotel was great for location. We didn't eat a meal at the hotel since there were so many other places in the nearby vicinity to explore and try. The Cafe across the street had an 8 euro French Breakfast (hot drink, glass of OJ, croissant, and half a toasted bagette) that was perfect for us and much cheaper than the alternative at the hotel. Would stay there again and recommend it to friends and relatives. Also as stated in earlier reviews...helpful concierge service all of whom spoke English, same with front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - Great service, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Gary1227
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Louvre for 8 nights from 1/25/06 through 2/2/06. I got a great promotional rate on the hotel website that included breakfast. The rate required prepayment but at 210 euros a night it was a great bargain for this hotel especially with the daily breakfast. The hotel is located accross the street from The Louvre Museum and the Palace Royal. Since the hotel is so centrally located we were able to walk to many of the major sites. There is also a metro stop right next to the hotel. The hotel itself is nicely decorated in period style. There are 2 elevators, a business center with internet access and a fitness room. There is also free WIFI internet access in the bar area if you bring a laptop (only works in the immediate area of the bar.) The buffet breakfast was delicious and included a complete selection of cereals, yogurt, fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon and even french toast. Nice to have American style drip coffee with breakfast in the morning. There are numerous cafes and resturaunts all around the hotel as well as small convenience stores and pastery shops. Our room was well furnished and larger than most hotel rooms in Paris. The beds were very comfortable and appeared to be relatively new. Our room had a view of the Louvre and Palace Royal as well as an open plaza adjacent to the hotel. The staff spoke perfect English, all were polite and willing to do whatever to make our stay enjoyable. The only minor complaint was that our room was very warm on a few nights and occassionally we got a whiff of cigarette smoke in the room even though we were on a non-smoking floor. Note that the deluxe rooms are larger than the superior rooms and most of the deluxe rooms have views where as the superior rooms face into the inner courtyard. The room itself was very quiet with no street noise with the double glazed windows shut nor did we hear any noise from the hallways or from adjacent rooms. All in all a great hotel in a great location and even better when you can get a promo rate. We will definately stay here again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: LondonParisRomeLover
Reviews.Content: What a terrific base for my week of exploring Paris! Right next to the subway station, so a direct train ride from the hotel saved me an expensive cab ride. Across from the Louvre and easy walking distance from many of the wonderful sites in the center of the city. The subway station takes you anywhere; the clerk in that station is very helpful. The people at the front desk, the concierge and the hotel restaurant all speak excellent English and are always very polite, friendly and helpful. Very elegant facility. Small but beautiful old-world room, nice bathroom. Restaurant is outstanding; the breakfast buffet may seem more expensive than the outdoor cafes but the quality and quantity of the buffet is dazzling. The hotel is surrounded by historic landmarks, public transportation options, bakeries, cafes, restaurants, chocolate shops, bars, perfumeries and designer shops. Felt very safe, but there are numerous warnings about pickpockets throughout the city. In the evening, walk outside and stand in the courtyard of the Louvre, with the pyramid, the Arc and the Eiffel Tower in the distance all lit up.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night trip to Paris was special and the stay at the Hotel du Louvre was excellent. Close to the Metro, the Museums, the Eifel Tower and Notre Dame and the Arch de Triumphe. Snow on Friday, Dec 30th made it even more picturesque. We would come back again in a heartbeat. Great staff and interesting bar.

Reviews.Title: “Paris charm, Louvre location, a Must stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Charming and wonderful. This is what a Paris hotel is all about. We went to Hotel du Louvre for after Xmas for New Year's. The room 261 was exquistite tiny and full of charm. The 10 foot ceilings had two floor to ceiling windows that overlooked the grand boulevard to a glorious view of the Opera garnier. Impeccably decorated in blue wallpaper and curtains with white French provincial furniture. The new, white tiled and stylish bathroom with a huge soaking tub and great Annick Goutal amenities. The non smoking floor was definatly free of smoke and the room was spotless. The front desk staff spoke flawless English and were so helpful in making reservations and getting us in places. The location is not to be believed- you can walk anywhere. Louvre as you fall out of bed- in fact- use the special entrance through the underground Carosuel du Louvre mall and miss the 1/2 hour line snaking outside the Louvre pyramid entrace! Skip hotel breakfast and eat there for cheap coffee and croissant. Near to Notre Dame, Musee D'orsay, and all high end shopping. Do not miss Louvre des Antiquaires- Hermes, Cartier and the New Louis Vuitton store (you will buy anything when they serve you the Vevre Cliquot!) Close to Nicolas wine store (great advice on reds and champagnes) and Monoprix food. The hotel even sent up a bottle of champagne and truffles when they found out it was our honeymoon and my 50 birthday. Close to great restaurants- must try Le vaudelvillle, Metro to Bofinger, Deux maggots. GO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: Padwiz
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel is its unbeatable location - we could see the sculptures in the Louvre from our room! The room was quiet but pretty unremarkable and by no means luxurious. Whereas we'd been given to expect a marble bathroom with double sinks, ours was pretty dated and cramped. However, for £150 a night it was still worth it. Also, the dinner we had in the hotel brasserie was superb, with very friendly waiting staff and a nice relaxing atmosphere. Don't miss an early evening walk in the Palais Royale across the road - it's really beautiful, a real pocket of secluded calm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Thanksgiving Day at Du Louvre”
Reviews.Author: valleyny
Reviews.Content: Our family reserved 2 rooms at the Hotel du Louvre for Thanksgiving Day. We were unexpectedly wished a "Happy Thanksgiving" by the front desk, but our rooms were not ready due to a large party the night before. There was no problem though as the big sites of Paris were within easy walking distance from hotel. Cafes on the nearby street were numerous and far cheaper than hotel prices. Metro was also nearby and a big plus. The hotel was almost attached to the Louvre Museum which brings a host of other good things like galleries, cafes, transportation, and a very safe area. Our rooms were small in comparision to London's Chancery Court which we stayed in next, but they were well decorated, clean and quiet. We overlooked the plaza and street noise was in the other direction. Bathrooms were nice with the largest towels I have ever seen. Our rooms connected which was conveninet to wake up our teens in the morning. We got a second room at 1/2 price using the hotels website and their "special rates" package. Overall it was still pretty expensive, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyagefromClinton
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel November 2005 and while our room was not huge you have to remember Europe is not known for large hotel rooms. The room (202)was comfortable, clean and quiet and as for size...how long are you in your room anyway? Bathroom was huge with double sinks, perfect for two people gettng ready and the staff was extremely helpful and polite. No language problems. More on the bathroom... excellent water pressure and instant hot water, something else I have heard was not the norm for Europe! The location is absolutely perfect, we walked everywhere because the hotel was so centrally located. There is a wonderful sandwich shop up the street past the duty free shop on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: lhusseini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Louvre November 11-14. Perfectly situated near all the things you'd want to do in Paris; directly across from the Louvre, close to shopping on Rue Saint-Honore and Place Vendome, down the street from the Opera House. The hotel is clean and quiet and has an old gentleman’s club feel with the dark wood and carpets in the hallways. Concierge and bellmen were very knowledgeable and absolutely sweet. There is a fantastic café across from the hotel that we also recommend for breakfast – Café Ruc. We spent most of our downtime hanging out there, you can sit outside and people watch, or at night, the place has cool music and a very lounge-y scene and the food is great. We only had two issues with this hotel. I mean, this is typical stuff that if you traveled Europe enough, happens everywhere BUT...First, prior to traveling to Paris, we called the hotel and confirmed early check-in for the morning we arrived; when we got there at 9am on the 11th, we were told we would have to wait until 2pm to check in. When 2pm came, we were told we would have to wait until 3pm. Second, the bedding…mattress and pillows were too soft. My boyfriend came back with a bad back and my neck is still bothering me (three days later). Oh and lastly, take notice of your bill when checking out – they tried to charge us for the continental breakfast they offer (which we didn’t take advantage of) so, we had to point that out to them. To their credit, they were apologetic and took it off our final bill. Other than those little things, would definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms were very nice and clean, staff was attentive and you can’t beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “bad room....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I was spending our honeymoon over there at the end of August 2005. We were packed in a room that 1) Inner door can not be closed. One day, I was waked up at 6:30am because someone was laughing loudly outside. 2) A sink in the bathroom was stucked for a night. I forgot the room number. It was on the first floor that is two level above the entrance. Well, the staffs are professional.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Louvre-Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: maitrega
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from 4 nights at the Hotel du Louvre. We were in Room 281. They have double doors (so it is quiet to the hallway) and double windows (can’t hear the street noise). Great place to relax. There is free wifi in the bar area (the concierge on the other hand didn’t seem to know this). The rooms are Paris small but comfortable, as was the bed. The bathroom had double sinks and a large bath tub. Our view was overlooking the Comedie Francaise courtyard and it was very nice to look at the café and beauty of the place. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aradsc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Paris on 10-12. We were fortunate to stay at the Hotel Du Louvre for 5 nights. Great location!!!! Our experience was one of an excellent hotel with a friendly staff. We found our deal on "Travelocity" and paid a much lower than advertised price. Our room listed for 450 Euros, we paid 275. We had a room on the 5th floor, one of the corner rooms; with 3 opening windows, 2 of which led to small patios. From our bathtub; we could soak, drink wine and watch the Paris traffic go by. We had a view of the Opera, Louvre and the top of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel and hotel room did not smell of smoke like so many other reviewers stated. Maybe they were there when a group of smokers were in the lounge puffing away. Overall, an excellent hotel in the heart of everything. Would stay again and refer to others!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to Tours, Metro, Louvre, Safe”
Reviews.Author: kampswas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one week at the Hotel de louvre. First when you approach it looks exactly like the picture at night beautiful. The rooms inside were perfect for us very comfortable we had to singles put together and never noticed slept well. There is a little balcony the you can step out on with two french doors very nice. The staff all speak English very well, and are very accommodating and exchange money for Euros. Though you can go to any ATM and get money out. There are numerous of restaurants around the Hotel even a very French one husband and wife team located next to the church. The louvre is literally outside your door,latin quarter within walking distance take Rue De bac in very nice walk into Latin Quarter. There were no hidden charges. We even ordered in room service recovering from jet lag and it was perfect meal and try the French fries seriously wow. They offer internet cards 20 euros for an hour a small room on the 2nd floor. As far as other amenities, didn’t bother with them. There is a cafe right outside the entrance to the left of the hotel on the first floor with chairs outside a reasonable breakfast 9 euros for roll, croissant, juice, cafe. There is a restaurant across the street a little rushed but meal was great no French translation though, there are some nice restaraunts in the area sepcialiazing in fish, french quisine and some japanese restaraunts, there is also a Hagan daaz across the street and a little convenience store. We even left our digital camera in the room not locked up and returned after 14 hours and it was still there as well as left some euros on the table and was there when we returned, it was a very safe area never felt uneasy. One thing though do not try the Main restaurant the food was mediocre and service was not very nice, some reviews said noisey we never hear anything other than basic traffic. Though you can exchange at the hotel you can go to any ATM and get money out. There are numerous restaurants around the Hotel even a very French one husband and wife team located next to the church. The louvre is literally outside your door. There are two metro stations outside your door as well. The Main Paris Tourist information is a few streets down near Rue Pyramides. Paris Vision tours and tourama is within a few blocks as well. No hidden charges. Also along champ elysse the obelisk area going toward the arc de triumphe, there are alot of greep stands selling fresh crepes go there perfect afternoon snack either a fromage (cheese) or a Jambon Framage(Ham chees) Big thing we used alot "je voudrais" (jay voodray) translate "I would like" either it is a je voudrais jambon fromage or je voudrais cafe au lait (coffee with cream), anyways it was perfect location I included pictures of the hotel as well. any questions ask.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great location - we walked everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Fotonut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven days on our first trip to Paris. The hotel was wonderful. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the location was wonderful. We walked everywhere. The room was nicely appointed, larger than I was expecting, with a large comfortable bed, desk and small table and chair. It also had a nice sized safe in the room to keep valuables. I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lmgreen
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this hotel. Across the street from the Louvre and around the corner from a metro stop. The deluxe room wasn't large nor well lit at night but it was very clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and the price was reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent several days at the Hotel du Louvre and we were nervous after reading previous web postings about the cigarette smoke odor in the rooms. We requested a room on one of the two non-smoking floors. The room was beautiful with a view of the Louvre outside our window, not a hint of any cigarette odor and a staff that could not do enough to assist with any requests. Frankly, we never were aware of cigarette odor anywhere in the hotel (elevators, restaurant, lobby) so I hope that doesn't stop anyone from booking a room.
