We could find nothing negative about this wonderful hotel and I only wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Louvre by far is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed in; please take my recommendation, I’m a tough sell and I research everything before I proceed. The location is ideal if you are a museum buff, it’s close to a few world class museums. The hotel is steps away from the Metro and bus lines, which is ideal getting around Paris. The hotel is a boutique style and very charming. The concierge staff is in a class by itself. We found them to be extremely helpful with great recommendations. As Americans, they treated us with kind. The hotel staff is friendly, polite and professional. Our room was great and the bathroom was even better. Both rooms had French doors that lead out to a very small balcony overlooking the Louvre Museum (you should call in advance requesting the Louvre side). I recommend the hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in Paris to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We chose this hotel based on it's description and location. Thirty minutes before we were leaving home for the airport, the hotel called to say that they were having "technical difficulties" and needed to move us to another hotel for the first 5 nights. Needless to say, this was not the best way to start our vacation, but they graciously arrranged for us to stay at the Hotel InterContinental, nearby. The Hotel du Louvre paid for our transfer between hotels for our last 2 nights and upgraded us to a junior suite with a bottle of champaign waiting. The room very nicely decorated. The bathroom was very clean and the towels were huge. The staff was very nice and spoke English well. We found this to be the case all over Paris as well as the outlyling areas we visited. My only complaint was the smoke smell in the lobby. We had a non-smoking room and fortunately had no problems with smell or noise from adjacent rooms or floors. The location for both our hotels was perfect. Right next to the Louvre, the gardens, Opera House, easy walk to the Effiel Tower and Notre Dame. Easy access to the metro and RER systems. Definately recommend staying in the 1st district.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: hpliz
Reviews.Content: That sums it up in one word -- the location can't be beat! We were able to walk to Ile de la Cite, the Left Bank and the Champs Elysee. When we needed to venture further, the Palais Royale metro was right outside the door. We had a room on the first floor with 12' ceilings (at least) and it gave the room a feeling of light and spaciousness. The furnishings were gracious and very old-world, much like the rest of the hotel. The bathroom, however, was modern, with double sinks and a separate shower and tub. The breakfast buffet was included in our rate, and it was plentiful enough (with eggs, bacon and sausage and French toast, in addition to cereals, fruits, cold meats and cheeses and pastries) to get us through the afternoon. The staff was very accomodating and friendly ... special kudos to the concierge who recommended some wonderful bistros for dinner. All in all, the Hotel du Louvre is a wonderful hotel for visitors to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Louvre-minus the smoke...”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler05
Reviews.Content: Bonjour! I stayed in Hotel du Louvre for 8 wonderful nights. This was my first trip to Paris, but it will certainly NOT be my last! I absolutely LOVED Paris. As for the hotel, it was nice. This is of course my first experience in Paris so I have no other Hotel to compare the Louvre to. Once inside, we were welcomed with carpet and beautiful furniture. The people at the front desk all spoke english very well and the concierge was extremely helpful. Our room was on the 4th floor. I think we had a junior suite. While the room was small, it met our needs. It was equipped with 2 small twin beds that were pushed together and a small balcony. It had a small fridge in it that we squeezed some of our goodies into. It is cheeper to find a store and buy soda, water and snacks than it is to buy from the cafes that line Rivoli Street. For example, a single serving bottle of water on Rivoli Street cost 2 Euros...in the store, I found a large bottle for .79 euros. Another tip is to exchange money at the airport, they charge only 1.5% commission vs on the street where they charge 15%. I used my ATM for all purchases other than food, taxi, and the metro (subway). If you plan to stay in the district, make sure you have food BEFORE 10pm because everyone shuts down their kitchens and there is nothing left to eat. Location Location Location! Absolutley fabulous! There was a carnival right around the corner from us. The Plaza De Lafayette mall was about a 20 minute walk. The metro was across the street and around the corner. Cafes and little shops line Rue de Rivoli and there is a McDonalds not to far away. The Seines river is a stones throw away, and whenever you need a cab, you can always walk to the circle and just tell the cabbie where you want to go. I am so happy that I decided to go with my freind. On t.v. Paris does not look like fun. The way it is depicted, it seems like it is for old people but I learned first hand that the people of Paris are truley amazing and beautiful. I am a 27 year old single, African American female. We met so many nice guys it was unbelievable....White, Brown and everything in between.....I will never forget those wonderful, smiling faces...It was a blessing to be in a place where I was celebrated, not just tolerated. It was nice to see how everyone got along without the barriers we still face in the states. My freind and I are both tiny but we felt completly safe in our hotel and walking the streets even in the wee hours of the night. The only thing about the hotel/Paris that was annoying was the smell of smoke in the hotel. Also many Parisians do smoke and as a nonsmoker, it's really annoying. But overall the hotel was nice, I would stay again. I am already looking forward to my next visit. It is the most amazing city that I have ever visited. While I was ready to come home and share my experiences, I hated to tell the city that I fell in love with avoir.....

Reviews.Title: “Close Enough to Touch”
Reviews.Author: theullman
Reviews.Content: If you are a history buff looking for a centrally located hotel, and don't mind forking out a few extra dollars, then the Hotel du Louvre is for you. It's the perfect location, if you are planning on spending a lot of time in the Louvre. The hotel is directly across the street--so close, that with good aim, you could hit the museum with a paper airplane! Nearby is shopping, cafes and there's a Metro stop right next to the hotel. You may appreciate that the hotel itself holds a place in history. In 1855, Napoleon III commissioned it for the Universal Exposition. Keep in mind that the rooms are not as plush as one would expect for a hotel in this price range. Yet, they are good-sized (by European standards) and the bathroom towels are some of the largest I've ever seen. It's a unique property, and frankly there aren't many hotels where the bathroom has it's own view of the Louvre! My tips. If you like croissants, don't get them at the hotel, unless of course you prefer a soft "Costco" like croissant. For true Parisian croissants (and excellent hot chocolate) go down the Rue de Rivoli to Angelina. And, if you want to splurge on a meal of a lifetime. Go to Le Grand Vefour, located in the Palais Royal next to the hotel. It is gorgeous and the food is to die for! You can save a few dollars as well if you order the fixed priced meal at lunchtime. Trust me, you won't regret it! RSVP about a month before you arrive and don't forget your coat and tie.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris in August”
Reviews.Author: merrylin88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Du Louvre from Aug 8 though the 16th The first thing we noticed is the beauty of the hotel. Standing on the steps of the entrance you can see Opera House at the end of the street. The lobby was nicely decorated and even had a replica of the Venus De Milo. The staff was wonderful! Everyone from the maids to the concierge were courteous and helpful. The staff at the front desk and at the concierge spoke English extremely well. That helped us out a lot, since our french is terrible. We also took the opportunity to email the hotel through their website to confirm our reservations (we booked through expedia) and requested a room with a view of the Louvre. They always replied to our emails promptly and accomodated all our requests. We booked a deluxe room so I imagine that our room is larger that the standard rooms. Although the room was small compared to American hotels, it did include a stocked mini-fridge--that we loaded with our own goodies--and a balcony. The best thing about this is hotel is LOCATION. Aside from being right across the street from the Louvre, there are also numerous cafes and restaurants withn walking distance. This includes a few of the ones everyone is always talking about, like Cafe Marly and Angelina. If you plan on going anywhere beyond the 1st then you can take the metro which is literally right outside the hotel. There are also a ton of souvenir shops close by on Rue de Rivoli and a few blocks south east on that same street are a bunch of clothing stores like H&M, Zara and Mango. There is even a Monoprix on Opera street where you can buy drinks and snacks. Although we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Du Louvre, there are a few cons that I can't ignore. I know this a debated issue among those who have posted reviews, but the lobby DOES stink of smoke. Being from California, the indoor smoking drove me crazy! I do understand though that this couldn't be helped since there is a bar very close to the lobby. Another downside is the price. If you want fork up the cash to stay at a centrally located hotel then you might want to consider staying here. But I feel that there are a lot of nice hotels that are more affordable outside the 1st. Although very yummy, the restaurants and cafes near the hotel tend to also be expensive. Because of this, I think that when I return to Paris I would probably stay in a hotel in the Left Bank, specifically the Latin Quarter, which I feel would be more suited for a young couple like us. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to travellers whose first priority is location and who do not mind spending the money for it.

Reviews.Title: “Was good enough for my standards”
Reviews.Author: BlondBarbie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last December and found it to be quite enjoyable. I have pretty high standards and can be a really spoiled baby [ upon arriving in Venice and walking in my hotel room I burst out into tears and cried nonstop for 10 minutes because I was so dissapointed with the room....... but this was after flying in from Paris and staying up allllllllllll night at a club in Paris. Needless to say I was in a horrible mood from lack of sleep] ANYWAYS!. The staff was really nice. My room had a fantastic view, of what I don't quite know but it was overlooking a huge empty space where people would kind of mill about in and lots of gorgeous buildings near by. The rooms were clean and bathrooms were very nice too. It was centrally located. Right near the Louvre Museum which was very convenient. The gym was a bit small, but it had a working treadmill in a clean environment, so I was satisfied. Although I got confused as to how many miles I ran since they use the Metric system there. The hotel also has a cozy bar. So all in all I would definately reccemmend this hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for all Romantics”
Reviews.Author: jimmyboyros
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend break at the Hotel Du Lourve and have to say, ignore any negative reviews on this hotel, ok so it may smell of smoke in places, but if you have a non smoking room (we did) then you are fine. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. The rooms well like any city hotel the rooms are quite small, we had a free upgrade to deluxe room and whilst still pretty small, it was bigger than some rooms I have been in, the room again was very clean and the maids done a fantastic job in cleaning our room everyday, and the room had air conditioning and if its hot when your there (it was for us) then this is a god send. But like most hotels there are a few niggles but nothing that ruined our stay. Our fridge didn’t work so everything in the mini bar was warm. The Mini bar prices were far too dear, it worked out £4 for a little jar of peanuts, our view from our window was of other hotel rooms and if you had the window open all you heard was generators going (lucky the room was double glazed) The main selling point of this hotel is its location and boy is it in a good location, you do step out of the front door and into the Lourve, EVERYTHING is close by and you feel so safe walking about which in the present climate is nice. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family, it may be a bit of a dear do, but it’s worth it. Would I stay here again, maybe? I would like to stay in other parts of Paris, as it’s so vast and 3 days is just not enough. This hotel is perfect for all romantics as you’re so close to it, nighttime walks along the River Seine are just so.. oh you have to go to find out

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Louvre, an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: manycruises
Reviews.Content: Before our recent trip, I had read a review of this hotel on your website, complaining about its smoky lobby and poor decor. It said even the non-smoking rooms smelled of smoke. Since my husband has asthma, I was concerned about our reservation there for our pending trip. I am writing to say that we found a delightful, clean hotel with a charming bar (that only smelled smoky when someone was actually smoking). The ventilation system took away the smoke immediately. Our room on the non-smoking floor had only fresh air in it, and though small, was very adequate for our visit. We had a delicious lobster club sandwich one evening in the bar when we did not want a full meal. The hotel is located one block from the Louvre Museum and two blocks from the Seine River, which made it convenient for walks around Paris. It is also two blocks from the Grayline Tour Office for tours around Paris. The breakfasts were all that you could eat, served in a buffet style. The pastries were flaky and delicious. I would choose this hotel again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WJSLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second stay in two years at the Hotel du Louvre.My first stay was on recommendation from a friend. We stayed a year ago in a beautiful junior suite -very spacious and nicely decorated. I found the location to be perfect -there is no need to take metros or taxis-one can walk virtually everywhere. Returning there last weekend we had taken a standard room ( I believe they call it superior) -although somewhat smaller than the junior suite it was perfectly acceptable. The bathroom was spacious and there was a view over the rue de Rivoli. I had informed the hotel in advance that we were there for a special birthday but had not specified that I wanted this marked in a particular way. On arrival however champagne and chocolates awaited us and a nice note from the manager. During our stay this time we used the services of the concierges and found them to be excellent. We also had a room service meal which was very good and nicely presented. The bar staff at the hotel's pleasant bar were also top notch. I also found eating breakfast in the hotel's brasserie much nicer than in some poky breakfast room without windows (which even some large hotels have). Breakfast had a good selection and did not (contrary to some earlier reviews) peter out early. I have recently been diagnosed with asthma ( since my original stay at the Hotel) and was concerned about some of the reviews mentioning smoke but I found no problems at all in any of the public areas, even the Bar. The Hotel is not cheap but I would definitely return- I believe it to be a very good four star indeed.It has a personal feel which is often lacking in chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy service, give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: jontay
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon based on the reviews on this site. We then made reservations for the hotel through Travelocity. When we arrived into Paris (Friday) we went straight to the hotel only for the lady at the front desk telling us that the hotel had electrical problems and weren't accepting any more guests. Rubbish! There was a couple ahead of us who were on the same flight as us, and they managed to get their room. Needless to say we were unimpressed no matter what we told the lady she was adamant that we couldn't stay there and there had been booking made for us at another hotel. So they paid for a taxi to take us to another hotel which was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: NYBob6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May, 2005 for four nights. The room was moderate in size, but adequate. Beds clean. Bathroom immaculate. Concierge assistance was wonderful. Email facility in the hotel, but not as cheap as a cybercafe would have been. We didn't eat in the Hotel. There were abundant small restaurants nearby for breakfast. Very convenient location to subway. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay in Paris with my 16 y.o. daughter. We really enjoyed this hotel. The location was ideal. You are in walking distance to many sites - the Louvre, the Opera Garnier, the Musee D'Orsay, and the Seine are very close. There is also a metro stop less than a block away. The room itself was s/w small, non-smoking, beautifully decorated with a good sized bath (shower/tub). Good heating, lots of hot water. We rarely heard other guests when in our room. The two of us were very comfortable. The common areas of the hotel are also quite nice. I have asthma, but had no difficulty with smoke here. Our entire floor was designated as non-smoking. Found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. The front desk staff and conceirge all speak english and helped us with restaurant reservations, showtimes and transportation to the airport. We always greeted them in French and found that our attempts were much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JMS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights January 2004. Great location, steps from the Louvre, and Metro. Nice views on top floor. Concierge was very helpful. Breakfast buffet was pretty good, and the food was very good at dinner as well. The only negative thing about the hotel was the smell of cigarette smoke throughout the hotel, even in our non-smoking room. By the end of our stay we had become desensitized to the stench, but upon arrival it was almost sickening. This is really just a problem with Europe in general, so I dont blame the Hotel so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned on New Year's Day after spending three nights at this hotel. I found the staff extremely accommodating and friendly and the location was great. We were steps away from all the excitement and the fireworks on New Year's Eve. I read the other reviews before we booked this hotel (through American Express) and did not know what to expect. However, I found our room size was adequate and our room faced the Louvre - not a bad view. As it is in a nosier area of town, ask for a room on an upper floor. The one negative comment I will make is about the bathroom/shower. I was nearly scalded by the hot water and could not adjust the water temperature for several minutes. Not exactly what you want to wake up to.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for the first time over the Christmas holiday. We fell in love with everything about it. The hotel is in a perfect location. We walked everywhere. The room was charming, the staff was both professional and very kind. The food in the restaurant was fabulous. We cannot wait to return and we would want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the view of the Louvre and Palace from our room. The room was pretty roomy and very easy to relax in. The bar downstairs was constantly full of smokers, so we didn't get a chance to enjoy it. The night staff at the desk was extremely friendly and helpful (day staff - not so much). I was surprised at the day staff charging for internet use in the business center. The room service meal we had was delicious! Best bread we had in France! For me the location was unbeatable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: veniceluv
Reviews.Content: Travelling with our 14 month old, my husband I decided to stay in the Deluxe room option, so that our son would have room to crawl around. When we arrived mid morning, we were given a tiny room which had barely enough room for our luggage and travel stroller. Since I had read a previous review regarding a situation like this I knew I had to call the concierge. We were told that this was the room we had booked (Deluxe), but if we waited til later in the day they may have something for us. They did move us to a larger room also a Deluxe but we had to sacrifice a view of the street. This was fine for us since we would rather have a more peaceful room without the traffic to think about. The concierge and staff were very friendly and polite during our stay. I thought that this was a great location but not with a toddler in tow. Even though the museums are close, the markets or little general stores are not. Both my husband and I knew Paris, since we have been there before but neither of us thought that searching for a carton of milk would be so difficult in the area surrounding the hotel. Needless to say we racked up quite the room service bill just for milk! The next time we go back we will have two little one and I think the 6th arrondisment is the way to go with the parks and Bon Marche so close you cant go wrong. But thats just my opinion.
